original: @220b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @220b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: m'a dhy'a ma ka aa ba t'a ra bh'a shu n'a ma /
analyzed: m'a dhy'a ma ka aa ba t'a ra bh'a shu n'a ma /
translated: Madhyamakāvatāra-bhāṣya-nāma

original: bod skad du //
analyzed: bod skad du //
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa zhes bya ba /
translated: Madhyamakāvatāra-bhāṣya-nāma

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.

original: dbu ma'i bstan bcos la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma'i bstan bcos la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to enter the treatise on the middle way,

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa rtsom par 'dod pas /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa rtsom par 'dod pas /
translated: desiring to compose the Madhyamakāvatāra,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams pas kyang thog mar /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams pas kyang thog mar /
translated: first, the perfect buddhas and bodhisattvas

original: bcom ldan 'das snying rje chen po sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang po /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das snying rje chen po sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang po /
translated: praise the Bhagavān's perfect cause for buddhahood, great compassion,

original: sems can 'khor ba'i btson rar bsdams pa skyabs med pa dpag tu med pa ma lus pa yongs su skyob pa'i mtshan nyid can la bstod par 'os pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can 'khor ba'i btson rar bsdams pa skyabs med pa dpag tu med pa ma lus pa yongs su skyob pa'i mtshan nyid can la bstod par 'os pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: which has the characteristic of completely protecting all without exception, the limitless beings imprisoned in the prison of saṃsāra, who are without refuge.

original: nyan thos sangs rgyas 'bring rnams thub dbang skyes //
analyzed: nyan thos sangs rgyas 'bring rnams thub dbang skyes //
translated: The lords of sages are born from buddhas,🔽the buddhas are born from the solitary realizers,🔽and the solitary realizers are born from the hearers.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' las 'khrungs shing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' las 'khrungs shing //
translated: The Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are born from the Bodhisattva.

original: snying rje'i sems dang gnyis su med blo dang // byang chub sems ni rgyal sras rnams kyi rgyu //
analyzed: snying rje'i sems dang gnyis su med blo dang // byang chub sems ni rgyal sras rnams kyi rgyu //
translated: The cause of the Bodhisattvas, the Sons of the Victor, is the Thought of Enlightenment, which is the Thought of Compassion and the Thought of Non-duality.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
translated: Thus two verses.

original: de la gong na med pa'i chos kyi dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa mnga' bas /
analyzed: de la gong na med pa'i chos kyi dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa mnga' bas /
translated: Therein, because of the perfection of sovereignty over the Dharma which is unsurpassed,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams pas kyang dbang phyug dam pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid dang / nyan thos la sogs pa rnams de'i bkas mnga' bsgyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams pas kyang dbang phyug dam pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid dang / nyan thos la sogs pa rnams de'i bkas mnga' bsgyur ba'i phyir /
translated: the perfection of the highest sovereignty over the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Bodhisattvas, and because the Sravakas, etc. are governed by his word,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la thub dbang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la thub dbang zhes bya'o //
translated: the Blessed Buddhas are called “Lords of Sages.”

original: de rnams las nyan thos la sogs pa dag skyes pa ni de dag las bskrun pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams las nyan thos la sogs pa dag skyes pa ni de dag las bskrun pa'o //
translated: They are born from the Bodhisattvas, i.e., they are produced from them.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sangs rgyas rnams byung bar gyur pa na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log pa ston pa la 'jug pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams byung bar gyur pa na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log pa ston pa la 'jug pa'i phyir la /
translated: When the Buddhas appear, they enter into the teaching of the unerring dependent origination.

original: de nyan pa dang sems pa dang sgom pa'i rim pa las kyang lhag par mos pa ji lta ba bzhin nyan thos la sogs pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyan pa dang sems pa dang sgom pa'i rim pa las kyang lhag par mos pa ji lta ba bzhin nyan thos la sogs pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And from listening to, reflecting on, and meditating on that, they complete the path of the śrāvakas, etc., in accordance with their aspiration.

original: gal te yang kha cig gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nye bar bstan pa nyan pa kho na las don dam pa rtogs pa la mkhas su zin kyang mthong ba'i skye ba kho na la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur mod kyi /🔽de lta na yang nye bar ston pa'i sgrub pa po dag gis las rnam par smin par nges pa'i 'bras bu ltar tshe rabs gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yongs @221a * //
analyzed: gal te yang kha cig gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nye bar bstan pa nyan pa kho na las don dam pa rtogs pa la mkhas su zin kyang mthong ba'i skye ba kho na la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur mod kyi / de lta na yang nye bar ston pa'i sgrub pa po dag gis las rnam par smin par nges pa'i 'bras bu ltar tshe rabs gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yongs @221a * //
translated: Even though some may not attain nirvāṇa in this very life by merely listening to the teaching of dependent origination,

original: su smin pa gor ma chag thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: su smin pa gor ma chag thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: nevertheless, the practitioners who teach it will certainly obtain the desired result in other lives, just like the result of karma that is certain to ripen.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa lhas /🔽de nyid shes pas gal te 'dir //🔽mya ngan 'das pa ma thob kyang //
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa lhas / de nyid shes pas gal te 'dir // mya ngan 'das pa ma thob kyang //
translated: As Āryadeva says:🔽If you do not attain nirvana here🔽through knowledge of reality,

original: skye ba gzhan du 'bad med par //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan du 'bad med par //
translated: you will definitely attain it in another life

original: nges par thob 'gyur las bzhin no //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nges par thob 'gyur las bzhin no // zhes bshad do //
translated: without effort, just as with karma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dbu ma las kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dbu ma las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Madhyamaka also says:

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
translated: When perfect buddhas do not appear

original: nyan thos rnams kyang zad pa na //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang zad pa na //
translated: and śrāvakas have become extinct,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //🔽rten pa med par rab tu 'byung //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni // rten pa med par rab tu 'byung //
translated: the wisdom of pratyekabuddhas

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: arises without dependence on others.

original: de la yang dag pa'i gdams ngag gi 'bras bu thob par byed pas na nyan thos dag ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i gdams ngag gi 'bras bu thob par byed pas na nyan thos dag ste /
translated: Śrāvakas are so called because they attain the result of true instruction.

original: 'di ltar bya ba byas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba byas so //
translated: Thus, they think, “The task is done.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: I will not know another existence.”

original: yang na 'bras bu'i mchog gam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las thos nas de don du gnyer ba rnams la sgrogs par byed pas na nyan thos dag ste /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu'i mchog gam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las thos nas de don du gnyer ba rnams la sgrogs par byed pas na nyan thos dag ste /
translated: Or else, they are sriivakas because they hear the path of the Tathagatas, the supreme or unsurpassed result, and they proclaim it to those who seek it.

original: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
translated: The Saddharmapundarika-sutra says,

original: mgon po de ring bdag cag nyan thos gyur //🔽byang chub dam pa yang dag bsgrags par bgyi //
analyzed: mgon po de ring bdag cag nyan thos gyur // byang chub dam pa yang dag bsgrags par bgyi //
translated: Today, Lord, we have become sriivakas🔽Because we have been proclaimed as supreme enlightenment.

original: byang chub pa yi sgra yang rab tu brjod //
analyzed: byang chub pa yi sgra yang rab tu brjod //
translated: We will proclaim the word enlightenment.

original: de bas bdag cag nyan thos mi zad 'dra //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bas bdag cag nyan thos mi zad 'dra // zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, we are inexhaustible sriivakas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang de lta yin mod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang de lta yin mod kyi /
translated: Even though bodhisattvas are like that,

original: de lta na yang sgrogs par byed pa nyid yin gyi rjes su mthun pa tsam yang mi sgrub pa gang yin pa de dag nyan thos yin pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang sgrogs par byed pa nyid yin gyi rjes su mthun pa tsam yang mi sgrub pa gang yin pa de dag nyan thos yin pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they are sriivakas because they proclaim that, but they do not merely conform to it, and they do not practice it. Therefore, this does not apply to bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sgra 'di sangs rgyas kyi de nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gsum car la yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sgra 'di sangs rgyas kyi de nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gsum car la yang 'jug ste /
translated: The term buddha applies to the three: śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: des na sangs rgyas kyi sgras rang sangs rgyas dag bsnyad do //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas kyi sgras rang sangs rgyas dag bsnyad do //
translated: Therefore, the term buddha is used to refer to pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag ni bsod nams dang ye shes gong du 'phel ba'i khyad par gyis nyan thos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang thugs rje chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa med pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams pas dman pa'i phyir na 'bring ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni bsod nams dang ye shes gong du 'phel ba'i khyad par gyis nyan thos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang thugs rje chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa med pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams pas dman pa'i phyir na 'bring ngo //
translated: They are middling because they are superior to śrāvakas due to the special increase of their merit and wisdom, and they are inferior to perfectly enlightened buddhas because they lack the accumulations of merit and wisdom, great compassion, knowledge of all aspects, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag ni nye bar ma bstan par ye shes 'byung zhing bdag nyid gcig pu'i phyir rang nyid sangs @221b rgyas pas rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag ni nye bar ma bstan par ye shes 'byung zhing bdag nyid gcig pu'i phyir rang nyid sangs @221b rgyas pas rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: They are called pratyekabuddhas because they are self-enlightened, because they are enlightened by themselves without being taught, because they are solitary, and because they are enlightened by themselves alone.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa las nges par byung ba nyid kyi phyir thub dbang las skyes so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa las nges par byung ba nyid kyi phyir thub dbang las skyes so //
translated: As explained, those śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are born from the Lord of Sages because they are born from the Tathāgata's teaching of the Dharma.

original: yang thub pa'i dbang po de rnams gang las bltams she na /
analyzed: yang thub pa'i dbang po de rnams gang las bltams she na /
translated: From what are those Lord of Sages born?

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' las 'khrungs shing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' las 'khrungs shing //
translated: The Buddha is born from the bodhisattva.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is stated.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pas nye bar bstan pa las skyes par gyur bas rgyal pa'i smras zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pas nye bar bstan pa las skyes par gyur bas rgyal pa'i smras zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If bodhisattvas are born from the Tathāgata's teaching, aren't they called the Victor's offspring?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub sems dpa' las 'khrungs she na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub sems dpa' las 'khrungs she na /
translated: Therefore, how are the Buddha Bhagavāns born from the bodhisattvas?

original: 'di ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang rgyu gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa' dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang rgyu gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa' dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: This is true, but for two reasons the bodhisattvas become the cause of the Buddha Bhagavāns.

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa las so //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa las so //
translated: from the point of view of the difference in state and from the point of view of the engagement in authentic commitment.

original: de la gnas skabs kyi khyad par las ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas skabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu can yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas skabs kyi khyad par las ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas skabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu can yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: From the point of view of the difference in state, the state of the Tathagata is the cause of the state of the bodhisattva.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa las ni ji ltar 'phags pa 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpar gyur pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ches thog ma kho nar byang chub kyi sems yang dag par 'dzin du bcug par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa las ni ji ltar 'phags pa 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpar gyur pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ches thog ma kho nar byang chub kyi sems yang dag par 'dzin du bcug par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: From the point of view of the engagement in authentic commitment, it is just as the noble Manjusri, when he was a bodhisattva, first engaged the Lord Sakyamuni and other Tathagatas in the spirit of enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu mthar thug pa de'i rgyu gtso bor gyur pa la ltos nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' las 'khrungs par bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu mthar thug pa de'i rgyu gtso bor gyur pa la ltos nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' las 'khrungs par bstan to //
translated: Thus, in dependence on the principal cause of the ultimate effect, the Tathagatas are said to be born from the bodhisattvas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ches brling ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ches brling ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Therefore, since the perfect cause is very firm,

original: rgyu la mchod pa brjod pas kyang 'bras bu la mchod pa don gyis 'phangs par dgongs te /
analyzed: rgyu la mchod pa brjod pas kyang 'bras bu la mchod pa don gyis 'phangs par dgongs te /
translated: and since worship of the cause implies worship of the effect,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis sman gyi ljon shing chen po 'bras bu nges pa dpag du med pa ster ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis sman gyi ljon shing chen po 'bras bu nges pa dpag du med pa ster ba /
translated: the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have taught that the great medicinal tree, which grants the fruit of the immeasurable definite excellence,

original: myu gu la sogs mtho zhing lo ma 'jam pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa ltar bsgrims te yongs su bskyang bar bya ba nyid du bstan par bya zhing /🔽dus der nye bar gyur cing theg pa gsum la bkod pa'i sems can gyi phung po theg pa chen po nyid la nges par sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' @222a * //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs mtho zhing lo ma 'jam pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa ltar bsgrims te yongs su bskyang bar bya ba nyid du bstan par bya zhing / dus der nye bar gyur cing theg pa gsum la bkod pa'i sems can gyi phung po theg pa chen po nyid la nges par sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' @222a * //
translated: should be carefully tended, like a sprout, etc., which become the state of a tall tree with smooth leaves.

original: rnams la bsngags pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnams la bsngags pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: And they have praised the bodhisattvas in order to bring about the time when the mass of beings who have been established in the three vehicles will be definitely fixed in the Great Vehicle itself.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the noble Ratnakuṭa Sūtra:

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na zla ba tshes pa la phyag 'tshal ba ltar nya ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na zla ba tshes pa la phyag 'tshal ba ltar nya ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this: one should pay homage to the moon on the first lunar day, not to the full moon on the fifteenth.

original: 'od srungs de bzhin du gang dag nga la rab tu dad pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag bya'i /
analyzed: 'od srungs de bzhin du gang dag nga la rab tu dad pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag bya'i /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, those who have faith in me should pay homage to the bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: not so much to the Tathāgatas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams las ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams las ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung ngo //
translated: The Tathāgatas arise from the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad byung ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad byung ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: All the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas arise from the Tathāgatas.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na rigs pa dang lung dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' las 'khrungs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na rigs pa dang lung dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' las 'khrungs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by reasoning and by scripture, it is established that the Tathāgatas are born from the bodhisattvas.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag ci'i phyir rgyu can zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag ci'i phyir rgyu can zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Why are those bodhisattvas called “possessing cause”?

original: snying rje'i sems dang gnyis su med blo dang // byang chub sems ni rgyal sras rnams kyi rgyu //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: snying rje'i sems dang gnyis su med blo dang // byang chub sems ni rgyal sras rnams kyi rgyu // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Compassion, nondualistic intuition, and the spirit of enlightenment are the causes of the victors’ spiritual offspring.

original: de la snying rje ni brtse ba ste /🔽'di nyid du 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang rang gi ngo bo can no //🔽gnyis su med pa'i blo ni /
analyzed: de la snying rje ni brtse ba ste / 'di nyid du 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang rang gi ngo bo can no // gnyis su med pa'i blo ni /
translated: Compassion is affection, as will be explained below.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i shes rab po //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i shes rab po //
translated: Nondualistic intuition is the insight free from the two extremes of conceptual construction and nonexistence.🔽The spirit of enlightenment is the spirit of unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni 'phags pa chos kun 'gro ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni 'phags pa chos kun 'gro ba'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Sūtra on the Posture for Beginning Enlightenment says,

original: byang chub sems dpas byang chub kyi sems las chos thams cad khong du chud par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas byang chub kyi sems las chos thams cad khong du chud par bgyi'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva should understand all phenomena from the spirit of enlightenment.

translated: All phenomena are merely to be known, and are empty of a knower, so this suchness should be understood by sentient beings.🔽The mind that arises in the bodhisattva is called the bodhisattva's mind of enlightenment.

original: @222b stong pa nyid kyis mi 'gyur ba'i sems dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pas sgrib pa ma mchis pa'i sems dang / smon pa ma mchis pas mi gnas pa'i sems zhes ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: @222b stong pa nyid kyis mi 'gyur ba'i sems dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pas sgrib pa ma mchis pa'i sems dang / smon pa ma mchis pas mi gnas pa'i sems zhes ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The mind that is unchanging due to emptiness, the mind that is unobstructed due to the absence of characteristics, and the mind that is non-abiding due to the absence of expectancy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtso bo'i rgyu ni snying rje dang / gnyis su med pa'i shes rab dang / byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba chos gsum po 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtso bo'i rgyu ni snying rje dang / gnyis su med pa'i shes rab dang / byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba chos gsum po 'di dag yin no //
translated: The principal causes of the bodhisattvas are these three dharmas: compassion, non-dual wisdom, and the thought of awakening.

original: ji skad du rin po che'i phreng ba las //
analyzed: ji skad du rin po che'i phreng ba las //
translated: As it is said in the Precious Garland:

original: de yi rtsa ba byang chub sems //
analyzed: de yi rtsa ba byang chub sems //
translated: Its root is the thought of awakening,🔽steadfast like the king of mountains,🔽compassion reaching the limits of space,

original: ri dbang rgyal po ltar brtan dang // phyogs mtha' gtugs pa'i snying rje dang // gnyis la mi brten ye shes lags //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ri dbang rgyal po ltar brtan dang // phyogs mtha' gtugs pa'i snying rje dang // gnyis la mi brten ye shes lags // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and wisdom that does not rely on duality.

original: byang chub kyi sems dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gnyis kyi rtsa ba yang snying rje yin pa'i phyir na snying rje gtso bo nyid du bstan par 'dod pas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gnyis kyi rtsa ba yang snying rje yin pa'i phyir na snying rje gtso bo nyid du bstan par 'dod pas /
translated: Since the root of both the thought of awakening and non-dual wisdom is compassion, it is taught that compassion is the principal cause.

original: gang phyir brtse nyid rgyal ba'i lo thog phun tshogs 'di yi //
analyzed: gang phyir brtse nyid rgyal ba'i lo thog phun tshogs 'di yi //
translated: For compassion is the very seed of the perfect harvest of the Victorious Ones.🔽🔽

original: sa bon dang ni spel la chur 'dra yun ring du //
analyzed: sa bon dang ni spel la chur 'dra yun ring du //
translated: Compassion is the seed and the water for the growth of the abundant harvest of the Victor’s crop;

original: longs spyod gnas la smin pa lta bur 'dod gyur pa //
analyzed: longs spyod gnas la smin pa lta bur 'dod gyur pa //
translated: it is like the ripening for the enjoyment of the crop.

original: de phyir bdag gis thog mar snying rje bstod par bgyi //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de phyir bdag gis thog mar snying rje bstod par bgyi // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, I praise compassion first of all.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi 'bru la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi 'bru la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa la /
translated: Just as, for the abundance of external crops,

original: thog ma dang bar dang tha ma rnams su sa bon dang chu dang smin pa rnams gtso bo nyid du gyur pas nye bar mkho ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: thog ma dang bar dang tha ma rnams su sa bon dang chu dang smin pa rnams gtso bo nyid du gyur pas nye bar mkho ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: seeds, water, and ripening are essential at the beginning, in the middle, and at the end,

original: snying rje kho na dus gsum car du yang rgyal ba'i lo thog phun sum tshogs pa la nye bar mkho ba nyid du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: snying rje kho na dus gsum car du yang rgyal ba'i lo thog phun sum tshogs pa la nye bar mkho ba nyid du ston pa yin no //
translated: so compassion alone is essential at all three times for the abundant harvest of the Victor’s crop.

original: 'di ltar snying rje can ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis sems can sdug bsngal bar gyur pa ma lus pa yongs su bskyab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar snying rje can ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis sems can sdug bsngal bar gyur pa ma lus pa yongs su bskyab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the compassionate one, suffering himself through the suffering of others, generates the resolve to definitely set out for the knowledge of the path to enlightenment, in order to protect all beings who are suffering.🔽He thinks:

original: gdon mi za bar bdag gis 'jig rten 'di mtha' dag sdug bsngal nas bton te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bdag gis 'jig rten 'di mtha' dag sdug bsngal nas bton te /
translated: I must certainly rescue this entire world from suffering

original: sangs rgyas nyid la nges par sbyar bar bya'o snyam du nges par sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la nges par sbyar bar bya'o snyam du nges par sems skyed par byed do //
translated: and definitely connect it with buddhahood.

original: dam bca' ba 'di yang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes spangs pas sgrub par mi nus pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la yang nges pa kho nar 'jug ste /
analyzed: dam bca' ba 'di yang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes spangs pas sgrub par mi nus pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la yang nges pa kho nar 'jug ste /
translated: Moreover, this vow cannot be accomplished without nondual knowledge, so he definitely enters nondual knowledge.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon ni snying rje nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon ni snying rje nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, compassion is the seed of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: ji skad du rin po che'i phreng ba las /
analyzed: ji skad du rin po che'i phreng ba las /
translated: As it says in the Precious Garland:

original: theg pa chen po gang zhig las //
analyzed: theg pa chen po gang zhig las //
translated: What is the Great Vehicle?

original: snying rje sngon btang spyod pa kun //
analyzed: snying rje sngon btang spyod pa kun //
translated: It is all the practices preceded by compassion

original: ye shes dri ma med bshad pa /
analyzed: ye shes dri ma med bshad pa /
translated: and explained by stainless knowledge.

original: sems yod su zhig de la smod //
analyzed: sems yod su zhig de la smod //
translated: What person with a mind would disparage it?🔽

original: ces gsungs so //🔽byang @223a * //
analyzed: ces gsungs so // byang @223a * //
translated: What person with a heart would disparage it?

original: chub kyi sems bskyed du zin kyang /
analyzed: chub kyi sems bskyed du zin kyang /
translated: Even if one generates the thought of awakening,

original: gal te dus phyis snying rje'i chus yang dang yang du bcus par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dus phyis snying rje'i chus yang dang yang du bcus par ma gyur na /
translated: if later on it is not repeatedly watered with the water of compassion,

original: 'bras bu'i tshogs yangs pa ma bsags pa 'di nges par nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i tshogs yangs pa ma bsags pa 'di nges par nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, without having accumulated a vast collection of merit, one will certainly attain nirvana through the nirvana of the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha.

original: 'bras bu mtha' yas pa'i gnas skabs thob tu zin kyang gal te dus phyis snying rje'i yongs su smin pa dang bral bar gyur na ni 'di dus ring por nye bar longs spyod par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'bras bu mtha' yas pa'i gnas skabs thob tu zin kyang gal te dus phyis snying rje'i yongs su smin pa dang bral bar gyur na ni 'di dus ring por nye bar longs spyod par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Even if one attains the state of infinite results, if later on one becomes separated from the full ripening of compassion, then it will not be enjoyed for a long time.

original: 'phags pa'i 'bras bu'i tshogs chen po rim pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rnam pa bar ma chad pa yun ring por mngon par 'phel bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i 'bras bu'i tshogs chen po rim pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rnam pa bar ma chad pa yun ring por mngon par 'phel bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the great collection of the results of the āryas, which is passed down from one stage to the next, will not increase uninterruptedly for a long time.

original: da ni dmigs pa'i bye brag la 'jug pa'i sgo nas kyang snying rje'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par mngon par gsal bar byas te de nyid la phyag 'tshal ba brtsam par 'dod pas /🔽dang por nga zhes bdag la zhen gyur zhing //🔽bdag gi 'di zhes dngos la chags bskyed pa //
analyzed: da ni dmigs pa'i bye brag la 'jug pa'i sgo nas kyang snying rje'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par mngon par gsal bar byas te de nyid la phyag 'tshal ba brtsam par 'dod pas / dang por nga zhes bdag la zhen gyur zhing // bdag gi 'di zhes dngos la chags bskyed pa //
translated: Now, in order to make clear the special nature of compassion by way of engaging in the various objects, and to begin the homage to it,🔽First, one is attached to the self, thinking “I.”

original: tho chun 'phyan ltar rang dbang med pa yi //
analyzed: tho chun 'phyan ltar rang dbang med pa yi //
translated: Then, one generates attachment to things, thinking “This is mine.”

original: 'gro la snying rjer gyur gang de la 'dud //🔽ces bya ba smos so //🔽'jig rten 'di ni bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i snga rol nyid du ngar 'dzin pas yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag yod do snyam du nye bar brtags nas 'di nyid du bden par mngon par zhen cing //
analyzed: 'gro la snying rjer gyur gang de la 'dud // ces bya ba smos so // 'jig rten 'di ni bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i snga rol nyid du ngar 'dzin pas yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag yod do snyam du nye bar brtags nas 'di nyid du bden par mngon par zhen cing //
translated: I bow to that compassion for the world,🔽Which is powerless like a small child wandering about.🔽Before one is attached to “mine” in the world, through the conception “I am,” one imagines the non-existent self to exist. Then, one is attached to it as real.

original: 'di ni bdag gi'o snyam du ngar 'dzin pa'i yul las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa ma lus pa la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi'o snyam du ngar 'dzin pa'i yul las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa ma lus pa la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: Then, one is attached to all the aspects of things other than the object of the conception “I am,” thinking “This is mine.”

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i 'jig rten 'di ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i thag pas ches dam du bsdams pa /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i 'jig rten 'di ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i thag pas ches dam du bsdams pa /
translated: This world, which is attached to the self and to what belongs to the self, is tightly bound by the ropes of karma and the afflictions.

original: 'khrul 'khor bskor mkhan rnam par shes pa'i bskyod pa la rag las par 'jug pa /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor bskor mkhan rnam par shes pa'i bskyod pa la rag las par 'jug pa /
translated: It is dependent on the movement of consciousness, the operator of the wheel of life.

original: 'khor ba'i khron pa chen po srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa la thug pa zab la bar med par 'phyan pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i khron pa chen po srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa la thug pa zab la bar med par 'phyan pa /
translated: It wanders in the great pit of cyclic existence, from the peak of existence down to the lowest hell, without any chance of escape.🔽It is like a well-drawn arrow that is shot by itself and that one does not know how to pull out.

original: rang gi rang nyid kyis thur du 'gro bar 'jug pa 'bad pas ci zhig ltar drang bar bya ba mi shes pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum yod kyang snga ma dang phyi ma dang bar gyi rim🔽pa nges par mi zin pa /
analyzed: rang gi rang nyid kyis thur du 'gro bar 'jug pa 'bad pas ci zhig ltar drang bar bya ba mi shes pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum yod kyang snga ma dang phyi ma dang bar gyi rim🔽pa nges par mi zin pa /
translated: It has three afflictions: karma, the afflictions, and birth.

original: nyi ma re re zhing sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dag gis gcog pa'i phyir zo chun khyud mo'i gnas skabs las ma 'das par gnas pa zhig ste /
analyzed: nyi ma re re zhing sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dag gis gcog pa'i phyir zo chun khyud mo'i gnas skabs las ma 'das par gnas pa zhig ste /
translated: Every day, they are broken by the suffering of suffering and the suffering of change, and so they remain in a state like that of a waterwheel.

original: gang gi @223b phyir byang chub sems dpa' de'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba de la shin tu snying rjes dmigs nas bskyab par spro ba de'i phyir ches thog ma kho nar bcom ldan 'das ma snying rje chen po la rab tu phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gang gi @223b phyir byang chub sems dpa' de'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba de la shin tu snying rjes dmigs nas bskyab par spro ba de'i phyir ches thog ma kho nar bcom ldan 'das ma snying rje chen po la rab tu phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Because the Bodhisattvas, with their great compassion, take on their suffering and are eager to protect them, they first pay homage to the Blessed One, Great Compassion.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje sems can la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje sems can la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the Bodhisattvas’ compassion that takes sentient beings as its object.

original: chos la dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje yang dmigs pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje yang dmigs pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate the compassion that takes phenomena as its object and the compassion that takes nothing as its object,🔽the root text says:

original: 'gro ba g-yo ba'i chu yi nang gi zla ba ltar //
analyzed: 'gro ba g-yo ba'i chu yi nang gi zla ba ltar //
translated: Like the moon in a rippling body of water,

original: g-yo dang rang bzhin nyid kyis stong par mthong ba yis //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: g-yo dang rang bzhin nyid kyis stong par mthong ba yis //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: they see that beings are insubstantial by nature.

original: snying rjer gyur gang de la 'dud //
analyzed: snying rjer gyur gang de la 'dud //
translated: I bow to that compassion.

original: ces bya ba de dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba de dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be applied.

original: 'di ltar chu shin tu dangs pa rlung te por drag po ma yin pas cha shas brlabs pas khyab pa'i nang du zla ba'i gzugs brnyan sngar dmigs pa'i rten gyi yul dang / lhan cig 'jig pa de dag gi dngos po mngon sum du dmigs pa lta bu shar ba na /
analyzed: 'di ltar chu shin tu dangs pa rlung te por drag po ma yin pas cha shas brlabs pas khyab pa'i nang du zla ba'i gzugs brnyan sngar dmigs pa'i rten gyi yul dang / lhan cig 'jig pa de dag gi dngos po mngon sum du dmigs pa lta bu shar ba na /
translated: Thus, when the reflection of the moon arises in a very clear pool of water, which is not disturbed by a strong wind, and which is filled with waves, it is as if the object that was previously perceived, the basis of the perception, and the thing that is now perceived, the reflection, were both directly perceived.

original: dam pa dag gis gnyis po 'di rang gi bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa ltar gnas par mthong ste /
analyzed: dam pa dag gis gnyis po 'di rang gi bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa ltar gnas par mthong ste /
translated: The wise see that these two exist as if they were illuminating themselves.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is how it is.

original: skad cig re re la mi rtag pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: skad cig re re la mi rtag pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: Moment by moment, they are impermanent and empty by nature.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' snying rje'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa rnams kyis kyang sems can 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshor ma rig pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i phul du byung ba 'byung ba'i rgyu /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' snying rje'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa rnams kyis kyang sems can 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshor ma rig pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i phul du byung ba 'byung ba'i rgyu /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattvas, who are governed by compassion, see that the water of the nectar of the true Dharma arises in the ocean of the perishable composite, which is the cause of the arising of the supreme nectar of the Dharma of non-production.

original: phyin ci log rtog pa mtha' dag pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: phyin ci log rtog pa mtha' dag pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The definition of all false conceptions is

original: 'gro ba yongs kyi ma rig pa'i chu sngon po rgya chen ba tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis rab tu bskyod pa'i nang na gnas pa rang gi las kyi gzugs brnyan lta bur mdun na gnas pa rnams skad cig re re la mi
analyzed: 'gro ba yongs kyi ma rig pa'i chu sngon po rgya chen ba tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis rab tu bskyod pa'i nang na gnas pa rang gi las kyi gzugs brnyan lta bur mdun na gnas pa rnams skad cig re re la mi
translated: that they are like reflections of one’s own actions, which appear in the vast blue waters of the ignorance of all beings, stirred up by the winds of incorrect conception.🔽When one sees that they are struck down by the suffering of impermanence,

original: rtag pa'i sdug bsngal thog tu 'bab pa dang / rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong ba na /
analyzed: rtag pa'i sdug bsngal thog tu 'bab pa dang / rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong ba na /
translated: and that they are empty by nature,

original: de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal la 'joms pa lta bur gyur pa /
analyzed: de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal la 'joms pa lta bur gyur pa /
translated: one becomes like a destroyer of their suffering of impermanence.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i phul du byung ba 'byung ba'i rgyu /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i phul du byung ba 'byung ba'i rgyu /
translated: One becomes a cause for the arising of the excellent nectar of the holy Dharma.

original: phyin ci log gi rtog pa mtha' dag 'og ma'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rtog pa mtha' dag 'og ma'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The definition of all false conceptions is

original: 'gro ba yongs kyi gnyen nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa sangs rgyas nyid yang dag par thob par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba yongs kyi gnyen nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa sangs rgyas nyid yang dag par thob par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: that they are the nature of the friend of all beings, and one wishes to attain the state of buddhahood.

original: de dag gi snying rje sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa gang yin pa de rnams la rab tu btud nas /🔽byang @224a * //
