original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i ye shes snying rje la sogs pas yongs su zin pa nyid char rnam par phye ba na sa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i ye shes snying rje la sogs pas yongs su zin pa nyid char rnam par phye ba na sa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ first spirit of enlightenment is as follows:

original: yon tan gyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of the qualities.🔽Moreover, the ten stages are established by the distinctions of the stage of the joyous, etc., due to the attainment of the higher and higher number of qualities, the attainment of the most excellent power, the increase of the perfections such as giving, and the increase of the maturation.

original: de yang gong nas gong du yon tan gyi grangs dang / mthu phul du byung ba thob pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa klags pa dang / rnam par smin pa 'phel ba'i bye brag gis sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bas dbye ba rnam pa bcur gzhag gi /'di la rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gyis byas pa'i dbye ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gong nas gong du yon tan gyi grangs dang / mthu phul du byung ba thob pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa klags pa dang / rnam par smin pa 'phel ba'i bye brag gis sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bas dbye ba rnam pa bcur gzhag gi /'di la rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gyis byas pa'i dbye ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no distinction made by way of their own nature.

original: ji skad du /🔽ji ltar bar snang bya rjes mkhas rnams kyi //
analyzed: ji skad du / ji ltar bar snang bya rjes mkhas rnams kyi //
translated: As it is said:

original: brjod par nus ma yin zhing mi mthong ba //
analyzed: brjod par nus ma yin zhing mi mthong ba //
translated: Just as the wise cannot describe or see the trace of a bird in the sky,

original: de ltar rgyal ba'i sras kyi sa kun kyang //🔽brjod mi nus na mnyan par ga la nus //
analyzed: de ltar rgyal ba'i sras kyi sa kun kyang // brjod mi nus na mnyan par ga la nus //
translated: so it is with all the stages of the Victor’s sons:

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: if they cannot be described, how can they be heard?

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba ni /
translated: The bodhisattva stage of the joyous

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa dang po yin la mthar chos kyi sprin ni sems bskyed pa bcu pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa dang po yin la mthar chos kyi sprin ni sems bskyed pa bcu pa'o //
translated: The first generation of the Thought of the Bodhisattva is the first stage, the Joyous. The last, the Cloud of Dharma, is the tenth stage.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'gro ba rang bzhin med par mthong ba snying rje'i khyad par nyid du nye bar gzung ba'i sems gang snying rje'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur cing /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'gro ba rang bzhin med par mthong ba snying rje'i khyad par nyid du nye bar gzung ba'i sems gang snying rje'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur cing /
translated: Therein, the Bodhisattva, by the method explained above, sees the world as essenceless, and the Thought which is taken hold of as the special feature of Compassion, is the power of Compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyis yongs su bsngos pa rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ming can gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de'i rgyu can gyi 'bras bus nye bar mtshon pa de la ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyis yongs su bsngos pa rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ming can gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de'i rgyu can gyi 'bras bus nye bar mtshon pa de la ni /
translated: The Thought which is dedicated by the Bodhisattva Samantabhadra's vow, is the cause of the nondual intuition, and is characterized by the result which is the cause of that.

original: dang po zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: That is called the first.

original: de la smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa smon lam 'bum phrag bcu po gang dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pas 'debs pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyi nang du 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: de la smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa smon lam 'bum phrag bcu po gang dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pas 'debs pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyi nang du 'dus pa yin te /
translated: The ten great vows and so forth, the one hundred thousand vows that the bodhisattva who has generated the first mind of enlightenment makes, are included within the vows of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra.

original: smon lam ma lus pa nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir @224b kun tu bzang po'i smon lam khyad par bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: smon lam ma lus pa nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir @224b kun tu bzang po'i smon lam khyad par bkod pa yin no //
translated: The special array of Samantabhadra’s vows is for the purpose of subsuming all vows without exception.

original: de la ji ltar nyan thos kyi theg par zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu'i lam la gnas pa'i dbye bas nyan thos kyis brgyad rnam par 'jog bde bzhin du /
analyzed: de la ji ltar nyan thos kyi theg par zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu'i lam la gnas pa'i dbye bas nyan thos kyis brgyad rnam par 'jog bde bzhin du /
translated: Just as in the vehicle of the hearers, the eight types of hearers are posited by way of the categories of those who have entered the vehicle and those who abide on the path of the result,

original: theg pa chen por yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen por yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yin no //
translated: in the same way, in the Great Vehicle, the ten bodhisattva stages of the bodhisattvas are posited.

original: yang ji ltar nyan thos nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs skyed pa ni /
analyzed: yang ji ltar nyan thos nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs skyed pa ni /
translated: Also, just as the hearers generate the state of the factors conducive to penetrative insight,

original: 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa'i gnas skabs yin par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa'i gnas skabs yin par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one does not assert that the state of entering the first result is the state of an ārya,

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yang yin te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yang yin te /
translated: so too one is a bodhisattva who will become a bodhisattva.

original: dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las /
analyzed: dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las /
translated: For the Ratnamegha Sūtra says,

original: mos pa chen po'i yang chen pos spyod pa'i chos nyid kyi sa dang po de ma thag tu thob par gnas pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems ma bskyed pa'i sa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mos pa chen po'i yang chen pos spyod pa'i chos nyid kyi sa dang po de ma thag tu thob par gnas pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems ma bskyed pa'i sa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “This bodhisattva who is abiding in the attainment of the first level of the reality of practice through the greatest of great aspirations is a bodhisattva who has not generated the thought of awakening.”

original: mos pas spyod pa'i skad cig de la gnas pa yang /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i skad cig de la gnas pa yang /
translated: And also, abiding in that instant of the stage of practice through belief,

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni mi'i mdog las ni 'das la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni mi'i mdog las ni 'das la /
translated: “Son of noble family, it is like this. For example, a universal monarch has passed beyond the color of humans,

original: lha'i mdog ni ma thob pa yin te /
analyzed: lha'i mdog ni ma thob pa yin te /
translated: but has not attained the color of the gods.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis thams cad las ni shin tu 'das la /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis thams cad las ni shin tu 'das la /
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva has completely passed beyond all worldly beings, hearers, and solitary realizers,🔽but has not attained the color of the tathāgatas.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni thob pa yin no zhes de nyid las rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni thob pa yin no zhes de nyid las rnam par bshad do //
translated: The ultimate stage of a bodhisattva is attained.

original: yang gang gi tshe 'di rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i sa dang po la zhugs par gyur pa /🔽de nas bzung ste de ni de thob gyur pa yis //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe 'di rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i sa dang po la zhugs par gyur pa / de nas bzung ste de ni de thob gyur pa yis //
translated: Moreover, when he enters the first stage called “Joyful,”

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'i sgra nyid kyis bsnyad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'i sgra nyid kyis bsnyad do //
translated: then he is called a bodhisattva.

original: sems de thob pa ni rnam pa thams cad du so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa'i gnas skabs su byang chub sems dpa'i sgra kho nas brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sems de thob pa ni rnam pa thams cad du so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa'i gnas skabs su byang chub sems dpa'i sgra kho nas brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Having attained that mind, he is always called a bodhisattva, in the context of having transcended the stage of ordinary beings.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: He is not called by any other name.

original: de'i tshe de 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de'i tshe de 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because at that time he is an ārya.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das ma nyis stong lnga brgya pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das ma nyis stong lnga brgya pa las /
translated: As the Blessed Lady, the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines, says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni rjes su rtogs pa'i sems dpa'i tshig  bla dags te ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni rjes su rtogs pa'i sems dpa'i tshig  bla dags te ;
translated: “Bodhisattva” is a term for a being who has realized.

original: gang gis chos thams cad rjes su rtogs shing shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad rjes su rtogs shing shes pa'o //
translated: It is the realization and knowledge of all phenomena.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it known?

original: ma byung ba dang yang dag par ma byung ba dang log pa dang de dag ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo'i brtags pa de lta ma yin pa dang / ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bos rnyed pa de lta ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: ma byung ba dang yang dag par ma byung ba dang log pa dang de dag ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo'i brtags pa de lta ma yin pa dang / ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bos rnyed pa de lta ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not arisen, not truly arisen, and not inverted, and it is not as it is imagined by childish ordinary beings, and it is not as it is attained by childish ordinary beings.

original: de'i phyir byang @225a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang @225a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the ‘enlightenment of a bodhisattva.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽byang chub ni rnam par ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / byang chub ni rnam par ma brtags pa'o //
translated: Why is that?🔽Enlightenment is not analyzed.

original: byang chub ni ma bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni ma bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: Enlightenment is not accomplished.

original: byang chub ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Enlightenment is not an object.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni byang chub brnyes pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni byang chub brnyes pa med de /
translated: the Tathāgata has not attained enlightenment.

original: chos thams cad ma rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are not attained.

original: chos thams cad ma dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub ces bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub ces bya ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are not observed, it is called ‘enlightenment.’

original: de lta bu ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ces bya'i /
analyzed: de lta bu ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ces bya'i /
translated: That is called the ‘enlightenment of the buddhas.’

original: ji skad brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But not as it is expressed.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: gang dag byang chub tu sems bskyed cing sems 'di byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag byang chub tu sems bskyed cing sems 'di byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: those who arouse the mind of awakening and think, “This mind should arouse the mind of awakening,”

original: gang du bdag cag gis sems bskyed par bya ba'i byang chub de ni yod do zhes byang chub tu rlom sems su byed pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang du bdag cag gis sems bskyed par bya ba'i byang chub de ni yod do zhes byang chub tu rlom sems su byed pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
translated: and who think, “That awakening in which we should arouse the mind of awakening exists,” and who think, “Awakening is,” are not called bodhisattvas.

original: de dag ni skye bar sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni skye bar sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called those who arouse the mind of birth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar skye ba la mngon par zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba la mngon par zhe na /
translated: Because they are attached to birth,

original: sems su mngon par zhe na /
analyzed: sems su mngon par zhe na /
translated: attached to mind,

original: byang chub tu mngon par zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub tu mngon par zhe na /
translated: attached to awakening.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: yang byang chub ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: yang byang chub ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, awakening is without defining characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
translated: free from the nature of defining characteristics.

original: gang gis 'di ltar rjes su rtogs pa de ni byang chub ces bya'i /
analyzed: gang gis 'di ltar rjes su rtogs pa de ni byang chub ces bya'i /
translated: That which is realized in this way is called awakening.

original: yang ji skad brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ji skad brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not what is said.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos de rnams rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos de rnams rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, it is because they have realized those dharmas that they are called bodhisattvas.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gang la la zhig chos 'di ma shes shing rjes su ma rtogs bzhin du bdag nyid la byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'o snyam du shes pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ring ba yin zhing /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gang la la zhig chos 'di ma shes shing rjes su ma rtogs bzhin du bdag nyid la byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'o snyam du shes pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ring ba yin zhing /
translated: Subhūti, anyone who, without knowing and without realizing those dharmas, thinks of themselves as a bodhisattva, as a bodhisattva, is far from the bodhisattva levels,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams las ring ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams las ring ba yin no //
translated: and is far from the dharmas of a bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin du de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ming gis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin gyi 'jig rten bslu ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ming gis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin gyi 'jig rten bslu ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, they deceive the world with its gods, humans, and asuras with the name of a bodhisattva.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa 'di tshig tsam gyis byang chub sems dpar 'gyur na ni ;
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa 'di tshig tsam gyis byang chub sems dpar 'gyur na ni ;
translated: Subhūti, if someone were to become a bodhisattva just by the words,

original: de bas na sems can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bas na sems can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpar 'gyur na /
translated: then all sentient beings would be bodhisattvas.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa 'di ni gang gi las tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa 'di ni gang gi las tsam ma yin te /
translated: Subhūti, this is not just the work of someone who is a beginner.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is as follows:🔽the stage of a bodhisattva.”

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i byang chub kyi sems thob @225b pa ni gnas skabs der byang chub sems dpa'i sgra kho nas brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i byang chub kyi sems thob @225b pa ni gnas skabs der byang chub sems dpa'i sgra kho nas brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Having attained the thought of awakening as it has been explained, at that time one is called by the name “bodhisattva.”

original: gzhan yang / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs su'ang skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs su'ang skyes pa ste /
translated: Moreover, one is born into the family of the tathāgatas.

original: 'di yi kun du sbyor ba gsum po thams cad spangs par gyur //
analyzed: 'di yi kun du sbyor ba gsum po thams cad spangs par gyur //
translated: All three of one’s fetters are abandoned.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni dga' ba mchog tu gyur 'chang zhing //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni dga' ba mchog tu gyur 'chang zhing //
translated: That bodhisattva holds the highest joy.

original: 'jig rten khams brgya kun nas g-yo bar nus par gyur pa'ang yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams brgya kun nas g-yo bar nus par gyur pa'ang yin //
translated: And is able to cause a hundred world-realms to quake.

original: so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa kun du 'od ces bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i lam skyes pa'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa kun du 'od ces bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i lam skyes pa'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no //
translated: Because he has transcended all the stages of ordinary beings, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas, and because he has generated the path that leads to the stage of the tathāgatas called “universal light,” that bodhisattva is born into the family of the tathāgatas.

original: de'i tshe gang zag gi bdag med pa mngon sum du mthong bas 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang the tshom dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba kun du sbyor ba gsum dang yang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang zag gi bdag med pa mngon sum du mthong bas 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang the tshom dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba kun du sbyor ba gsum dang yang bral ba yin te /
translated: At that time, he is also free from the three fetters called the view of the aggregates as a person, doubt, and the grasping of rules and ritual as emminent.

original: slar mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slar mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not generate them again.

original: de kho na nyid ma mthong ba ni bdag tu sgro btags pa las 'jig tshogs su lta bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma mthong ba ni bdag tu sgro btags pa las 'jig tshogs su lta bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: One who has not seen reality superimposes a self and generates the view of the aggregates as a person.

original: de bzhin du the tshom gyis de lam gzhan du 'ang 'gro ba srid pa zhig na gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du the tshom gyis de lam gzhan du 'ang 'gro ba srid pa zhig na gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, because of doubt, it is possible that he will go on a different path, but not so for the other two.

original: nges pa la zhugs pas de'i rgyu can gyi yon tan thob pa dang / sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi skyon dang bral bas thun mong ma yin pa'i dga' ba'i khyad par skyes pas rab tu dga' ba mang ba nyid kyi phyir na byang chub sems dpa' de ni dga' ba mchog tu gyur pa srel ba yang yin no //
analyzed: nges pa la zhugs pas de'i rgyu can gyi yon tan thob pa dang / sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi skyon dang bral bas thun mong ma yin pa'i dga' ba'i khyad par skyes pas rab tu dga' ba mang ba nyid kyi phyir na byang chub sems dpa' de ni dga' ba mchog tu gyur pa srel ba yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is also one who has the highest joy, because he has attained the virtues that are its cause, and because he has generated the special, uncommon joy that comes from being free of the faults that are the opposites of the stages.

original: rab tu dga' ba khyad par 'phags pa yod pa'i phyir na sa 'dis ni rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ming yang rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba khyad par 'phags pa yod pa'i phyir na sa 'dis ni rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ming yang rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: This stage is also called the Joyous because of the preeminence of that joy.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya bskyod par yang nus so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya bskyod par yang nus so //
translated: He is also able to shake a hundred world systems.

original: sa nas sar gnon byed cing gong bar rab tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sa nas sar gnon byed cing gong bar rab tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: He proceeds higher and higher, from stage to stage.

original: de tshe 'di yi ngan 'gro'i lam rnams mtha' dag 'gags par gyur //
analyzed: de tshe 'di yi ngan 'gro'i lam rnams mtha' dag 'gags par gyur //
translated: At that time, all the paths to the lower realms are blocked for him.

original: de tshe 'di yi so so'i skye bo'i sa rnams thams cad zad //
analyzed: de tshe 'di yi so so'i skye bo'i sa rnams thams cad zad //
translated: At that time, all the levels of the common person are exhausted for him.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa brgyad pa ji lta de ltar nye bar bstan //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa brgyad pa ji lta de ltar nye bar bstan //
translated: He is taught to be like the eighth noble person.

original: zhes bya ba la 'di ni ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos la goms pa'i phyir dang / sa gnyis pa la sogs pa la gnon pa la spo ba che ba'i phyir sa nas sar gnon pa na gong du rab tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //🔽mdor na ji ltar 'phags @226a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di ni ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos la goms pa'i phyir dang / sa gnyis pa la sogs pa la gnon pa la spo ba che ba'i phyir sa nas sar gnon pa na gong du rab tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro // mdor na ji ltar 'phags @226a * //
translated: Here, he goes higher and higher on the stages, from stage to stage, because he is habituated to the Dharma as he has understood it, and because he is very mobile in his progress from the second stage onward.

original: pa rgyun du zhugs pa la rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'phags pa'i chos rtogs pa las skyon dang bral zhing /
analyzed: pa rgyun du zhugs pa la rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'phags pa'i chos rtogs pa las skyon dang bral zhing /
translated: In brief, just as the noble stream-enterer, having realized the noble Dharma in accordance with his own kind, is free from faults and

original: yon tan 'byung bar gyur pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' 'di la yang sa rtogs pa las rang dang 'tsham pa'i yon tan 'byung ba dang / skyon zad par rgyun du zhugs pa'i dpe'i sgo nas yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan 'byung bar gyur pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' 'di la yang sa rtogs pa las rang dang 'tsham pa'i yon tan 'byung ba dang / skyon zad par rgyun du zhugs pa'i dpe'i sgo nas yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: possesses virtues, in the same way, the bodhisattva, having realized the stage, possesses virtues and eliminates faults that are appropriate to his stage.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di /
translated: The bodhisattva,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems lta dang po la gnas kyang //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems lta dang po la gnas kyang //
translated: even though he is in the first stage,

original: thub dbang gsung skyes dang bcas rang sangs rgyas rnams ni //
analyzed: thub dbang gsung skyes dang bcas rang sangs rgyas rnams ni //
translated: is superior to the disciples and solitary enlightened ones.

original: bsod nams dag gi dbang gis pham byas rnam par 'phel //
analyzed: bsod nams dag gi dbang gis pham byas rnam par 'phel //
translated: Through the power of merit, they are overcome and increase.

original: zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni khyad par gzhan yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni khyad par gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another difference.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa las /
translated: As it says in the Sublime Sūtra of the Liberation of Maitreya:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, it is like this.

original: dper na rgyal po'i bu skyes nas ring por ma lon pa rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan pa ni blon po'i tshogs rgan po gtso bor gyur pa thams cad kyang rigs kyi bdag nyid che ba'i dbang gis zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i bu skyes nas ring por ma lon pa rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan pa ni blon po'i tshogs rgan po gtso bor gyur pa thams cad kyang rigs kyi bdag nyid che ba'i dbang gis zil gyis gnon to //
translated: For example, a prince who has been born not long ago, who has the marks of a king, surpasses all the groups of ministers, even the most senior, through the power of his great family.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ring po ma lon pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ring po ma lon pa /
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva who is a beginner, who has generated the mind of awakening not long ago,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pas kyang byang chub kyi sems dang / snying rje'i dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yun ring du tshangs par spyad pa rnams zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pas kyang byang chub kyi sems dang / snying rje'i dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yun ring du tshangs par spyad pa rnams zil gyis gnon to //
translated: through the power of the mind of awakening and compassion, surpasses the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who have practiced pure conduct for a long time, because he has been born into the family of the Tathāgata, the king of the Dharma.”

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this.

original: dper na nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i phru gu skyes nas ring po ma lon pa'i gshog pa'i rlung gi shugs dang / mig yongs su dag pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i bya'i tshogs ma lus pa rgas par gyur pa thams cad la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i phru gu skyes nas ring po ma lon pa'i gshog pa'i rlung gi shugs dang / mig yongs su dag pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i bya'i tshogs ma lus pa rgas par gyur pa thams cad la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The qualities of the speed of the wind of the wings and the completely pure eyes of a young garuḍa king, born not long ago, are not possessed by any of the other flocks of birds, no matter how old they are.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems dang po bskyed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems dang po bskyed pa /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva who has first given rise to the mind of awakening

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i rigs kyi rgyud du yang dag par byung ba nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i phru gu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i gshog pa'i stobs kyis pha rol gnon pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i rigs kyi rgyud du yang dag par byung ba nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i phru gu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i gshog pa'i stobs kyis pha rol gnon pa dang /
translated: has come forth from the lineage of the great garuḍa king, the Tathāgata. The power of the wings of the mind of awakening to omniscience of the young garuḍa king

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i mig gi yon tan gang yin pa de ni bskal pa brgya stong du nges par 'byung ba'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la yod pa ma yin no zhes pa la @226b sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i mig gi yon tan gang yin pa de ni bskal pa brgya stong du nges par 'byung ba'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la yod pa ma yin no zhes pa la @226b sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The eye of pure superior intention is not possessed by any of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas who have definitely left the world for a hundred thousand eons.

original: de ni ring du song bar blo yang lhag par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ring du song bar blo yang lhag par 'gyur //
translated: On the Gone Afar ground, his intelligence becomes superior.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las kyang /
translated: The noble Sūtra on the Ten Grounds also says,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: “O children of the Victor, it is like this:

original: dper na rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa'i rgyal po'i bu rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan pa ni skyes pa tsam gyis rgyal po'i byin gyis blon po'i chogs thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa'i rgyal po'i bu rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan pa ni skyes pa tsam gyis rgyal po'i byin gyis blon po'i chogs thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi /
translated: For example, a prince born into a royal family, who has the marks of a king, by merely being born surpasses all the hosts of ministers.

original: rang gi blo'i stobs kyis rnam par dpyad pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi blo'i stobs kyis rnam par dpyad pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But not by the power of his own intelligence.

original: nam de nar son par gyur pa de'i tshe rang gi blo'i stobs bskyed pas blon po'i bya ba thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: nam de nar son par gyur pa de'i tshe rang gi blo'i stobs bskyed pas blon po'i bya ba thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yin no //
translated: But when he has grown up, then by the power of his own intelligence he surpasses all the activities of the ministers.”

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems bskyed ma thag tu lhag pa'i bsam pa'i che ba nyid kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems bskyed ma thag tu lhag pa'i bsam pa'i che ba nyid kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi /
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones, in the same way, as soon as a bodhisattva has given rise to the mind of awakening, through the greatness of his superior intention, he outshines all the śrāvakas and solitary buddhas.

original: rang gi blo'i stobs kyis rnam par dpyad bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi blo'i stobs kyis rnam par dpyad bas ni ma yin no //
translated: But not through the power of his own intellect.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi yul shes pa'i che ba la gnas pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bya ba thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi yul shes pa'i che ba la gnas pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bya ba thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva ground, the bodhisattva ground Gone Far Beyond, through abiding in the greatness of knowing his own domain, has gone far beyond all the activities of the śrāvakas and solitary buddhas.”

original: // de'i phyir de ltar na ring du song ba kho na nas bzung nas ni byang chub sems dpas rang gi blo'i stobs bskyed pas kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag zil gyis gnon par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: // de'i phyir de ltar na ring du song ba kho na nas bzung nas ni byang chub sems dpas rang gi blo'i stobs bskyed pas kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag zil gyis gnon par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, from the ground Gone Far Beyond onward, the bodhisattva outshines the śrāvakas and solitary buddhas through the power of his own intellect.

original: sa 'og ma rnams su ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma rnams su ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is not the case for the lower levels.

original: lung 'di las ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med par shes pa yang yod do zhes bya bar gsal bar nges te /
analyzed: lung 'di las ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med par shes pa yang yod do zhes bya bar gsal bar nges te /
translated: This scriptural passage clearly and definitively shows that even śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have knowledge that all phenomena lack intrinsic existence.

original: de ltar ma yin na dngos po rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na dngos po rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir //
translated: If that were not so, then because they would lack the knowledge that things lack intrinsic existence,

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ltar de dag kyang sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pas kyang zil gyis gnon par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ltar de dag kyang sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pas kyang zil gyis gnon par 'gyur la /
translated: then just like those who are free from worldly attachment, they would be outshone even by the bodhisattvas who have generated the first level of bodhicitta, who have analyzed with their own minds,

original: phyi rol pa bzhin du 'di dag gis khams gsum na spyod pa'i phra rgyas thams cad spangs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol pa bzhin du 'di dag gis khams gsum na spyod pa'i phra rgyas thams cad spangs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and they would not have abandoned all the afflictions that operate in the three realms, just like the non-Buddhists.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pas phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir gang zag gi bdag med par rtogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pas phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir gang zag gi bdag med par rtogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because they focus on the intrinsic reality of form and so on, they are mistaken and therefore do not realize the selflessness of persons.

original: bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu phung po la dmigs pa'i phyir @227a * //
analyzed: bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu phung po la dmigs pa'i phyir @227a * //
translated: Because they focus on the aggregates, which are the cause for the imputation of a self.

original: ro ; / ji skad du rin po che'i phreng ba las /
analyzed: ro ; / ji skad du rin po che'i phreng ba las /
translated: As the Precious Garland says:🔽As long as there is clinging to the aggregates,

original: ji srid phung por 'dzin yod pa //🔽de srid de la ngar 'dzin nyid //
analyzed: ji srid phung por 'dzin yod pa // de srid de la ngar 'dzin nyid //
translated: there is the view of the transitory collection.

original: ngar 'dzin yod na yang las te //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin yod na yang las te //
translated: If there is the view of the transitory collection, there is karma.

original: de las yang ni skye ba yi //
analyzed: de las yang ni skye ba yi //
translated: From that, there is birth.🔽The three paths have no beginning, middle, or end.

original: lam gsum thog mtha' dbus med pa //
analyzed: lam gsum thog mtha' dbus med pa //
translated: The wheel of saṃsāra is like a firebrand’s wheel.🔽It is a mutual cause.🔽This is how saṃsāra revolves.🔽Since it is not obtained in terms of self, other, both, or the three times,

original: 'khor ba'i dkyil 'khor mgal me yi /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dkyil 'khor mgal me yi /
translated: the view of the transitory collection is exhausted.🔽Then karma and birth🔽are exhausted.🔽As the Precious Garland says:🔽As long as there is clinging to the aggregates,🔽there is the view of the transitory collection.🔽If there is the view of the transitory collection, there is karma.🔽From that, there is birth.🔽The three paths have no beginning, middle, or end.

original: dkyil 'khor lta bu phan tshun gyi //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor lta bu phan tshun gyi //
translated: The wheel of saṃsāra is like a firebrand’s wheel.🔽It is a mutual cause.

original: rgyu can 'di ni 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu can 'di ni 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: This is how saṃsāra revolves.🔽Since it is not obtained in terms of self, other, both, or the three times,

original: de ni rang gzhan gnyis ka dang // dus gsum nyid du 'ang ma thob phyir //
analyzed: de ni rang gzhan gnyis ka dang // dus gsum nyid du 'ang ma thob phyir //
translated: the view of the transitory collection is exhausted.🔽Then karma and birth🔽are exhausted.🔽As the Precious Garland says:

original: ngar 'dzin pa ni zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa ni zad par 'gyur //
translated: As long as there is clinging to the aggregates,🔽there is the view of the transitory collection.🔽If there is the view of the transitory collection, there is karma.

original: de nas las dang skye ba dang // zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas las dang skye ba dang // zhes gsungs so //
translated: From that, there is birth.🔽The three paths have no beginning, middle, or end.🔽The wheel of saṃsāra is like a firebrand’s wheel.🔽It is a mutual cause.🔽This is how saṃsāra revolves.🔽Since it is not obtained in terms of self, other, both, or the three times,🔽the view of the transitory collection is exhausted.🔽Then karma and birth🔽are exhausted.🔽As the Precious Garland says:🔽As long as there is clinging to the aggregates,

original: yang ji ltar mig ni 'khrul pa yis /
analyzed: yang ji ltar mig ni 'khrul pa yis /
translated: there is the view of the transitory collection.🔽If there is the view of the transitory collection, there is karma.🔽From that, there is birth.🔽The three paths

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo 'dzin byed pa //🔽de bzhin dbang po rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo 'dzin byed pa // de bzhin dbang po rnams kyis ni //
translated: Whirled in a circle as a wheel,🔽So the senses apprehend their objects

original: de lta'i yul dag 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: de lta'i yul dag 'dzin par byed //
translated: In a manner that is similarly deceptive.

original: dbang po dang ni dbang don rnams //
analyzed: dbang po dang ni dbang don rnams //
translated: The senses and their objects

original: 'byung ba lnga yi rang bzhin 'dod //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga yi rang bzhin 'dod //
translated: Are held to be composed of the five elements.

original: 'byung ba so sor don med pas //
analyzed: 'byung ba so sor don med pas //
translated: But since the elements individually have no substance,

original: 'di dag don du don med do //
analyzed: 'di dag don du don med do //
translated: They are in reality without substance.

original: 'byung rnams so sor tha dad na //
analyzed: 'byung rnams so sor tha dad na //
translated: If the elements were distinct from each other,

original: bud shing med pa'i mer thal 'gyur //
analyzed: bud shing med pa'i mer thal 'gyur //
translated: It would follow that fire could exist without fuel.

original: 'dus na mtshan nyid med 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'dus na mtshan nyid med 'gyur te //
translated: If they were combined, they would be without defining characteristics,

original: lhag ma la yang de ltar nges //🔽de ltar 'byung rnams rnam gnyis su'ang //
analyzed: lhag ma la yang de ltar nges // de ltar 'byung rnams rnam gnyis su'ang //
translated: And the same is true of the remaining elements.🔽Thus, since the elements are devoid of substance

original: don med pas na 'dus don med //
analyzed: don med pas na 'dus don med //
translated: In both of these ways, their combination is nonsubstantial.

original: 'dus pa don med nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'dus pa don med nyid kyi phyir /
translated: And since the combination is nonsubstantial,

original: gzugs kyang don du don med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyang don du don med do //
translated: Form is also, in reality, without substance.🔽Consciousness, feeling, perception,

analyzed: ji skad du slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis / mtshan ma med pa ma rtogs par //

translated: At the time when the bodhisattva has attained the ground of joy,

analyzed: de las gzhan rnams med pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: sbyin pa de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu dang po yin no //

analyzed: rang sha ster la'ang gus par byas pa yi //

analyzed: snang du mi rung dpog pa'i rgyur yang gyur // de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de'i yon tan snang rung ma yin pas rtogs pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po stong pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid las gsal bar dpog par byed
translated: and are inferred from the reason of their invisibility.🔽At that time, the qualities of the bodhisattva are not visible, and so they are inferred from the reason of their realization, and so on.

original: pa yin te /
analyzed: pa yin te /
translated: They are clearly inferred from the inference of the emptiness of internal and external things.

original: du ba la sogs pa las me la sogs pa dag bzhin no //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa las me la sogs pa dag bzhin no //

analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa dang / gtan du @228b ba'i bde ba thob pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan par 'dod pas /
translated: in the same way, it is the cause of the happiness of ordinary beings, hearers, and solitary realizers, and the cause of the happiness of the bodhisattvas that is free of attachment.

original: skye bo 'di kun bde ba mngon 'dod cing //
analyzed: skye bo 'di kun bde ba mngon 'dod cing //
translated: All these people desire happiness,

original: mi rnams bde ba 'ang longs spyod med min la //
analyzed: mi rnams bde ba 'ang longs spyod med min la //
translated: and human happiness does not exist without resources.

original: longs spyod kyang ni sbyin las 'byung mkhyen nas //
analyzed: longs spyod kyang ni sbyin las 'byung mkhyen nas //
translated: Knowing that resources come from generosity,

original: thub pas dang por sbyin pa'i gtam mdzad do //🔽zhes bya ba smos pa la /
analyzed: thub pas dang por sbyin pa'i gtam mdzad do // zhes bya ba smos pa la /
translated: the Sage first taught the discourse on generosity.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa dang nad dang grang ba la sogs pa'i gnyen po //
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa dang nad dang grang ba la sogs pa'i gnyen po //
translated: The antidote to hunger, thirst, disease, cold, and so on,

original: sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa tsam srid pa'i bde ba 'byung ba'i rgyu 'ching ba phyin ci log tsam gyis bdag nyid kyi rgyun nye bar brtags pas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa tsam srid pa'i bde ba 'byung ba'i rgyu 'ching ba phyin ci log tsam gyis bdag nyid kyi rgyun nye bar brtags pas /
translated: the mere alleviation of suffering, is the cause of the happiness of cyclic existence. It is merely a mistaken conception that the continuum of one’s own self is the cause of happiness.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba bsal ba bde ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid la 'jig rten shin tu ches mngon par zhen la ;
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba bsal ba bde ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid la 'jig rten shin tu ches mngon par zhen la ;
translated: The world is extremely attached to the mere removal of harm as being the nature of happiness.

original: de lta bu'i bde ba mngon par 'dod pa de'i bde ba sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa tsam gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bde ba mngon par 'dod pa de'i bde ba sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa tsam gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The nature of the happiness that is the mere alleviation of suffering is

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul longs spyod sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por gyur pa /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul longs spyod sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por gyur pa /
translated: The object of enjoyment that is desired is the antidote to suffering.

original: phyin ci log gi bdag nyid can longs spyad pa med par skye bar ma dmigs so //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi bdag nyid can longs spyad pa med par skye bar ma dmigs so //
translated: He does not see that the enjoyment of desired objects, which is the antidote to suffering, arises without being enjoyed, having the nature of error.

original: sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i yul de dag kyang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ma bsags pa rnams la mi 'byung ngo snyam du mkhyen nas /

translated: He knows that those objects which are the cause of the remedy for suffering do not arise for those who have not accumulated the bases of meritorious action that arise from generosity.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bsam pa'i rang bzhin mkhyen pas tshul khrims la sogs pa'i gtam rnams pas ches thog mar sbyin pa'i gtam nyid mdzad do //🔽da ni stong pa po'i sems can tshul dang mi mthun pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bsam pa'i rang bzhin mkhyen pas tshul khrims la sogs pa'i gtam rnams pas ches thog mar sbyin pa'i gtam nyid mdzad do // da ni stong pa po'i sems can tshul dang mi mthun pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: The Lord, knowing the nature of the thoughts of all beings without exception, first of all taught the discourse on generosity, rather than the discourse on morality and so forth.

original: rang gi bya ba dang rjes su mthun pas sbyin pa'i bdag nyid chen po brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi bya ba dang rjes su mthun pas sbyin pa'i bdag nyid chen po brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to express the greatness of generosity, which is in accord with one's own actions, even though beings are empty and their minds are not in accord,🔽he says:

original: snying rje dman zhing shin tu rtsub sems can //
analyzed: snying rje dman zhing shin tu rtsub sems can //
translated: Those with inferior compassion and very harsh minds,

original: rang don lhur len nyid du gyur pa gang //
analyzed: rang don lhur len nyid du gyur pa gang //
translated: Those who are intent on their own welfare

original: de dag gi yang 'dod pa'i longs spyod rnams //🔽sdug bsngal nyer zhi'i rgyur gyur sbyin las byung /
analyzed: de dag gi yang 'dod pa'i longs spyod rnams // sdug bsngal nyer zhi'i rgyur gyur sbyin las byung /
translated: Even for them, the enjoyment of their desired objects

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Arises from generosity, which is the cause of the pacification of suffering.

original: gang dag tshong pa bzhin du nor ches nyung du btang ba las 'bras bu nor gyi phung po ches yangs pa 'dod pa don du gnyer ba bas kyang lhag par don du gnyer bar gyur cing sbyin par 'dod par gus kyi /
analyzed: gang dag tshong pa bzhin du nor ches nyung du btang ba las 'bras bu nor gyi phung po ches yangs pa 'dod pa don du gnyer ba bas kyang lhag par don du gnyer bar gyur cing sbyin par 'dod par gus kyi /
translated: Those who, like merchants, seek even more than they desire in the form of vast heaps of wealth as the result of giving a small amount of wealth, and who are respectful in their desire to give,

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sras rnams ltar snying rje'i gzhan gyi dbang gis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu don du mi gnyer ba kho nar sbyin par 'dod pa'i dga' ston mngon par 'phel bar mi byed pa de dag la yang /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sras rnams ltar snying rje'i gzhan gyi dbang gis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu don du mi gnyer ba kho nar sbyin par 'dod pa'i dga' ston mngon par 'phel bar mi byed pa de dag la yang /
translated: unlike the heirs of the sugatas, who, through compassion, do not seek the results of generosity, and who do not increase the festival of generosity,

original: sbyin pa'i skyon 'dzin pa la rgyab kyis phyogs @229a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i skyon 'dzin pa la rgyab kyis phyogs @229a * //
translated: for them, the fault of generosity is turned away from.

original: pa yon tan tsam 'dzin pa la g-yer bag thob pa des /
analyzed: pa yon tan tsam 'dzin pa la g-yer bag thob pa des /
translated: Those who are proud of merely holding the qualities

original: longs spyod phul du byung ba phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas lus kyi sdug bsngal yid du mi 'ong ba bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa 'joms par byed pas sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod phul du byung ba phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas lus kyi sdug bsngal yid du mi 'ong ba bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa 'joms par byed pas sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of perfect, excellent enjoyment, one conquers the unpleasant bodily suffering of hunger, thirst, and so on. Thus, generosity is the cause of the pacification of suffering.

original: gang zhig snying rje dang bral bas rang gi sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa la ltos pa nyid kyis sbyin par 'dod par gus pa 'di yang /🔽'di yang sbyin pa'i skabs kyis nam zhig tshe //
analyzed: gang zhig snying rje dang bral bas rang gi sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa la ltos pa nyid kyis sbyin par 'dod par gus pa 'di yang / 'di yang sbyin pa'i skabs kyis nam zhig tshe //
translated: Even if one wishes to give out of respect for the antidote to one's own suffering, due to a lack of compassion,🔽one will quickly obtain

original: 'phags pa'i skye ba dang phrad myur du 'thob //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye ba dang phrad myur du 'thob //
translated: the birth of an ārya.

original: de nas srid rgyun yang dag bcad byas te //
analyzed: de nas srid rgyun yang dag bcad byas te //
translated: Then, having severed the continuum of existence,

original: de yi rgyu can zhi bar 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi rgyu can zhi bar 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: one will go to peace, which is caused by that.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //🔽sbyin bdag gtong ba po'i thad du dam pa dag gis bgrod pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so // sbyin bdag gtong ba po'i thad du dam pa dag gis bgrod pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: This is what is said.🔽The noble ones go to the side of the giver, the one who gives.

original: sbyin pa la lhag par mos pa ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa la lhag par mos pa ni /
translated: Thus, one should have intense interest in generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i skabs kyis 'phags pa'i skye ba dang phrad pas des nye bar bston  pa las 'khor ba la yon tan med par rig cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i skabs kyis 'phags pa'i skye ba dang phrad pas des nye bar bston  pa las 'khor ba la yon tan med par rig cing /
translated: Since they encounter the birth of an ārya through the occasion of generosity, they know that saṃsāra has no good qualities through the teaching of the āryas.

original: 'phags pa'i lam dri ma med pa mngon du byas pas sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i ma rig pa spangs nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dri ma med pa mngon du byas pas sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i ma rig pa spangs nas /
translated: Since they manifest the stainless ārya path, they abandon the ignorance that is the pacification of suffering.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyun skye ba dang 'chi ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug pa dor te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyun skye ba dang 'chi ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug pa dor te /
translated: They cast off the continuum of saṃsāra, the succession from one birth and death to another, which has been occurring since beginningless time.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They attain nirvāṇa through the vehicle of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de lta na re zhig byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa rnams kyi sbyin pa 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de lta na re zhig byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa rnams kyi sbyin pa 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, generosity of those who are not bodhisattvas is the cause for attaining the happiness of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: 'gro ba phan par dam bcas yid can rnams //
analyzed: 'gro ba phan par dam bcas yid can rnams //
translated: Those whose minds are committed to helping migrating beings

original: sbyin pas ring por mi thogs dga' ba thob //
analyzed: sbyin pas ring por mi thogs dga' ba thob //
translated: attain joy through generosity without delay.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa rnams ni sbyin pa dang dus mnyam du ji skad bshad pa'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu nges par longs spyod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa rnams ni sbyin pa dang dus mnyam du ji skad bshad pa'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu nges par longs spyod pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who are not bodhisattvas do not definitely enjoy the results of generosity as they are explained, simultaneously with the generosity.

original: des na de rnams ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir sbyin pa la mi 'jug pa yang srid na /
analyzed: des na de rnams ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir sbyin pa la mi 'jug pa yang srid na /
translated: Therefore, since they do not directly experience the results of generosity, it is possible that they will not engage in generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sbyin pa dang dus mnyam pa kho nar don du gnyer ba'i yang yongs su tshim par byas pa las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sbyin pa dang dus mnyam pa kho nar don du gnyer ba'i yang yongs su tshim par byas pa las /
translated: But bodhisattvas, simultaneously with generosity, satisfy those who are in need,

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa mchog tu dga' ba 'chang zhing /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa mchog tu dga' ba 'chang zhing /
translated: and they experience the results of generosity that they desire, the perfect joy of supreme delight.

original: de nyid du sbyin pa'i 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod do //
analyzed: de nyid du sbyin pa'i 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod do //
translated: They enjoy the results of generosity right then and there.

original: de'i phyir dus thams cad kyi tshe sbyin pa la dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus thams cad kyi tshe sbyin pa la dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they delight in generosity at all times.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ji @229b skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ji @229b skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: Thus, in accordance with the explanation,

original: gang phyir brtse bdag brtse bdag ma yin pa //
analyzed: gang phyir brtse bdag brtse bdag ma yin pa //
translated: the compassionate one, not the noncompassionate one,

original: thams cad kyi mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i rgyu sbyin pa yin pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyi mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i rgyu sbyin pa yin pa /
translated: Generosity is the cause of the higher realms and definite excellence for all.

original: de phyir sbyin pa'i gtam nyid rtsa ba yin //
analyzed: de phyir sbyin pa'i gtam nyid rtsa ba yin //
translated: Therefore, the discourse on generosity is the root.

original: gang las de rnams dus rtag tu sbyin pa la gus par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang las de rnams dus rtag tu sbyin pa la gus par 'gyur ba /
translated: How is it that they always respect generosity?

original: don du gnyer ba rnams longs spyod kyis rnam par 'ged pa'i sgo nas yid tshim par byed pa na /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba rnams longs spyod kyis rnam par 'ged pa'i sgo nas yid tshim par byed pa na /
translated: When they satisfy the desires of those who seek their help by distributing their wealth,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dga' ba'i khyad par skye ba ko ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dga' ba'i khyad par skye ba ko ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: what kind of special joy arises in the bodhisattvas?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: This will now be explained.🔽The joy that arises in the victors' children

original: ji ltar byin cig ces sgra thos bsams las /🔽rgyal sras bde 'byung de ltar thub rnams la //
analyzed: ji ltar byin cig ces sgra thos bsams las / rgyal sras bde 'byung de ltar thub rnams la //
translated: when they hear the words give me

original: zhi ba zhugs pas bde ba byin min na //
analyzed: zhi ba zhugs pas bde ba byin min na //
translated: is not produced by the bliss of entering🔽the meditative concentration of peace.

original: thams cad btang bas lta zhig smos ci dgos //
analyzed: thams cad btang bas lta zhig smos ci dgos //
translated: What need is there to mention their giving everything away?🔽When those who seek their help merely hear the words give me,

original: re zhig don du gnyer ba rnams kyis byin cig ces bya ba'i sgra thos pa nyid sems par byed pa na /
analyzed: re zhig don du gnyer ba rnams kyis byin cig ces bya ba'i sgra thos pa nyid sems par byed pa na /
translated: the bodhisattvas' joy is greater🔽than the bliss of the meditative concentration of peace.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'di dag ni bdag la slong ba zhig go snyam du rtogs nas yang nas yang du bde ba 'byung ba gang yin pa de nyid je mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba bas kyang phul du byung ba dang bcas pa yin na🔽/ phyi dang nang gi dngos po btang bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'di dag ni bdag la slong ba zhig go snyam du rtogs nas yang nas yang du bde ba 'byung ba gang yin pa de nyid je mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba bas kyang phul du byung ba dang bcas pa yin na / phyi dang nang gi dngos po btang bas /
translated: This bliss is even greater than the bliss of nirvana.

original: don du gnyer ba'i skye bo tshim par byed pa rnams kyi lta ci smos /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba'i skye bo tshim par byed pa rnams kyi lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention those who satisfy the hopes of those who seek their external and internal things by giving them away?

original: yang ci gang las de skad brjod pa phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lus kyi sdug bsngal yang mi 'byung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci gang las de skad brjod pa phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lus kyi sdug bsngal yang mi 'byung ngam zhe na /

original: bshad pa / bdag nyid chen po rnams la ni sems med pa rnams bcad pa ltar lus kyi sdug bsngal 'byung ba mi srid pa nyid de /
analyzed: bshad pa / bdag nyid chen po rnams la ni sems med pa rnams bcad pa ltar lus kyi sdug bsngal 'byung ba mi srid pa nyid de /
translated: It is impossible for the great beings to experience physical suffering, as if they were mindless beings who had been cut up.

original: 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin las /
analyzed: 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin las /
translated: As it says in the noble Gaganagañja Sūtra,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is like this.

original: dper na shing s'a la chen po'i tshal zhig yod la /
analyzed: dper na shing s'a la chen po'i tshal zhig yod la /
translated: For example, there is a great forest of sāla trees.

original: der 'ga' zhig 'ongs nas s'a la gcig bcad pa na /
analyzed: der 'ga' zhig 'ongs nas s'a la gcig bcad pa na /
translated: If someone comes and cuts down one sāla tree,

original: der shing s'a la lhag ma de rnams 'di snyam du 'di ni bcad pa'o //
analyzed: der shing s'a la lhag ma de rnams 'di snyam du 'di ni bcad pa'o //
translated: the remaining sāla trees do not think, “This one was cut down.

original: bdag cag ni ma bcad pa'o snyam du mi sems shing /
analyzed: bdag cag ni ma bcad pa'o snyam du mi sems shing /
translated: We were not cut down.”

original: de dag la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med do //
analyzed: de dag la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med do //
translated: They are without attachment and aversion.

original: rtog pa dang ; rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ; rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: They are without conceptualization and discrimination.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni bzod pa yongs su dag pa mchog nam mkha' dang mnyam pa yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni bzod pa yongs su dag pa mchog nam mkha' dang mnyam pa yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The bodhisattva’s patience like that is the highest pure patience, equal to space.”

original: rin po che'i phreng ba las kyang /
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng ba las kyang /
translated: Also, Nāgārjuna’s Precious Garland says:

analyzed: de la lus kyi sdug bsngal med // yid kyi sdug bsngal @230a * //

analyzed: ga la yod // de ni snying rjes 'jig rten sdug / de nyid kyis ni yun ring gnas //

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: yang chags pa med pa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa gang zhig la lus gnas pa dang 'gal ba'i yul yang dag par babs pas lus kyi sdug bsngal gdon mi za bar 'byung ba de'i tshe de yang sems can gyi don bya ba dag la ches lhag par 'jug

translated: Bodhisattvas see that beings are immersed in the unbearable states of existence of the hells, the animal realm, the world of Yama, and so on, where their bodies are being destroyed by extremely intense and constant suffering.

original: rang gi lus gcod pa'i sdug bsngal bas stong 'gyur bas kyang ches lhag par 'phel ba'i sdug bsngal ba sran du med pa dang ldan pa dag la rang gi sdug bsngal myong ba nyid du lta ba na rang gi lus gcod pa'i sdug bsngal la /

analyzed: de la pha rol zhes bya ba ni gang 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i phar 'gram dang ngogs te //
translated: Therein, the other shore is the far shore and bank of the ocean of samsara.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pa'i rang bzhin mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas nyid do //

original: mi dmigs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir la /
translated: Nonperception is supramundane because it transcends the world.

original: dmigs pa ni tha snyad kyi bden pas bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni tha snyad kyi bden pas bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Perception is mundane because it is included in the conventional truth.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa dag gis shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa dag gis shes par mi nus so //
translated: This is not something that those who have not attained the stage of a bodhisattva can understand.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / gsum po dag la chags skyes gyur pas de //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gsum po dag la chags skyes gyur pas de //
translated: The one who is attached to the three

original: 'jig rten pa yi pha rol phyin zhes bstan //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi pha rol phyin zhes bstan //
translated: Is said to have a mundane perfection.

original: sbyin pa de nyid gsum du dmigs pa yod na 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar bsnyad do //
analyzed: sbyin pa de nyid gsum du dmigs pa yod na 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar bsnyad do //
translated: If that generosity is observed as the three, it is called a mundane perfection.

original: da ni ji skad brjod pa'i sa zhes bya ba shes pa'i khyad par gyi phul du byung ba'i yon tan rjes su brjod pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ji skad brjod pa'i sa zhes bya ba shes pa'i khyad par gyi phul du byung ba'i yon tan rjes su brjod pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach by way of describing the special qualities of the superior knowledge called the ground as it has been explained,🔽it is said:

original: de ltar rgyal ba'i sras kyi yid la rab gnas shing //🔽dam pa'i rten la 'od chags mdzes pa rnyed gyur pa'i //
analyzed: de ltar rgyal ba'i sras kyi yid la rab gnas shing // dam pa'i rten la 'od chags mdzes pa rnyed gyur pa'i //
translated: Thus, well established in the mind of the Victor’s Son,🔽this joy, which is beautiful with the luster of the support of the holy,

original: dga' ba 'di ni nor bu chu shel ji bzhin du //🔽mun pa stug po thams cad rnam par bsal nas rgyal //
analyzed: dga' ba 'di ni nor bu chu shel ji bzhin du // mun pa stug po thams cad rnam par bsal nas rgyal //
translated: like a water-cleansing gem,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: having completely cleared away all the thick darkness, is victorious.

original: de ltar gyi sgra ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyi sgra ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “thus” is for the purpose of teaching the aspect as it has been explained.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sa'i ming yang dag par sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sa'i ming yang dag par sgrogs pa'o //
translated: “ Joy” is the proclamation of the name of the ground.

original: rgyal zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs pham par byas nas gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyal zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs pham par byas nas gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ Victorious” means that, having defeated the opposing side, one remains.

original: de ni shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis rgyal ba'i sras kyi yid la gnas pa'i phyir mthon por gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis rgyal ba'i sras kyi yid la gnas pa'i phyir mthon por gnas pa yin te /
translated: It is high, because it is the nature of consciousness, and thus it abides in the mind of the Bodhisattva.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis mun pa stug po thams cad kyang rnam par bsal te rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis mun pa stug po thams cad kyang rnam par bsal te rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The first ground, the Joyful One, is victorious, in the manner explained, over all the thick darkness.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i don nyid dpes gsal bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i don nyid dpes gsal bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of what has been explained, the text says:

original: nor bu chu shel ji bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nor bu chu shel ji bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just like a water-purifying gem.

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba sems bskyed pa dang po'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa dang po @231a * //
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba sems bskyed pa dang po'o // byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa dang po @231a * //
translated: This completes the first ground or stage in the cultivation of absolute bodhichitta, called the Joyful One, from the commentary entitled “The Light of the Middle Way.”

original: bshad zin to /
analyzed: bshad zin to /
translated: The first ground or stage in the cultivation of absolute bodhichitta has now been explained.🔽The second ground

original: // / da ni gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: // / da ni gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The second ground is called The Stainless.

original: de tshul phun tshogs yon tan dag ldan phyir //
analyzed: de tshul phun tshogs yon tan dag ldan phyir //
translated: The Bodhisattvas on this ground are endowed with perfect discipline.

original: rmi lam du yang 'chal khrims dri ma spangs //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rmi lam du yang 'chal khrims dri ma spangs //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Even in their dreams, they never transgress the rules of discipline.

original: sa zhes bya ba shes pa'i khyad par thams cad ni rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba shes pa'i khyad par thams cad ni rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The stages are the distinctive states of consciousness, and they are all of one nature.

original: de med na mi 'byung ba'i yon tan tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa phul du byung ba nyid las sems bskyed pa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i khyad par ston par byed do //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba'i yon tan tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa phul du byung ba nyid las sems bskyed pa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i khyad par ston par byed do //
translated: When that is absent, the distinctive states of the second generation of the mind of enlightenment and so on are taught, due to the excellence of the transcendent perfection of morality and so on, which are qualities that do not occur in its absence.

original: de la nyon mongs pa dang du mi len pa'i phyir dang / sdig pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir sems yid la gcags pa'i me zhi bas bsil ba nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa dang du mi len pa'i phyir dang / sdig pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir sems yid la gcags pa'i me zhi bas bsil ba nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: Morality is so called because it is the cause of bliss, since it is the pacification of the fire of regret due to not indulging in the afflictions and due to not engaging in vile actions.

original: bde ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis dam pa dag gis bsten par bya ba nyid kyi phyir na tshul khrims te de yang spong ba bdun gyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis dam pa dag gis bsten par bya ba nyid kyi phyir na tshul khrims te de yang spong ba bdun gyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: It is also the cause of bliss because it is the basis of the highest beings, since it is the cause of bliss. It has the nature of the seven relinquishments.

original: chos gsum po ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang yang dag pa'i lta ba ni de dag kun nas slong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chos gsum po ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang yang dag pa'i lta ba ni de dag kun nas slong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The three qualities of nonattachment, nonaversion, and correct view are its motivating factors.

original: de'i phyir kun nas slong bar byed pa dang bcas pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas las kyi lam bcur rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun nas slong bar byed pa dang bcas pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas las kyi lam bcur rnam par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the ten courses of action are explained from the perspective of morality that is motivated.

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa ni tshul khrims rab tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa ni tshul khrims rab tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the transformation of morality.

original: yon tan rnam par dag pa ni yon tan dag pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan rnam par dag pa ni yon tan dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of good qualities is the purity of good qualities.

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “the perfection of the purity of morality” is a compound.

original: rang gi yon tan yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir tshul khrims nyid khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi yon tan yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir tshul khrims nyid khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: Morality itself is superior because it is the purity of one’s own good qualities.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su yang tshul khrims 'chal ba'i dri ma dag gis mi gos pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su yang tshul khrims 'chal ba'i dri ma dag gis mi gos pa'o //
translated: Because he possesses that, even in the state of dreaming, that bodhisattva is not stained by the impurity of immorality.

original: yang ji ltar na de de ltar tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas yon tan yongs su dag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de de ltar tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas yon tan yongs su dag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how does he become one who has the purity of good qualities through the perfection of morality?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa la rab tu gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa la rab tu gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is established in the second bodhisattva stage

original: lus ngag yid kyi rgyu ba dag gyur pas //
analyzed: lus ngag yid kyi rgyu ba dag gyur pas //
translated: has purified the movement of body, speech, and mind.🔽He is engaged in all ten of the holy paths of action.

original: dam pa'i las lam bcu char sogs par byed /🔽ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa las /
analyzed: dam pa'i las lam bcu char sogs par byed / ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa las /
translated: As it says in the Sutra of the Ten Stages,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma med pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis srog gcod pa spangs pa yin te /🔽dbyig pa spangs /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma med pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis srog gcod pa spangs pa yin te / dbyig pa spangs /
translated: “O sons of the Conqueror! The bodhisattva who is established in the second bodhisattva stage, the Immaculate, is naturally free of killing.

original: mtshon cha spangs /
analyzed: mtshon cha spangs /
translated: He has abandoned sticks and weapons.

original: 'khon du 'dzin pa spangs nas /
analyzed: 'khon du 'dzin pa spangs nas /
translated: He has abandoned enmity.

original: 'jem @231b pa dang ldan zhing snying rje la zhugs pas /
analyzed: 'jem @231b pa dang ldan zhing snying rje la zhugs pas /
translated: He is gentle and compassionate.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.

original: de srog chags 'byung po thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba dang / snying brtse ba dang / byams pa'i sems dang ldan te /🔽de kun tu rtog pa tsam gyis kyang /
analyzed: de srog chags 'byung po thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba dang / snying brtse ba dang / byams pa'i sems dang ldan te / de kun tu rtog pa tsam gyis kyang /
translated: He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.🔽He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.

original: srog chags la rnam par 'tshe bar mi byed na /
analyzed: srog chags la rnam par 'tshe bar mi byed na /
translated: He has a mind of love and affection for all living beings.

original: sems can gzhan la sems can du 'du shes shing ched du bsams te /
analyzed: sems can gzhan la sems can du 'du shes shing ched du bsams te /
translated: What need is there to mention that he would not intentionally and with the perception of a sentient being

original: lus kyi mtho 'tshams pa chen po bya ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: lus kyi mtho 'tshams pa chen po bya ba lta ci smos /
translated: harm another sentient being?

original: ma byin par len pa spangs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa spangs pa yang yin te /
translated: “He has given up taking what is not given.

original: bdag gi longs spyod kyis chog shes shing snying brtse ba dang ldan te /
analyzed: bdag gi longs spyod kyis chog shes shing snying brtse ba dang ldan te /
translated: He is content with his own wealth and is compassionate.🔽He is careful about the wealth of others.
