original: gzhan gyi longs spyod la bag byed pas de gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po dag la gzhan gyis bzung bar 'du shes shing /🔽rku sems nye bar gzhag ste tha na {rtsva} dang lo ma tsam yang ma byin par mi len na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi longs spyod la bag byed pas de gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po dag la gzhan gyis bzung bar 'du shes shing / rku sems nye bar gzhag ste tha na {rtsva} dang lo ma tsam yang ma byin par mi len na /
translated: He has the perception that things are owned by others.

original: 'tsho ba'i yo byad gzhan dag lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i yo byad gzhan dag lta ci smos /
translated: He is careful to avoid the thought of stealing, and he does not take without permission even grass or leaves, let alone other things that are necessary for life.

original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa spangs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa spangs pa yang yin te /
translated: “He has given up sexual misconduct.

original: bdag gi chung mas chog shes shing /
analyzed: bdag gi chung mas chog shes shing /
translated: He is content with his own wife.

original: gzhan gyi chung ma la 'dod pa med pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi chung ma la 'dod pa med pas /
translated: He has no desire for the wives of others.

original: de gzhan gyis bzung ba'i bud med gzhan gyi chung ma dang / rus dang / mtshan dang / chos kyis bsrungs pa rnams la chags sems kyang mi bskyed na /🔽yan lag ma yin pa'i rnam par rig byed dam /
analyzed: de gzhan gyis bzung ba'i bud med gzhan gyi chung ma dang / rus dang / mtshan dang / chos kyis bsrungs pa rnams la chags sems kyang mi bskyed na / yan lag ma yin pa'i rnam par rig byed dam /
translated: He does not even arouse thoughts of desire for other women who are the wives of others, who are protected by their family, or who are protected by Dharma.🔽What need is there to mention that he does not engage in any sexual activity with a woman who is not available,

original: gnyis kyi dbang po gnyis sprod pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gnyis kyi dbang po gnyis sprod pa lta ci smos /
translated: or that he does not engage in sexual intercourse with a woman who is available?

original: brdzun du smra ba spangs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba spangs pa yang yin te /
translated: He has abandoned lying.

original: bden par smra zhing yang dag par smra la /
analyzed: bden par smra zhing yang dag par smra la /
translated: He speaks the truth, speaks correctly,

original: dus su smra ste /
analyzed: dus su smra ste /
translated: and speaks at the right time.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa'o //
translated: He does what he says he will do.

original: de tha na rmi lam na yang lta ba dang bzod pa dang 'dod pa dang rab tu rtog pa bsgyur te /🔽bslu ba'i bsam pas brdzun gyi tshig mi smra na /
analyzed: de tha na rmi lam na yang lta ba dang bzod pa dang 'dod pa dang rab tu rtog pa bsgyur te / bslu ba'i bsam pas brdzun gyi tshig mi smra na /
translated: Even in his dreams he does not deceive others by changing his views, opinions, desires, or thoughts.

original: ched du bsams te smra ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: ched du bsams te smra ba lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention that he does not intentionally tell lies?

original: phra ma'i tshig spangs ba yin te /🔽sems can rnams la dbyen mi byed cing /
analyzed: phra ma'i tshig spangs ba yin te / sems can rnams la dbyen mi byed cing /
translated: He has abandoned divisive speech.🔽He does not cause division among sentient beings.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba la zhugs pas /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba la zhugs pas /
translated: He does not engage in violence.

original: des de dag dbye ba'i phyir tshu gi las thos nas pha gir snyod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des de dag dbye ba'i phyir tshu gi las thos nas pha gir snyod pa ma yin te /
translated: He does not say, “I heard it from the other side,” in order to divide those who are united.

original: de dag dbye ba'i phyir tha gi las thos nas tshu gir snyod pa ma yin te /🔽'dum pa rnams mi 'byed cing /🔽bye ba rnams la yang mi gnon te /
analyzed: de dag dbye ba'i phyir tha gi las thos nas tshu gir snyod pa ma yin te / 'dum pa rnams mi 'byed cing / bye ba rnams la yang mi gnon te /
translated: He does not say, “I heard it from this side,” in order to divide those who are divided.🔽He does not cause division among those who are united.🔽He does not delight in those who are divided.

original: mi 'dum pa la dga' zhing mi 'dum pa la mos pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: mi 'dum pa la dga' zhing mi 'dum pa la mos pa ma yin pas //
translated: He does not delight in or encourage disunity.

original: bden nam brdzun yang mi 'dum par bya ba'i tshig mi smra'o //
analyzed: bden nam brdzun yang mi 'dum par bya ba'i tshig mi smra'o //
translated: He does not speak words that cause disunity, whether true or false.

original: tshig rtsub mo spangs pa yin te /🔽zher 'debs pa dang / brlang pa dang / gzhan @232a * //
analyzed: tshig rtsub mo spangs pa yin te / zher 'debs pa dang / brlang pa dang / gzhan @232a * //
translated: He has given up harsh speech.🔽He does not insult, does not speak roughly,

original: la gnod pa dang / gzhan gyi mtshang 'bru ba dang / grong mi'i tshig dang / ma rabs kyi tshig ngor brjod pa dang / dor brjod par gzhol ba dang / brdzun dang rnar mi snyan pa dang / khro zhing gshe ba las byung ba dang /
analyzed: la gnod pa dang / gzhan gyi mtshang 'bru ba dang / grong mi'i tshig dang / ma rabs kyi tshig ngor brjod pa dang / dor brjod par gzhol ba dang / brdzun dang rnar mi snyan pa dang / khro zhing gshe ba las byung ba dang /
translated: does not speak words that hurt others, does not speak words that divide others against each other, does not speak words that are like a knife or a stick to others, does not speak words that are unwelcome, disagreeable, and displeasing to others, and does not speak words that are divisive, quarrelsome, and hurtful to others.

original: mi snyan pa dang / yid du mi 'ong bas snying na bar byed pa dang / yid gdung bar byed pa dang / rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud ma rungs par byed pa'i tshig rnam pa de lta bu spangs te /
analyzed: mi snyan pa dang / yid du mi 'ong bas snying na bar byed pa dang / yid gdung bar byed pa dang / rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud ma rungs par byed pa'i tshig rnam pa de lta bu spangs te /
translated: He avoids words that are unpleasant, disagreeable, and hurtful to the heart, that cause mental anguish, and that disturb one’s own mindstream and the mindstreams of others.

original: gang 'di mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / brdzun du ma yin pa dang / rnar snyan pa dang / snying du sdug pa dang / grong khyer ba dang / skye bo mang po'i snying du sdug pa dang /
analyzed: gang 'di mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / brdzun du ma yin pa dang / rnar snyan pa dang / snying du sdug pa dang / grong khyer ba dang / skye bo mang po'i snying du sdug pa dang /
translated: He speaks words that are gentle, soft, pleasant, truthful, pleasing to the ear, endearing, agreeable to the town, and dear to many people.

original: skye bo mang po'i yid du 'ong ba dang / yid dga' bar byed pa dang / yid tshim par byed pa dang / rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud dang bar byed pa'i tshig rnam pa de lta bu dag brjod do //
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i yid du 'ong ba dang / yid dga' bar byed pa dang / yid tshim par byed pa dang / rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud dang bar byed pa'i tshig rnam pa de lta bu dag brjod do //
translated: He speaks words that are agreeable to many people, that delight the mind, that satisfy the mind, and that bring harmony to his own mindstream and the mindstreams of others.

original: tshig 'khyal pa spang pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig 'khyal pa spang pa yin te /
translated: He avoids idle talk.

original: lan legs par glon pa'i tshig dang / dus su smra ba dang / yang dag par smra ba dang / don smra ba dang / chos smra ba dang / rigs par smra ba dang / phul bar smra ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: lan legs par glon pa'i tshig dang / dus su smra ba dang / yang dag par smra ba dang / don smra ba dang / chos smra ba dang / rigs par smra ba dang / phul bar smra ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: He speaks with words that are well-received, timely, true, meaningful,🔽dharmic, reasonable, and appropriate. He is patient,

original: dus dang rmed dang bcas pa'i tshig smra ba yin te /🔽de tha na bzhad gad du bya ba'i yongs su spang bar bya ba yang yongs su spong na /
analyzed: dus dang rmed dang bcas pa'i tshig smra ba yin te / de tha na bzhad gad du bya ba'i yongs su spang bar bya ba yang yongs su spong na /
translated: and speaks words that are timely and measured.🔽Even when it comes to things that are to be avoided for the sake of a joke,

original: tshig gis rnam par g-yeng ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: tshig gis rnam par g-yeng ba lta ci smos /
translated: he avoids them, let alone distracting words.

original: brnab sems med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: brnab sems med pa yang yin te /
translated: He is without covetousness.

original: de gzhan gyi nor dang / gzhan gyi 'dod pa dang / gzhan gyi rdzas dang / yo byad gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba la /
analyzed: de gzhan gyi nor dang / gzhan gyi 'dod pa dang / gzhan gyi rdzas dang / yo byad gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba la /
translated: He does not covet the wealth, desires, possessions, or property of others.

original: brnab sems mi bskyed la /
analyzed: brnab sems mi bskyed la /
translated: He is not attached,

original: chags par mi byed la /🔽mi smon te /
analyzed: chags par mi byed la / mi smon te /
translated: does not wish for them,

original: chags pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: chags pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: and does not give rise to a covetous mind.

original: gnod sems med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gnod sems med pa yang yin te /
translated: He is without ill will.

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / bde ba'i sems dang / 'jam pa'i sems dang / skye bo thams cad la phan gdags pa'i sems dang ldan pas khrong khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / bde ba'i sems dang / 'jam pa'i sems dang / skye bo thams cad la phan gdags pa'i sems dang ldan pas khrong khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang /
translated: They have a loving mind, a helpful mind, a compassionate mind, a happy mind, a gentle mind, and a mind to benefit all beings. They have abandoned anger, resentment,

original: tha ba dang / dri ma dang / gnod sems dang / khong khro ba sngon du 'gro ba gang dag yin pa de dag spangs te /
analyzed: tha ba dang / dri ma dang / gnod sems dang / khong khro ba sngon du 'gro ba gang dag yin pa de dag spangs te /
translated: hardness, stains, malice, and hostility.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag rtog pa yin no //
translated: They are loving and have understanding.

original: log par lta ba spangs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: log par lta ba spangs pa yang yin te /
translated: They have abandoned wrong views.

original: @232b yang dag par lta bar gyur la yang dag pa'i lam la gnas shing /
analyzed: @232b yang dag par lta bar gyur la yang dag pa'i lam la gnas shing /
translated: They have right views and abide in the right path.

original: dge mtshan dang bkra shis rnam pa sna tshogs dang / tshul khrims ngan pa'i lta ba can dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: dge mtshan dang bkra shis rnam pa sna tshogs dang / tshul khrims ngan pa'i lta ba can dang bral ba yin te /
translated: They are free from the views of bad ethics and various inauspicious signs.

original: lta ba drang zhing g-yo med la sgyu med pas /
analyzed: lta ba drang zhing g-yo med la sgyu med pas /
translated: They have an upright view, are without deceit, and are without pretense.

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang dge 'dun la bsam pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang dge 'dun la bsam pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: One is certain in one's thoughts about the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: de la dge ba'i las kyi lam dang po gsum ni lus kyis rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i las kyi lam dang po gsum ni lus kyis rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The first three of the ten paths of virtuous action are completed by the body.

original: bar gyi bzhi ni ngag gis so //
analyzed: bar gyi bzhi ni ngag gis so //
translated: The next four are completed by speech.

original: tha ma gsum ni yid kyis so //
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni yid kyis so //
translated: The last three are completed by the mind.

original: de ltar na dge ba'i las lam bcu char yang sog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge ba'i las lam bcu char yang sog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the ten paths of virtuous action are all completed by the mind.

original: yang ci las kyi lam 'di rnams sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas mi sog gam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci las kyi lam 'di rnams sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas mi sog gam zhe na /
translated: Do the bodhisattvas who have generated the first stage of the mind not complete these paths of action?

original: des kyang sog mod kyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: des kyang sog mod kyi 'on kyang /
translated: They do complete them, but

original: dge ba'i lam 'di lta zhig bcu char yang //
analyzed: dge ba'i lam 'di lta zhig bcu char yang //
translated: these ten paths of virtuous action

original: de la klags te shin tu dag par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la klags te shin tu dag par 'gyur //
translated: are completely purified for them.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa la ni ma yin no //🔽ston ka'i zla ltar rtag tu rnam dag ste //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa la ni ma yin no // ston ka'i zla ltar rtag tu rnam dag ste //
translated: They are not like that for the bodhisattvas who have generated the first stage of the mind.🔽They are always pure like the autumn moon,

original: zhi 'od chags par de dag gis rnam mdzes //
analyzed: zhi 'od chags par de dag gis rnam mdzes //
translated: and they are beautiful with the radiance of peace.

original: zhi ba ni dbang po bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni dbang po bsdams pa'o //
translated: Tranquility is the restraint of the senses.

original: 'od chags pa ni lham mer gsal ba'i lus can nyid do //
analyzed: 'od chags pa ni lham mer gsal ba'i lus can nyid do //
translated: Radiance is the body’s natural luminosity.

original: de ltar tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin yang /
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin yang /
translated: Even though one’s morality is thus pure,

original: gal te de ni khrims dag rang bzhin lta //
analyzed: gal te de ni khrims dag rang bzhin lta //
translated: if one sees it as the nature of pure morality,

original: de phyir de ni tshul khrims dag mi 'gyur //🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: de phyir de ni tshul khrims dag mi 'gyur // ji skad du /
translated: then one’s morality is not pure.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the noble Heap of Jewels:

original: 'od srungs 'di la dge slong kha cig tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di la dge slong kha cig tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Kāśyapa, some monks are moral,

original: so sor thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams shing gnas /
analyzed: so sor thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams shing gnas /
translated: restrained by the vow of individual liberation,

original: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa kha na ma tho ba phra rab rnams la yang 'jig par lta ba /
analyzed: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa kha na ma tho ba phra rab rnams la yang 'jig par lta ba /
translated: their conduct and sphere of activity perfect, seeing danger in the slightest transgression,

original: yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob cing lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gyur pas 'tsho ba yongs su dag kyang bdag tu smra ba yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob cing lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gyur pas 'tsho ba yongs su dag kyang bdag tu smra ba yin te /
translated: upholding the fundamental precepts and training rules, their physical, verbal, and mental actions completely pure, their livelihood pure, yet they are proponents of a self.

original: 'od srungs de ni tshul khrims 'chal ba /
analyzed: 'od srungs de ni tshul khrims 'chal ba /
translated: Kāśyapa, this is the first hypocrisy of those with unethical conduct,

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ltar bcos pa dang po zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ltar bcos pa dang po zhes bya ba nas /
translated: who pretend to have ethical conduct.

original: 'od srungs gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs kyang /
analyzed: 'od srungs gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs kyang /
translated: Kāśyapa, moreover, here some monks take up the twelve ascetic practices,

original: dmigs par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: dmigs par lta ba yin te /
translated: but they view them as objects.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa de ni /🔽'od srungs tshul khrims 'chal pa tshul khrims dang ldan @233a * //🔽pa ltar bcos pa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa de ni / 'od srungs tshul khrims 'chal pa tshul khrims dang ldan @233a * // pa ltar bcos pa bzhi pa ste /
translated: They abide in the grasping of “I” and “mine.”🔽Kāśyapa, this is the fourth hypocrisy of those with unethical conduct,

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //🔽de phyir de ni rtag tu gsum char la'ang //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so // de phyir de ni rtag tu gsum char la'ang //
translated: who pretend to have ethical conduct.🔽Therefore, they are always free from

original: gnyis blo'i rgyu ba yang dag bral bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis blo'i rgyu ba yang dag bral bar 'gyur //
translated: the movement of the mind of duality in all three.🔽The mind of duality, such as entity and nonentity, is free in all three—

original: sems can gang dag la spong bar byed pa dang gang zhig byed pa dang gang gis byed pa de gsum car la'ang dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi blo dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gang dag la spong bar byed pa dang gang zhig byed pa dang gang gis byed pa de gsum car la'ang dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi blo dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: those sentient beings who are abandoned, that which is abandoned, and that by which it is abandoned.

original: de ltar re zhig byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having described how bodhisattvas are endowed with perfect morality,

original: de'i 'og tu spyir de las gzhan pa rnams kyi tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang sbyin pa la sogs pa dag las kyang shin tu che ba nyid dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten nyid du gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽sbyin pas longs spyod dag ni 'gro ngan na 'ang //🔽skye bo tshul khrims rkang pa nyams la 'byung //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu spyir de las gzhan pa rnams kyi tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang sbyin pa la sogs pa dag las kyang shin tu che ba nyid dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten nyid du gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir / sbyin pas longs spyod dag ni 'gro ngan na 'ang // skye bo tshul khrims rkang pa nyams la 'byung //
translated: in order to show that, in general, perfect morality is superior to generosity and so on and is the basis of all excellent qualities,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the text says:🔽Even in the lower realms, generosity brings wealth

original: sbyin pa gang kho na las sbyin bdag tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur pa de la /
analyzed: sbyin pa gang kho na las sbyin bdag tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur pa de la /
translated: to those whose moral discipline is impaired.🔽The generosity that causes a generous person to be reborn in the lower realms

original: lha dang mi dag gi nang du khyad par du 'phags pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa 'byung ba de nyid tshul khrims kyi rkang pa dang bral ba las ngan 'gro'i 'gro bar ltung ba nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba dang ba lang dang /
analyzed: lha dang mi dag gi nang du khyad par du 'phags pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa 'byung ba de nyid tshul khrims kyi rkang pa dang bral ba las ngan 'gro'i 'gro bar ltung ba nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba dang ba lang dang /
translated: The result of generosity is the arising of perfect resources in the god and human realms.

original: rta dang / glang po che dang / spre'u dang / klu la sogs pa dang / yi dags rdzu 'phrul chen po can la sogs pa rnams su skyes pa de la longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa sna tshogs 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rta dang / glang po che dang / spre'u dang / klu la sogs pa dang / yi dags rdzu 'phrul chen po can la sogs pa rnams su skyes pa de la longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa sna tshogs 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: But if that generosity is divorced from the legs of discipline, one will fall to the lower realms and be born as a hell being, an animal, an asura, a human, or a god, and one will experience only the various perfect resources of those realms.

original: de'i phyir / bskyed bcas dngos 'du yongs su zad pas na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bskyed bcas dngos 'du yongs su zad pas na //
translated: Since the resources and their causes are exhausted,

original: phyin chad de la longs spyod 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: phyin chad de la longs spyod 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: from then on, resources will not arise.

original: gang zhig sa bon tshes nyung du btab nas 'bras bu rgya chen po 'byung ba rnyed cing slar yang 'bras bu'i ched du de bas kyang ches mang po'i sa bon 'debs par byed pa de la ni 'bras bu'i tshogs chen po dus ji lta ba bzhin du nye
analyzed: gang zhig sa bon tshes nyung du btab nas 'bras bu rgya chen po 'byung ba rnyed cing slar yang 'bras bu'i ched du de bas kyang ches mang po'i sa bon 'debs par byed pa de la ni 'bras bu'i tshogs chen po dus ji lta ba bzhin du nye
translated: Someone who plants a few seeds and then reaps a great harvest and then again plants even more seeds for the sake of future harvests will have a great harvest of results in the future.

original: bar 'phel bas rim pa rnam par chad pa med pa yong srid kyi /
analyzed: bar 'phel bas rim pa rnam par chad pa med pa yong srid kyi /
translated: The process will continue without interruption.

original: byas pa chung gson pa'i tshul can gang zhig blun pa nyid kyis sngar gyi sa bon tsam yang nye bar longs spyod pa de la ni skyed dang lhan cig tu dngos po 'du ba yang zad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byas pa chung gson pa'i tshul can gang zhig blun pa nyid kyis sngar gyi sa bon tsam yang nye bar longs spyod pa de la ni skyed dang lhan cig tu dngos po 'du ba yang zad pa'i phyir /
translated: But someone who is stingy and through stupidity does not even enjoy the seeds he has already planted will exhaust the things that accumulate with his production of results.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa skye ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa skye ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could he possibly produce a perfect future harvest?

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang bral ba'i phyir @233b gnas ma yin par longs spyod nye bar longs spyod pa la yang shin tu blun pas snga na med pa'i 'phen pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / sngar 'phangs pa ma lus par nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir phyis longs spyod dag 'byung ba mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang bral ba'i phyir @233b gnas ma yin par longs spyod nye bar longs spyod pa la yang shin tu blun pas snga na med pa'i 'phen pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / sngar 'phangs pa ma lus par nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir phyis longs spyod dag 'byung ba mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, because of being devoid of morality, when one enjoys the use of possessions in an improper way, because of being extremely foolish, one lacks the prior impetus and because one has used up the prior impetus, it is impossible for enjoyments to arise later.

original: tshul khrims kyi rkang pa dang bral ba 'di'i longs spyod 'byung ba rdzogs pa shin tu rnyed par dka' ba 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rkang pa dang bral ba 'di'i longs spyod 'byung ba rdzogs pa shin tu rnyed par dka' ba 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it extremely difficult for the enjoyments of one who is devoid of the support of morality to arise and be completed,

original: ngan 'gror song bas ngan 'gro las ldang ba yang shin tu rnyed par dka'o zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngan 'gror song bas ngan 'gro las ldang ba yang shin tu rnyed par dka'o zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: but it is also extremely difficult for one who has gone to a miserable realm to rise up from a miserable realm.🔽In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: gang tshe rang dbang 'jug cing mthun gnas pas //
analyzed: gang tshe rang dbang 'jug cing mthun gnas pas //
translated: When one has independence and lives in a favorable situation,

original: gal te 'di bdag 'dzin par mi byed na //
analyzed: gal te 'di bdag 'dzin par mi byed na //
translated: if one does not take hold of this opportunity,

original: g-yang sar ltung bas gzhan dbang 'jug 'gyur ba //
analyzed: g-yang sar ltung bas gzhan dbang 'jug 'gyur ba //
translated: one will fall into an abyss and be under the control of others.

original: de la phyi nas gang gis slong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de la phyi nas gang gis slong bar 'gyur //
translated: Who will rescue him from that?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says:

original: gal te 'di de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'di de'i tshe /
translated: If at that time

original: dpa' bo mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba ltar 'dod pas gzhan la rag ma las par 'jug cing /
analyzed: dpa' bo mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba ltar 'dod pas gzhan la rag ma las par 'jug cing /
translated: he is like a hero who is free from bondage living in a friendly land, and he is not dependent on others for his happiness,

original: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro bar gnas pa na /
analyzed: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro bar gnas pa na /
translated: and he is living in a happy migratory state as a god or human,

original: bdag nyid 'dzin par mi byed na /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dzin par mi byed na /
translated: and he does not take care of himself,

original: dpa' bo bcings nas ri sul ches chen por bskyur ba ltar /
analyzed: dpa' bo bcings nas ri sul ches chen por bskyur ba ltar /
translated: then like a hero who is bound and thrown into a deep ravine,

original: ngan 'gror song ba de phyi nas gang gis 'don par 'gyur /
analyzed: ngan 'gror song ba de phyi nas gang gis 'don par 'gyur /
translated: who will rescue him from that bad migratory state?

original: des na gnod par bya ba'i phyir ngan 'gro kho nar nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gnod par bya ba'i phyir ngan 'gro kho nar nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he will certainly go to a bad migratory state in order to be harmed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nas gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par sgrub ste zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nas gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par sgrub ste zhes gsungs so //
translated: For this very reason, it is said: “If he is born among humans, he establishes two results.”

original: gang gi phyir de ltar tshul khrims 'chal ba nyes ba'i tshogs shin tu mang po'i gnas su gyur pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar tshul khrims 'chal ba nyes ba'i tshogs shin tu mang po'i gnas su gyur pa /
translated: Because of this, the immoral person is the basis for a great mass of faults.

original: de phyir rgyal bas sbyin pa'i gtam mdzad nas //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal bas sbyin pa'i gtam mdzad nas //
translated: Therefore, the Victorious One, having taught the discourse on generosity,

original: tshul khrims rjes 'gro'i gtam nyid mdzad pa yin //🔽de nyid kyi phyir sdig pa'i chos mtha' dag pham par mdzad pa'i rgyal bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes 'gro'i gtam nyid mdzad pa yin // de nyid kyi phyir sdig pa'i chos mtha' dag pham par mdzad pa'i rgyal bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: taught the discourse on ethics.

original: sbyin pa'i gtam gyi dus kyi mjug thogs su tshul khrims kyi gtam kho na mdzad do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gtam gyi dus kyi mjug thogs su tshul khrims kyi gtam kho na mdzad do //
translated: For this very reason, the Victorious One, who has conquered all evil qualities, immediately after the discourse on generosity, taught the discourse on ethics in order to ensure that the qualities of generosity and so on are not wasted.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because,

original: yon tan tshul khrims zhing du rnam 'phel na //
analyzed: yon tan tshul khrims zhing du rnam 'phel na //
translated: when the qualities are cultivated in the field of ethics,

original: 'bras bu nyer spyod chad pa med par 'gyur //🔽yon tan thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyer spyod chad pa med par 'gyur // yon tan thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: the enjoyment of the fruits will be uninterrupted.

original: tshul khrims nyid kyi zhing ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyid kyi zhing ngo //
translated: Ethics is the field in which all the qualities are cultivated.

original: der sbyin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams rnam par 'phel ba na /🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu brgyud pa gong nas gong du rim pa rnam par ma chad pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu'i @234a * //
analyzed: der sbyin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams rnam par 'phel ba na / rgyu dang 'bras bu brgyud pa gong nas gong du rim pa rnam par ma chad pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu'i @234a * //
translated: When the qualities of generosity and so on are cultivated in that field,🔽the collection of fruits will increase

original: tshogs nye bar 'phel zhing /
analyzed: tshogs nye bar 'phel zhing /
translated: through the uninterrupted process of cause and effect.

original: dus ring por nye bar longs spyad par nus kyi /
analyzed: dus ring por nye bar longs spyad par nus kyi /
translated: It is possible to enjoy them for a long time,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not otherwise.

original: de'i phyir tshul 'dis /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul 'dis /
translated: Therefore, by this method,🔽for ordinary beings, for those born from the Buddha's speech,🔽for those who are certain in their own enlightenment,

original: so so'i skye bo rnams dang gsung skyes dang // rang byang chub la bdag nyid nges rnams dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi nges par legs pa dang// mngon mtho'i rgyu ni tshul khrims las gzhan med //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams dang gsung skyes dang // rang byang chub la bdag nyid nges rnams dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi nges par legs pa dang// mngon mtho'i rgyu ni tshul khrims las gzhan med //
translated: and for the Buddha's heirs, there is no cause for high rebirth or definite goodness other than morality.

original: ji skad du mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag bsten pa dang / mang du byas pa'i shas che bas ni sems can dmyal ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag bsten pa dang / mang du byas pa'i shas che bas ni sems can dmyal ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: As it is said, By relying on and frequently engaging in these ten unwholesome courses of action, the greatest degree leads to rebirth as a hell being,

original: 'bring gis ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bring gis ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: the medium degree leads to rebirth as an animal,

original: chung dus ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung dus ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: and the lesser degree leads to rebirth in the world of Yama.

original: de la srog gcod pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do //
analyzed: de la srog gcod pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do //
translated: Among them, killing leads to rebirth as a hell being,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su khrid do //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su khrid do //
translated: leading to rebirth as an animal,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do //
translated: leading to rebirth in the world of Yama.

original: de nas gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: de nas gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: Then, if born among humans, one establishes two karmic maturations:

original: tshe thung ba dang / nad mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe thung ba dang / nad mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: a short life and many illnesses.🔽Through stealing, one is led to the hells and so on up to:🔽one has few resources and resources that are shared with others.

original: ma byin par len pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas longs spyod chung ba dang / thun mong gi longs spyod du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ma byin par len pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas longs spyod chung ba dang / thun mong gi longs spyod du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Through sexual misconduct, one is led to the hells and so on up to:🔽one has a wife who is unstable and has many enemies.

original: 'khor g-yog brtan du mi rung ba dang / dgra zla dang bcas pa'i chung mar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / brdzun du smra bas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'khor g-yog brtan du mi rung ba dang / dgra zla dang bcas pa'i chung mar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / brdzun du smra bas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Through false speech, one is led to the hells and so on up to:🔽one is often slandered and deceived by others.

original: skur pa mang ba dang / gzhan gyis bslu bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / phra mas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: skur pa mang ba dang / gzhan gyis bslu bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / phra mas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Through malicious speech, one is led to the hells and so on up to:

original: 'khor g-yog mi 'dum ba dang / 'khor g-yog ngan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar dang / tshig rtsub mos ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /🔽yid du mi 'ong ba thos pa dang 'thab mo'i chig tu 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang tshig 'khyal pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'khor g-yog mi 'dum ba dang / 'khor g-yog ngan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar dang / tshig rtsub mos ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas / yid du mi 'ong ba thos pa dang 'thab mo'i chig tu 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang tshig 'khyal pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: You will not be able to keep servants and attendants, and those you have will be bad.🔽Harsh speech leads to the hells, and so on up to: You will hear unpleasant sounds and will be in quarrelsome places.

original: gzung bar 'os pa'i tshig ma yin pa dang / ma nges pa'i spobs par 'gyur pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / brnab sems kyis ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzung bar 'os pa'i tshig ma yin pa dang / ma nges pa'i spobs par 'gyur pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / brnab sems kyis ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Frivolous speech leads to the hells, and so on up to: You will not be worthy of being heeded, and your eloquence will be uncertain.🔽Covetousness leads to the hells, and so on up to: You will be discontented and have great desires.

original: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod pa che bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar dang / gnod sems @234b kyis ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod pa che bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar dang / gnod sems @234b kyis ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Malice leads to the hells, and so on up to:

original: phan pa mi tshol ba dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar dang / log par lta bas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do //
analyzed: phan pa mi tshol ba dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar dang / log par lta bas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do //
translated: “ Wrong views lead to rebirth as a hell being.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su khrid do //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su khrid do //
translated: They lead to rebirth as an animal.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do //🔽de nas gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na yang /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do // de nas gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na yang /
translated: They lead to rebirth in the world of Yama.

original: rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: If you are reborn among humans, you will have two kinds of results:

original: lta ba ngan par ltung ba dang / g-yo sgyu can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba ngan par ltung ba dang / g-yo sgyu can du 'gyur ro //
translated: you will be reborn in a place where there are wrong views, and you will be deceitful.

original: de ltar mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po tshad med pa sdud par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: de ltar mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po tshad med pa sdud par 'gyur gyis /
translated: “ Thus, these ten unwholesome courses of action lead to immeasurable great masses of suffering.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus ni lha dang mir skye ba la sogs pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skye ba yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus ni lha dang mir skye ba la sogs pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skye ba yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But by taking up the ten wholesome courses of action, you will be reborn as a god or a human, up to the highest existence.

original: de'i gong du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyi tshe ba'i sems dang / khams gsum pas skrag pa'i yid dang / snying rje chen po med pa dang / gzhan las thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ste sgra'i rjes su 'brang bar shes rab kyi rnam pas yongs su bsgoms na /
analyzed: de'i gong du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyi tshe ba'i sems dang / khams gsum pas skrag pa'i yid dang / snying rje chen po med pa dang / gzhan las thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ste sgra'i rjes su 'brang bar shes rab kyi rnam pas yongs su bsgoms na /
translated: If, prior to that, one cultivates these paths of the ten virtues with a limited mind, with a mind frightened by the three realms, without great compassion, and in accordance with what one has heard from others, following after sound,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa yongs su 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa yongs su 'grub par byed do //
translated: then one will accomplish the vehicle of the hearers.

original: de'i gong du gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang / rang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / snying rje chen po dang / thabs ma khas pa med ba dang ; rkyen nyid 'di pa zab mo khong du chud pas yongs su sbyangs na /
analyzed: de'i gong du gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang / rang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / snying rje chen po dang / thabs ma khas pa med ba dang ; rkyen nyid 'di pa zab mo khong du chud pas yongs su sbyangs na /
translated: If, prior to that, one cultivates them without relying on others, with self-awakening, with great compassion, without lack of skillful means, and with an understanding of the profound conditionality,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'grub par byed do //
translated: then one will accomplish the vehicle of the solitary realizers.

original: de'i gong du shin tu rgya che zhing tshad med pa'i snying brtse ba dang / snying rje dang ldan pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas bsdus pa dang / smon lam chen po shin tu btab pa dang ; sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba dang /
analyzed: de'i gong du shin tu rgya che zhing tshad med pa'i snying brtse ba dang / snying rje dang ldan pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas bsdus pa dang / smon lam chen po shin tu btab pa dang ; sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba dang /
translated: through being endowed with compassion, through being gathered by skill in means, through making extremely vast aspirational prayers, through not abandoning any sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pas yongs su sbyangs na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pas yongs su sbyangs na /
translated: and through focusing on the extremely vast wisdom of buddhahood,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'i spyod pa rgya chen po 'grub par byed do zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'i spyod pa rgya chen po 'grub par byed do zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: if one trains, one will accomplish the vast conduct of the bodhisattva grounds and the pure perfections.

original: de'i phyir tshul 'dis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de dag ma gtogs par so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ci rigs par mngon par mtho ba'i 'khor ba'i bde ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul 'dis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de dag ma gtogs par so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ci rigs par mngon par mtho ba'i 'khor ba'i bde ba dang /
translated: Therefore, except for these ten paths of virtuous action, there is nothing that can accomplish the happiness of cyclic existence and the definite goodness of nirvana.

original: nges par legs pa @235a * //
analyzed: nges par legs pa @235a * //
translated: It is the definite goodness.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin thar pa'i mtshan nyid can thob pa'i thabs gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gsal bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin thar pa'i mtshan nyid can thob pa'i thabs gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gsal bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no other means of attaining the liberation which is the nature of neither-pleasure-nor-pain.

original: gang sems bskyed pa gnyis pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni /
analyzed: gang sems bskyed pa gnyis pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni /
translated: The bodhisattva who has generated the second generation of the will to enlightenment🔽is like the ocean with its corpse,

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho ro dang lhan cig dang // bkra shis sna nag ma dang lhan cig bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho ro dang lhan cig dang // bkra shis sna nag ma dang lhan cig bzhin //
translated: like the lucky one with the black-toothed one.

original: de ltar tshul khrims dbang byas bdag nyid che //
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims dbang byas bdag nyid che //
translated: Thus, the one who is controlled by morality is great.

original: de 'chal ba dang lhan cig gnas mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de 'chal ba dang lhan cig gnas mi 'dod do //
translated: He does not want to stay with the immoral.

original: sna nag ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sna nag ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The black-toothed one is

original: bkra mi shis pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: bkra mi shis pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: a synonym for the inauspicious.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul khrims la pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dbye ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul khrims la pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dbye ba bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the divisions of the perfection of morality, as it has been explained, is

original: gang gis gang zhig gang la spong byed pa //
analyzed: gang gis gang zhig gang la spong byed pa //
translated: that by which, for the sake of which, and in which

original: gsum du dmigs pa yod na tshul khrims de //
analyzed: gsum du dmigs pa yod na tshul khrims de //
translated: there is the observation of the three, that morality🔽is not the highest.

original: 'jig rten pa yi pha rol phyin zhes bshad //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi pha rol phyin zhes bshad //
translated: It is called a mundane perfection.

original: tshul khrims de ni gsum du dmigs pa yod na 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bstan to //🔽gsum la chags pas stong de 'jig rten 'das //
analyzed: tshul khrims de ni gsum du dmigs pa yod na 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bstan to // gsum la chags pas stong de 'jig rten 'das //
translated: When it is present in the three spheres, it is taught to be a mundane perfection.🔽When it is free of attachment to the three spheres, it is a supramundane perfection.

original: tshul khrims de nyid ji skad bshad pa'i gsum por dmigs pa med na ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims de nyid ji skad bshad pa'i gsum por dmigs pa med na ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: When it is free of the three spheres, it is taught to be a supramundane perfection.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i sa'i yon tan rjes su brjod pa'i sgo nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs yongs su rdzogs par 'chad pa ni /🔽rgyal sras zla ba las byung srid mi srid pa yi //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i sa'i yon tan rjes su brjod pa'i sgo nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs yongs su rdzogs par 'chad pa ni / rgyal sras zla ba las byung srid mi srid pa yi //
translated: The chapter on the perfection of morality is completed by praising the qualities of the stage as they have been explained.

original: dpal gyur dri ma dang bral dri ma med 'di yang //
analyzed: dpal gyur dri ma dang bral dri ma med 'di yang //
translated: The moon of the Conqueror’s sons has arisen, and the world has become glorious and stainless.

original: ston ka'i dus kyi zla ba'i 'od ni ji bzhin du //
analyzed: ston ka'i dus kyi zla ba'i 'od ni ji bzhin du //
translated: Like the light of the autumn moon,

original: 'gro ba'i yid kyi gdung ba sel bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i yid kyi gdung ba sel bar byed pa yin //
translated: it dispels the mental anguish of beings.

original: zhes bya ba'o //🔽dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //🔽dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Stainless.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyis dri ma med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyis dri ma med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the path of the ten virtues is stainless.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa'i don dang mthun pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa'i don dang mthun pa'i ming ngo //
translated: This is the name that accords with the meaning of the second Bodhisattva ground.

original: ji ltar ston ki'i zla ba'i 'od dri ma dang bral ba skye bo'i gdung ba sel bar byed pa de bzhin du rgyal ba'i sras kyi zla ba las byung ba'i dri ma med pa 'di yang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyis bskyed pa'i yid kyi gdung ba sel bar🔽byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ston ki'i zla ba'i 'od dri ma dang bral ba skye bo'i gdung ba sel bar byed pa de bzhin du rgyal ba'i sras kyi zla ba las byung ba'i dri ma med pa 'di yang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyis bskyed pa'i yid kyi gdung ba sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Just as the light of the autumn moon, free from clouds, dispels the agony of beings, so too this stainless light that arises from the moon of the Victor’s sons dispels the agony of the mind that is produced by unethical conduct.

original: 'di ni 'khor pa'i khongs su ma gtogs pas srid pa ma yin yang srid pa'i dpal te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor pa'i khongs su ma gtogs pas srid pa ma yin yang srid pa'i dpal te /
translated: This is not existence because it is not included within cyclic existence, but it is the glory of existence,

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir dang / gling bzhi'i dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu @235b yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir dang / gling bzhi'i dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu @235b yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the perfections of good qualities follow from it and because it is the cause for the perfection of being the lord of the four continents.

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa gnyis pa'o /
translated: This completes the second bodhichitta generation from the Entrance to the Middle Way.

original: // / da ni sems bskyed pa gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas //
analyzed: // / da ni sems bskyed pa gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas //
translated: Now, from the point of view of the third production of the thought,

original: shes bya'i bud shing ma lus sreg pa'i me //
analyzed: shes bya'i bud shing ma lus sreg pa'i me //
translated: The fire that burns up all the fuel of objects of knowledge

original: 'od 'byung phyir na sa ni gsum pa 'di //🔽'od byed pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'od 'byung phyir na sa ni gsum pa 'di // 'od byed pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Arises from it, so this third ground is The Luminous.🔽The Luminous, the third ground of the Bodhisattva, is so called because the fire of wisdom that burns up all the fuel of objects of knowledge arises from it.

original: 'od byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: 'od byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa'i ming ngo //
translated: The Luminous is the name of the third Bodhisattva ground.

original: yang 'di ci'i phyir 'od byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di ci'i phyir 'od byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the Luminous?

original: don dang mthun pa nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: don dang mthun pa nyid ston par byed do //
translated: It is so called because it reveals the concordance with the object.

original: de'i tshe shes bya'i bud shing ma lus pa sreg pa'i ye shes kyi me zhi ba'i bdag nyid can gyi 'od 'byung ba'i phyir sa 'di la 'od byed pa zhes bshad do ;
analyzed: de'i tshe shes bya'i bud shing ma lus pa sreg pa'i ye shes kyi me zhi ba'i bdag nyid can gyi 'od 'byung ba'i phyir sa 'di la 'od byed pa zhes bshad do ;
translated: At that time, the fire of wisdom that burns up all the fuel of objects of knowledge arises from it, and because it has the nature of peace, this ground is called the Luminous.

original: / sems gsum pa bskyed pa'i /
analyzed: / sems gsum pa bskyed pa'i /
translated: The third production of the thought

original: bde gshegs sras de la /🔽de tshe nyi ltar zangs 'dra'i snang ba 'byung //
analyzed: bde gshegs sras de la / de tshe nyi ltar zangs 'dra'i snang ba 'byung //
translated: of the Sugata’s heir🔽is like the copper of the rising sun.

original: ji ltar nyi ma shar ba'i gnas skabs kyi snga rol du zangs lta bu'i snang ba 'byung ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma shar ba'i gnas skabs kyi snga rol du zangs lta bu'i snang ba 'byung ba ltar /
translated: Just as at the time of the rising sun, there is a copper-colored glow,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la yang der ye shes kyi snang ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la yang der ye shes kyi snang ba 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, the light of wisdom arises for the bodhisattva.

original: ye shes kyi snang ba de lta bu rnyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la /
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang ba de lta bu rnyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la /
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained such a light of wisdom🔽In order to demonstrate the supremacy of the perfection of patience,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir //🔽gal te gnas min 'khrugs ba 'ga' yis de'i //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir // gal te gnas min 'khrugs ba 'ga' yis de'i //
translated: he says:🔽If someone were to cut flesh and blood from his body

original: lus las sha ni rus bcas yun ring du //
analyzed: lus las sha ni rus bcas yun ring du //
translated: for a long time,

original: srang re res nas bcad par gyur kyang de'i //🔽bzod pa gcod par byed la lhag par skye //
analyzed: srang re res nas bcad par gyur kyang de'i // bzod pa gcod par byed la lhag par skye //
translated: weighing it out with scales,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: his patience would increase toward the one who cuts.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / de lta bu'i ye shes yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / de lta bu'i ye shes yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the bodhisattva is intent on protecting the minds of others and because he has such wisdom,

original: gang gis gzhan dag gi mnar sems kyi gzhi dus gsum gyi don ma yin pa dogs pa can du 'gyur bde lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi lus dang ngag dang yid 'jug par mngon du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis gzhan dag gi mnar sems kyi gzhi dus gsum gyi don ma yin pa dogs pa can du 'gyur bde lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi lus dang ngag dang yid 'jug par mngon du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: he does not manifest a body, speech, or mind of such a nature that others would suspect it to be a basis for impatience in the three times.

original: de'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gal te gnas min 'khrugs pa 'ga' yis de'i //
analyzed: gal te gnas min 'khrugs pa 'ga' yis de'i //
translated: if someone were to disturb him in an improper way,

original: zhes khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: zhes khyad par du byas so //
translated: he would be especially so.

original: gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i sems can gyis byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus las sha rus pa dang bcas pa srang re re nas sdod cing sdod cing yun ring por gcod kyang /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i sems can gyis byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus las sha rus pa dang bcas pa srang re re nas sdod cing sdod cing yun ring por gcod kyang /
translated: If sentient beings like that were to cut off the flesh and bones of that Bodhisattva, one ounce at a time, for a long time,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i gcod par byed pa po la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /🔽sdig pa'i las de'i rkyen can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa la lhag bar dmigs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ches lhag par bzod pa @236a * //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i gcod par byed pa po la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi / sdig pa'i las de'i rkyen can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa la lhag bar dmigs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ches lhag par bzod pa @236a * //
translated: not only would he not become angry at all at the one who cuts like that,

original: nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but he would generate patience especially toward the one who cuts, because of the condition of that sinful action, and so forth, in the sufferings of hell.

original: gzhan yang / bdag med mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bdag med mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la //
translated: Moreover, the Bodhisattva who sees selflessness

original: gang zhig gang gis gang tshe ji ltar gcod //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis gang tshe ji ltar gcod //
translated: is cut by whom? with what? when? how?

original: gang phyir chos kyang de yi gzugs brnyan ltar //
analyzed: gang phyir chos kyang de yi gzugs brnyan ltar //
translated: Because the Dharma is like a reflection of him.

original: mthong ba des na de yis bzod par 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong ba des na de yis bzod par 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, he is patient.

original: sdig pa'i las de'i rkyen can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal la lhag par dmigs nas ches lhag par bzod par 'gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sdig pa'i las de'i rkyen can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal la lhag par dmigs nas ches lhag par bzod par 'gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is he patient with regard to the suffering of the hells, etc., which are the conditions of that sinful action, but he is also patient with regard to the suffering of the world.

original: gang gi phyir des chos rnams kyang gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar mthong zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir des chos rnams kyang gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar mthong zhing /
translated: And why is he patient? Because he sees all things as like a reflection.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i 'du byed dang bral ba 'di'i phyir yang ches shin tu bzod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i 'du byed dang bral ba 'di'i phyir yang ches shin tu bzod pa nyid do //
translated: And because he is free from the formative influence of “I” and “mine,” he is extremely patient.

original: kyang gi sgras ni bzod pa'i rgyu bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni bzod pa'i rgyu bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “also” is used to include the cause of patience.

original: bzod pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'tsham pa'i chos yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bzod pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'tsham pa'i chos yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: This patience is not only the appropriate dharma for bodhisattvas,

original: de las gzhan pa rnams kyi yon tan mtha' dag bsrung ba'i rgyu yang yin pas mi bzod pa dang ldan pa ltar khro ba las ldog par rig par 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams kyi yon tan mtha' dag bsrung ba'i rgyu yang yin pas mi bzod pa dang ldan pa ltar khro ba las ldog par rig par 'chad pa ni /
translated: but it is also the cause for the protection of all the virtues of the other perfections. Therefore, it is explained that one should turn away from anger, which is incompatible with patience.

original: gnod pa byas pas gal te der bkon na /
analyzed: gnod pa byas pas gal te der bkon na /
translated: If one is angry with someone who has done harm,

original: de la bkon pas byas zin ldog gam ci //
analyzed: de la bkon pas byas zin ldog gam ci //
translated: Is the past that was done reversible by being angry about it?

original: de phyir de bkon nges par 'dir don med //
analyzed: de phyir de bkon nges par 'dir don med //
translated: Therefore, being angry about it is definitely pointless here.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang ni 'gal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang ni 'gal bar 'gyur //
translated: And it is also contradictory to the next world.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what it says.

original: gal te re zhig khong 'khrugs pa'i skabs ster ba 'di gnod pa byas pa gzhan la khro na de'i tshe gnod pa byas zin pa bzlog tu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te re zhig khong 'khrugs pa'i skabs ster ba 'di gnod pa byas pa gzhan la khro na de'i tshe gnod pa byas zin pa bzlog tu med pa'i phyir /
translated: If, on the one hand, you give an opportunity for anger to arise, and you are angry with another who has done harm, then at that time, since the harm that was done is irreversible,

original: de la dmigs pa'i zhe 'kham  pa don med pa nyid do /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i zhe 'kham  pa don med pa nyid do /
translated: the anger that focuses on it is pointless.

original: rgyu byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause has already been done.

original: 'di'i bkon pa dang lta dgos pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di'i bkon pa dang lta dgos pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it pointless to be angry about it,

original: 'jig rten pha rol dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur te ;
translated: it is also contradictory to the next world.

original: khong khro ba skyes pa yin dang rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khong khro ba skyes pa yin dang rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because anger has arisen and because it propels an unpleasant ripening.

original: gang zhig rang gis nyes par spyad pa byas ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par nye bar spyod pa bzhin du gti mug pas gzhan gyis bdag la gnod pa de byas so snyam du rtog pa de la ni gnod pa byed pa la khro ba nye bar skye la ;
analyzed: gang zhig rang gis nyes par spyad pa byas ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par nye bar spyod pa bzhin du gti mug pas gzhan gyis bdag la gnod pa de byas so snyam du rtog pa de la ni gnod pa byed pa la khro ba nye bar skye la ;
translated: “The one who is experiencing the specific result of the misdeed he himself has done thinks, ‘It is the other who has harmed me.’ The one who thinks this way will give rise to anger toward the one who is harming him.

original: lan du gnod pa bskyal bas de'i gnod pa pham par 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang bzlog par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: lan du gnod pa bskyal bas de'i gnod pa pham par 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang bzlog par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: “The one who wishes to defeat the harm by retaliating should be stopped.

original: sngon byas pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu gang //
analyzed: sngon byas pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu gang //
translated: What is the result of nonvirtuous karma that was done in the past?

original: zad par byed par brjod par 'dod pa de nyid ko //
analyzed: zad par byed par brjod par 'dod pa de nyid ko //
translated: What is it that you wish to exhaust?

original: gzhan la gnod pa dang ni khro bas sdug bsngal phyir //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa dang ni khro bas sdug bsngal phyir //
translated: It is the very thing that leads to suffering through harming others and anger.

original: @236b sa bon nyid du ji lta bur na khrid par byed //🔽gang zhig mtshon cha rnon po'i so babs pas //
analyzed: @236b sa bon nyid du ji lta bur na khrid par byed // gang zhig mtshon cha rnon po'i so babs pas //
translated: How could it be the seed itself?🔽“The one who is being served by the sounds🔽that are produced by the sharp teeth that have sunk into him

original: de la lus la gnod pa'i sdug bsngal ches che ba sgra dag gis nye bar bsgrubs pa de ni /
analyzed: de la lus la gnod pa'i sdug bsngal ches che ba sgra dag gis nye bar bsgrubs pa de ni /
translated: has a very great suffering that harms his body.

original: 'bras bu 'byung ba tha ma srog gcod pa'i las sngon byas pa sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu drag pa nyams su myong bar gyur cing /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung ba tha ma srog gcod pa'i las sngon byas pa sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu drag pa nyams su myong bar gyur cing /
translated: The final result is the arising of the result of the karma of killing that was previously done, the experience of the intense results of the karmic maturation of birth as a hell being, an animal, a preta, and so on.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyon mongs pa lhag mar lus pa can rnams kyi 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba ma lus pa ldog pa'i rgyu gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyon mongs pa lhag mar lus pa can rnams kyi 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba ma lus pa ldog pa'i rgyu gang yin pa ste /
translated: The cause and result of the remaining afflictions are the cause of the cessation of all unpleasant results.

original: de ji ltar slar yang rnam par 'gyur pas sman gyi btung ba tha ma khong na yod pa'i nad gso ba'i rgyu ltar khong nas 'khrug pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dag gis 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba 'das zin pa bas kyang ches lhag par gnod par byed pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du bkri bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar slar yang rnam par 'gyur pas sman gyi btung ba tha ma khong na yod pa'i nad gso ba'i rgyu ltar khong nas 'khrug pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dag gis 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba 'das zin pa bas kyang ches lhag par gnod par byed pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du bkri bar 'gyur /
translated: Just as the final medicine that is drunk is the cause of healing an illness from within, in the same way, the cause of the arising of the result that is more harmful than the previously passed unpleasant result is the cause of the agitation from within and the harm to others.

original: de'i phyir des sman pa nad gso bar byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa gtsags cha rnon po'i las byed pa la bya ba ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir des sman pa nad gso bar byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa gtsags cha rnon po'i las byed pa la bya ba ltar /
translated: Therefore, it is like the action of a sharp needle that is the cause for a doctor to heal an illness.

original: 'bras bu sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu la ches shin tu bzod par rigs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu la ches shin tu bzod par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is quite reasonable to be very patient with the cause of the suffering that is its effect, just as one would with the action of a sharp scalpel that is the cause of a cure for an illness.

original: mi bzod pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba spangs pa 'phen pa'i rgyu yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mi bzod pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba spangs pa 'phen pa'i rgyu yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is impatience the sole cause of projecting an unpleasant karmic maturation, as explained above,

original: yun ring du bsags pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs zad pa'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yun ring du bsags pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs zad pa'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is also the cause for exhausting the great collection of merit that has been accumulated for a long time.🔽To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: gang phyir rgyal sras rnams la khro ba yis //
analyzed: gang phyir rgyal sras rnams la khro ba yis //
translated: Because anger destroys in an instant

original: sbyin dang khrims 'byung dge ba bskal pa brgyar //
analyzed: sbyin dang khrims 'byung dge ba bskal pa brgyar //
translated: the virtue of generosity and ethical conduct

original: bsags pa skad cig gis 'joms de yi phyir //
analyzed: bsags pa skad cig gis 'joms de yi phyir //
translated: that has accumulated for a hundred eons,

original: mi bzod las gzhan sdig pa yod ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi bzod las gzhan sdig pa yod ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: there is no greater misdeed than impatience.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid chen po des gang zag gi khyad par du nges pa dang bral ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid chen po des gang zag gi khyad par du nges pa dang bral ba'i phyir la /
translated: The great being, the bodhisattva, is free from the certainty of being an individual.🔽

original: nges pa yin du zin kyang nyon mongs pa goms pa la rag las nas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnams la bden par gyur pa dang / bden par 'gyur pa ma yin pa'i nyes pa lhag par sgro btags nas khyod khro ba'i bsam pa skad cig tsam zhig bskyed na yang /🔽de tsam gyis kyang bskal pa brgyar bsags pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs sngar bstan pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa goms pa las bskyed pa @237a * //
analyzed: nges pa yin du zin kyang nyon mongs pa goms pa la rag las nas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnams la bden par gyur pa dang / bden par 'gyur pa ma yin pa'i nyes pa lhag par sgro btags nas khyod khro ba'i bsam pa skad cig tsam zhig bskyed na yang / de tsam gyis kyang bskal pa brgyar bsags pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs sngar bstan pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa goms pa las bskyed pa @237a * //
translated: If the bodhisattvas, those great beings, were to generate the thought of anger for even an instant, toward those who have generated the spirit of enlightenment, imputing to them the faults of being untrue and of becoming untrue,

original: 'joms par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'joms par 'gyur na /
translated: even that would destroy the accumulation of merit that they have gathered for a hundred eons, as previously explained, through the practice of generosity and the perfection of moral discipline.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bskyed pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bskyed pa lta ci smos te /
translated: How much more so if they were to generate anger toward a bodhisattva!

original: de'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i tshad srang grangs kyis nges par mi nus pa ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i tshad srang grangs kyis nges par mi nus pa ltar /
translated: Therefore, just as the amount of water in the great ocean cannot be ascertained by counting with a flask,

original: der rnam par smin pa'i mtshams nges par mi nus so //
analyzed: der rnam par smin pa'i mtshams nges par mi nus so //
translated: the limit of the karmic maturation of that anger cannot be ascertained.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba 'phen pa dang / dge ba la gnod pa byed pa'i sdig pa ni mi bzod pa las gzhan mchog tu gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba 'phen pa dang / dge ba la gnod pa byed pa'i sdig pa ni mi bzod pa las gzhan mchog tu gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no evil more powerful than intolerance in propelling an unpleasant result and in harming virtue.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'jam dpal khong khro ba khong khro ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khong khro ba khong khro ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Mañjuśrī, “anger, anger” is
