analyzed: bskal pa brgyar bsags pa'i dge ba nye bar 'joms par byed pa de'i phyir khong khro ba khong khro ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: because it destroys the virtue accumulated over a hundred eons.

original: gzhan yang mi bzod pa gzhan la gnod par byed mi nus pa rnams kyis ni bdag nyid kho na 'joms par byed la /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi bzod pa gzhan la gnod par byed mi nus pa rnams kyis ni bdag nyid kho na 'joms par byed la /
translated: Moreover, those who are intolerant but unable to harm others destroy themselves.

original: nus pa snying rje med pa rnams kyis ni bdag dang gzhan 'joms par byed pa 'di ni skyes ba nyid kyis /
analyzed: nus pa snying rje med pa rnams kyis ni bdag dang gzhan 'joms par byed pa 'di ni skyes ba nyid kyis /
translated: This is born with them.

original: mi sdug gzugs su byed cing dam pa min par dkri //
analyzed: mi sdug gzugs su byed cing dam pa min par dkri //
translated: They make their bodies ugly and are led into what is not good.

original: tshul dang tshul min shes pa'i rnam dpyod 'phrog byed cing //
analyzed: tshul dang tshul min shes pa'i rnam dpyod 'phrog byed cing //
translated: They steal the discernment that knows what is proper and improper.

original: dus phyis rigs mthun pa btang nas /
analyzed: dus phyis rigs mthun pa btang nas /
translated: Later, they give up their class and

original: mi bzod pa yis myur du ngan 'gror sgyur bar byed /
analyzed: mi bzod pa yis myur du ngan 'gror sgyur bar byed /
translated: quickly go to a bad rebirth through their intolerance.

original: gal te mi bzod pa'i skyon de dag yin na de dang 'gal ba bzod pa'i yon tan ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi bzod pa'i skyon de dag yin na de dang 'gal ba bzod pa'i yon tan ci yin zhe na /
translated: If these are the faults of intolerance, what are the virtues of tolerance, which is the opposite of that?

original: bshad pa / bzod pas bshad zin dang 'gal yon tan rnams byed do //
analyzed: bshad pa / bzod pas bshad zin dang 'gal yon tan rnams byed do //
translated: It was said: Tolerance produces the virtues that are the opposite of those already explained.

original: bzod pas mdzes shing skye bo dam pa la //
analyzed: bzod pas mdzes shing skye bo dam pa la //
translated: Through tolerance, one becomes beautiful and is esteemed by holy beings.

original: phangs dang lugs dang lugs min shes pa la //🔽mkhas par gyur zhing de yi 'og tu ni //
analyzed: phangs dang lugs dang lugs min shes pa la // mkhas par gyur zhing de yi 'og tu ni //
translated: One becomes skilled in knowing what is proper and improper.

original: lha mi'i skye dang sdig pa zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: lha mi'i skye dang sdig pa zad par 'gyur //
translated: After that, one is born as a god or human and one’s sins are destroyed.

original: mi bzod pa la skyon gang dag bstan pa de dag dang 'gal ba'i yon tan de dag bzod pa la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pa la skyon gang dag bstan pa de dag dang 'gal ba'i yon tan de dag bzod pa la rig par bya'o //
translated: The qualities that are the opposites of the faults of impatience should be understood as the benefits of patience.

original: de'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar /
translated: Therefore,

original: so so'i skye bo dang ni rgyal sras kyis //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang ni rgyal sras kyis //
translated: Ordinary beings and the victors’ spiritual heirs

original: khro dang bzod pa'i skyon yon rig byas te //🔽mi bzod spangs nas 'phags pa'i skye bo yis //
analyzed: khro dang bzod pa'i skyon yon rig byas te // mi bzod spangs nas 'phags pa'i skye bo yis //
translated: should know the faults of anger and the benefits of patience.🔽Having abandoned impatience, they should always quickly cultivate

original: bsngags pa'i bzod pa rtag tu myur bsnyen bya //
analyzed: bsngags pa'i bzod pa rtag tu myur bsnyen bya //
translated: the patience praised by the noble beings.

original: khro ba dang bzod pa ni khro ba dang bzod pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba dang bzod pa ni khro ba dang bzod pa'o //
translated: Anger and patience are anger and patience.

original: skyon dang yon tan ni skyon dang yon tan te /
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan ni skyon dang yon tan te /
translated: Faults and benefits are faults and benefits.

original: khro ba dang bzod pa dag gi skyon dang yon tan gnyis zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: khro ba dang bzod pa dag gi skyon dang yon tan gnyis zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “the faults and benefits of anger and patience” should be applied in two ways.

original: khro ba'i skyon ni ji skad bshad pa dang bzlog pa'i sgo nas bzod pa'i yon tan khong du chud @237b par byas te /
analyzed: khro ba'i skyon ni ji skad bshad pa dang bzlog pa'i sgo nas bzod pa'i yon tan khong du chud @237b par byas te /
translated: The benefits of patience should be understood by knowing the faults of anger as they have been explained and by knowing the benefits that are the opposite of those faults.

original: mi bzod pa spangs nas dus thams cad du bzod pa kho na bsten par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi bzod pa spangs nas dus thams cad du bzod pa kho na bsten par bya ba yin no //
translated: Having abandoned impatience, one should always rely on patience alone.

original: de ni bzod pa la pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni bzod pa la pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the root text says:

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi byang chub phyir bsngos kyang //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi byang chub phyir bsngos kyang //
translated: Even if it is dedicated to the enlightenment of perfect buddhahood,

original: gsum dmigs yod na de ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: gsum dmigs yod na de ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: if the three are present, it is a mundane patience.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su bsngos su zin kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su bsngos su zin kyang /
translated: Even if patience is dedicated to buddhahood,

original: gang bzod pa dang / gang gis bzod pa dang / sems can gang dag la bzod pa gsum po 'di la dmigs pa yod na /
analyzed: gang bzod pa dang / gang gis bzod pa dang / sems can gang dag la bzod pa gsum po 'di la dmigs pa yod na /
translated: if the three—the patience, the one who is patient, and the sentient beings with regard to whom one is patient—are present,

original: bzod pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that patience is called the mundane perfection of patience.

original: dmigs pa med na de nyid sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: dmigs pa med na de nyid sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: If the three are not present, the Buddha has taught

original: 'jig rten 'das pa'i pha rol phyin zhes bstan //🔽sa de la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par ji ltar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i pha rol phyin zhes bstan // sa de la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par ji ltar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: that it is a supramundane perfection of patience.🔽Just as the perfection of patience is purified on this ground,🔽so too the bodhisattvas’ perfection of concentration and the higher perceptions

original: sa der rgyal sras bsam gtan mngon shes dang // 'dod chags zhe sdang yongs su zad par gyur //
analyzed: sa der rgyal sras bsam gtan mngon shes dang // 'dod chags zhe sdang yongs su zad par gyur //
translated: and the complete exhaustion of attachment and aggression🔽occur on this ground.

original: des kyang rtag tu 'jig rten pa yi ni //
analyzed: des kyang rtag tu 'jig rten pa yi ni //
translated: And always in the world,🔽

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'joms par nus par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'joms par nus par 'gyur //
translated: And he is able to destroy the desire for sensual pleasure of the world.

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i bsam gtan gyi sgra ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don te /
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i bsam gtan gyi sgra ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don te /
translated: The word “meditation” is used in the sense of a metaphor.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang tshad med pa rnams kyang 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang tshad med pa rnams kyang 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It also refers to the meditative absorptions and the immeasurables.

original: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa las gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa las gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: As it is said in the Bodhisattvabhūmi,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni /🔽'dod pa rnams las dben pa /🔽sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni / 'dod pa rnams las dben pa / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: “The bodhisattva who is on this third bodhisattva stage, the Luminous,

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: he abides in the first meditative absorption, which is endowed with conception and sustained thought and is accompanied by the joy and pleasure born of seclusion.🔽He abides in the second meditative absorption, which is born of concentration due to the internal clarity of the mind that is free of the fluctuations of conception and sustained thought.

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He achieves and remains in the second concentration, which is without thought and investigation, and is born of samādhi, and is filled with the rapture and pleasure born of samādhi.

original: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
translated: “Free from the desire for rapture, he remains in equanimity, and with mindfulness and introspection,

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: he experiences pleasure with his body, and he enters and remains in the third concentration, which the noble beings declare to be ‘without thought and investigation, remaining in equanimity and mindfulness.’

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de bde ba yang spangs te snga nas @238a * //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum bsgrubs te gnas so // de bde ba yang spangs te snga nas @238a * //
translated: “He achieves and remains in the third concentration, which is without rapture.🔽“He gives up pleasure, gives up pain,

original: sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas /
translated: and with the disappearance of mental well-being or anguish,🔽he enters and remains in the fourth concentration, which is without pain or pleasure and is purified in terms of equanimity and mindfulness.”

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba de dag ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba de dag ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
translated: These are the four meditations.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The four formless absorptions are as follows:

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: He completely transcends perceptions of form,

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
translated: perceptions of obstruction, and perceptions of diversity.🔽He no longer pays attention to perceptions of infinitude.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He thinks, “Space is infinite,” and achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite space.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: He completely transcends the sphere of infinite space.

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He thinks, “Consciousness is infinite,” and achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: They completely transcend the sphere of infinite consciousness and

original: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: think, “There is nothing at all.” They achieve and abide in the sphere of nothing whatsoever.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: They completely transcend the sphere of nothing whatsoever and

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med pa yang ma yin no snyam ste 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med pa yang ma yin no snyam ste 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ste /
translated: think, “This is not even non-perception.” They achieve and abide in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'di dag ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four formless absorptions.

original: tshad med pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four immeasurables are as follows:🔽With a mind endowed with love, they have an expansive, vast

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems yangs ba rgya chen por gyur pa /
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems yangs ba rgya chen por gyur pa /
translated: mind,

original: mi gnyis pa /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa /
translated: non-dual,

original: tshad med pa /🔽'khon med pa /
analyzed: tshad med pa / 'khon med pa /
translated: immeasurable,🔽without enmity,

original: 'gran zla med pa /
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa /
translated: without rivalry,

original: sgrib pa med pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa /
translated: without obscurations,

original: gnod pa med pa thams cad du khyab pas chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa thams cad du khyab pas chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
translated: without harm, and it pervades everywhere, extending as far as the limits of space.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He remains having pervaded and extended his loving kindness to the whole world, to the extent of the realm of space, above, across, and below, everywhere, all around, with a mind that is vast, great, immeasurable, without hostility, without enmity, without rivalry, without obstruction, without affliction, and well cultivated.

original: de bzhin du snying rje dang ldan pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems yongs pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje dang ldan pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems yongs pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, he remains having pervaded and extended his compassion, his joy, and his equanimity to the whole world, to the extent of the realm of space, above, across, and below, everywhere, all around, with a mind that is vast, great, immeasurable, without hostility, without enmity, without rivalry, without obstruction, without affliction, and well cultivated.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /🔽de rdzu 'phrul bya ba rnam pa du ma myong bar byed des yang g-yo bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga ni 'di lta ste / de rdzu 'phrul bya ba rnam pa du ma myong bar byed des yang g-yo bar byed do //
translated: The five superknowledges are as follows:

original: gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: He experiences the various kinds of magical power: he becomes many after being one;

original: mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: he becomes one after being many;

original: snang bar 'gyur zhing @238b mi snang bar 'gyur ro //🔽rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro //🔽ra ba la yang thad kar 'gro /
analyzed: snang bar 'gyur zhing @238b mi snang bar 'gyur ro // rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro // ra ba la yang thad kar 'gro /
translated: he becomes visible; he becomes invisible;🔽he goes unhindered through walls, through enclosures, through mountains, as if through space;🔽he dives in and out of the earth as if in water;🔽he goes on water without sinking as if on earth;

original: ri la yang mi thogs par thad kar 'gro ste dper na nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ri la yang mi thogs par thad kar 'gro ste dper na nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no //
translated: he sits cross-legged through space like a bird on the wing;🔽he touches and strokes with his hand the moon and sun, so mighty and powerful, and he wields bodily mastery even as far as the Brahma world.

original: nam mkha' la yang skyil mo krung gis 'gro ste dper na 'dab chags bya bzhin no /
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang skyil mo krung gis 'gro ste dper na 'dab chags bya bzhin no /
translated: He moves through space cross-legged, like a bird.

original: sa la yang steng du 'byung ba dang byi'u 'dzul byed de /🔽dper na chu la bya ba bzhin no //🔽chu la yang mi nub par 'gro ste /
analyzed: sa la yang steng du 'byung ba dang byi'u 'dzul byed de / dper na chu la bya ba bzhin no // chu la yang mi nub par 'gro ste /
translated: He dives into the earth and out of it, like a waterbird.

original: dper na sa la bya ba bzhin no //🔽du ba 'thul bar yang byed 'bar bar yang byed de /
analyzed: dper na sa la bya ba bzhin no // du ba 'thul bar yang byed 'bar bar yang byed de /
translated: He walks on water without sinking, like on earth.

original: dper na me'i phung po chen po bzhin no //🔽bdag gi lus la chu'i rgyun chen po 'byin te /
analyzed: dper na me'i phung po chen po bzhin no // bdag gi lus la chu'i rgyun chen po 'byin te /
translated: He emits smoke and flames, like a great fire.

original: dper na / sprin chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / sprin chen po bzhin no //
translated: He creates a great rain cloud, like a great rain cloud.

original: chu'i rgyun de dag gis kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di kun tu 'bar zhing rab tu 'bar la /🔽kun tu rab tu mched cing 'bar te me lce gcig tu gyur pa zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: chu'i rgyun de dag gis kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di kun tu 'bar zhing rab tu 'bar la /🔽kun tu rab tu mched cing 'bar te me lce gcig tu gyur pa zhi bar byed do //
translated: He can extinguish a great fire with that stream of water.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba 'di ltar mthu che ba 'di gnyis la yang lag pas 'dzin zhing kun du nyug par byed do //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba 'di ltar mthu che ba 'di gnyis la yang lag pas 'dzin zhing kun du nyug par byed do //
translated: He can touch and stroke even the moon and sun, so mighty and powerful, with his hand.🔽He can exercise mastery with his body as far as the Brahma world.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du yang lus kyis dbang bsgyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du yang lus kyis dbang bsgyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: This is the superknowledge of miraculous powers.

original: de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas lha dang mi gnyis ka'i sgra yang thos so //
analyzed: de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas lha dang mi gnyis ka'i sgra yang thos so //
translated: With the divine ear, which is pure and surpasses the human, he hears both kinds of sounds, divine and human, whether far or near.

original: phra ba dang rgya che ba dang gang dag ring yang rung nye yang rung ;
analyzed: phra ba dang rgya che ba dang gang dag ring yang rung nye yang rung ;
translated: He hears even the faintest sounds, whether great or small.

original: tha na sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / bung ba dang / srin bu rnams kyi sgra yang thos so //
analyzed: tha na sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / bung ba dang / srin bu rnams kyi sgra yang thos so //
translated: He hears even the sounds of insects, bees, and mosquitoes.

original: 'di ni lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: This is the superknowledge of the divine ear.

original: de sems can gzhan dag dang gang zag gzhan rnams kyi sems dang sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de sems can gzhan dag dang gang zag gzhan rnams kyi sems dang sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows the minds of other beings and other persons, having comprehended them with his own mind.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows a mind with passion as a mind with passion, and he knows a mind without passion as a mind without passion.🔽He knows a mind with aversion as a mind with aversion, and he knows a mind without aversion as a mind without aversion.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows a mind with confusion as a mind with confusion, and he knows a mind without confusion as a mind without confusion.🔽He knows a defiled mind as a defiled mind, and he knows an undefiled mind as an undefiled mind.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang gti mug dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa dang / chung ba dang yangs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang gti mug dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa dang / chung ba dang yangs pa dang /
translated: He knows a contracted mind as a contracted mind, and he knows a distracted mind as a distracted mind.🔽He knows an exalted mind as an exalted mind, and he knows a non-exalted mind as a non-exalted mind.🔽He knows a surpassed mind as a surpassed mind, and he knows an unsurpassed mind as an unsurpassed mind.

original: chen por gyur pa dang tshad med pa dang / bsdus pa dang rgyas pa dang mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa @239a * //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa dang tshad med pa dang / bsdus pa dang rgyas pa dang mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa @239a * //
translated: He knows a concentrated mind as a concentrated mind, and he knows an unconcentrated mind as an unconcentrated mind.🔽He knows a liberated mind as a liberated mind, and he knows an unliberated mind as an unliberated mind.

original: dang / rnam par grol ba dang rnam par ma grol ba dang / skyon can dang skyon med pa dang / sems rags pa la yang sems rags pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dang / rnam par grol ba dang rnam par ma grol ba dang / skyon can dang skyon med pa dang / sems rags pa la yang sems rags pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: and the liberated and the unliberated, the faulty and the faultless, and the coarse and the subtle, he knows them as they really are.

original: sems rags pa ma yin pa la yang sems rags pa ma yin pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems rags pa ma yin pa la yang sems rags pa ma yin pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: And he knows the subtle mind as it really is.

original: de ltar na sems can gzhan dag dang gang zag gzhan rnams kyi sems sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems can gzhan dag dang gang zag gzhan rnams kyi sems sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: Thus he knows the minds of other beings and other individuals as they really are. This is the superknowledge of the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: de sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te /
analyzed: de sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te /
translated: He recollects his manifold previous abodes,

original: tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dran no //
translated: recollecting one birth, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, one hundred, one thousand, one hundred thousand births.

original: tshe rabs gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang lnga dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / brgya dang stong yang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: tshe rabs gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang lnga dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / brgya dang stong yang rjes su dran no //
translated: many hundreds of lives, many thousands of lives, many hundreds of thousands of lives, many millions of lives, many billions of lives,🔽many aeons of dissolution,🔽many aeons of evolution, many aeons of dissolution and evolution,🔽many hundreds of aeons of dissolution and evolution,🔽many thousands of aeons of dissolution and evolution,🔽many hundreds of thousands of aeons of dissolution and evolution, many millions of aeons of dissolution and evolution, many billions of aeons of dissolution and evolution,

original: tshe rabs brgya phrag du ma dang tshe rabs stong phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs 'bum phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs bye ba 'bum phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa dang /🔽'chags pa'i bskal pa dang / 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa'i bskal pa du ma yang rjes su dran no //🔽bskal pa brgya yang rjes su dran no //🔽bskal pa stong yang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: tshe rabs brgya phrag du ma dang tshe rabs stong phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs 'bum phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs bye ba 'bum phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa dang /🔽'chags pa'i bskal pa dang / 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa'i bskal pa du ma yang rjes su dran no //🔽bskal pa brgya yang rjes su dran no //🔽bskal pa stong yang rjes su dran no //
translated: many trillions of aeons of dissolution and evolution,🔽he remembers: ‘There I had this name, belonged to this tribe, looked like this, ate this kind of food, experienced this kind of pleasure and pain, and after living so long I died and was reborn elsewhere; and there too I had this name, belonged to this tribe, looked like this, ate this kind of food, experienced this kind of pleasure and pain, and after living so long I died and was reborn here.’ Thus he remembers his many previous abodes with their characteristics and details.

original: bskal pa 'bum dang / bskal pa bye ba dang / bskal pa bye ba phrag brgya dang / bskal pa bye ba phrag stong dang / bskal pa bye ba phrag 'bum nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma'i bar du rjes su dran no //🔽che ge mo zhig na bdag ming ni 'di zhes bya bar gyur /🔽rus ni 'di zhes bya /🔽rigs ni 'di zhes bya /🔽zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /🔽tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub /🔽yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /
analyzed: bskal pa 'bum dang / bskal pa bye ba dang / bskal pa bye ba phrag brgya dang / bskal pa bye ba phrag stong dang / bskal pa bye ba phrag 'bum nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma'i bar du rjes su dran no // che ge mo zhig na bdag ming ni 'di zhes bya bar gyur / rus ni 'di zhes bya / rigs ni 'di zhes bya / zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za / tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub / yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /
translated: He recollects one aeon, a hundred aeons, a thousand aeons, a hundred thousand aeons, an infinite number of aeons, a hundred infinite number of aeons, a thousand infinite number of aeons, a hundred thousand infinite number of aeons, and even more.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong ngo //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong ngo //
translated: He recollects: “I was born in such and such a place, in such and such a family, ate such and such food, experienced such and such happiness and suffering, lived such and such a length of time, and experienced such and such an end of life.

original: bdag de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
analyzed: bdag de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
translated: Having died there, I was born here.”

original: de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes rnam pa dang bcas dan rtags dang bcas rgyu mtshan dang bcas par sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran no //
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes rnam pa dang bcas dan rtags dang bcas rgyu mtshan dang bcas par sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran no //
translated: Thus he recollects his various previous abodes with their aspects and characteristics.

original: de ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: This is the superknowledge of the recollection of former abodes.

original: des lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang mdog sdug pa dang @239b mdog mi sdug pa dang bde bar song ba dang ngan par song ba dang / bzang po dang ngan pa rnams mthong ngo //
analyzed: des lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang mdog sdug pa dang @239b mdog mi sdug pa dang bde bar song ba dang ngan par song ba dang / bzang po dang ngan pa rnams mthong ngo //
translated: By means of the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and he understands how beings pass on according to their actions.

original: las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He understands how beings pass on according to their actions.

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: ‘These worthy beings who are ill-conducted in body,

original: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /🔽yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa / yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: speech and thought, who revile the noble ones, who have wrong view and act accordingly,🔽with the breakup of the body, after death, will reappear in a place of loss, a bad destination, a lower realm, hell.🔽‘These worthy beings who are well-conducted in body,

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur ba 'debs par spyod pa log par lta ba can dag ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur ba 'debs par spyod pa log par lta ba can dag ste /
translated: speech and thought, who do not revile the noble ones, who have right view and act accordingly,🔽with the breakup of the body, after death, will reappear in a good destination, a heavenly world.’

original: log par lta ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro rnam par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye'o zhes bya ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro rnam par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye'o zhes bya ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Alas, these sentient beings are endowed with good physical conduct,

original: ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with good verbal conduct,

original: yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: and endowed with good mental conduct.

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur ba mi 'debs pa yang dag par lta ba can dag ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur ba mi 'debs pa yang dag par lta ba can dag ste /
translated: They do not slander the noble ones and have right views.

original: yang dag par lta ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
translated: Due to the cause of taking up the karma of right views, after the body has perished and death has occurred, they are born in the happy realms, the higher realms, among the gods.

original: de ltar na lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang mdog sdug pa dang mdog mi sdug pa dang zhes bya ba nas thams cad rnam pa dang bcas dan rtags dang bcas /
analyzed: de ltar na lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang mdog sdug pa dang mdog mi sdug pa dang zhes bya ba nas thams cad rnam pa dang bcas dan rtags dang bcas /
translated: Thus, with the divine eye, which is pure and surpasses that of humans, he sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in good and bad destinies—he sees sentient beings being reborn in the appropriate realms of existence according to their deeds.

original: rgyu mtshan dang bcas par mthong ste /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang bcas par mthong ste /
translated: He sees all this as it really is.

original: las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can dag byang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can dag byang rab tu shes so //
translated: He sees sentient beings as they really are, according to their deeds.

original: de bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag la snyoms par 'jug cing rnam par ldang yang /
analyzed: de bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag la snyoms par 'jug cing rnam par ldang yang /
translated: He enters and emerges from these meditative concentrations, liberations, meditative absorptions, and attainments.

original: gang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar mthong ba der ched du bsams te smron  lam btab pa'i dbang gis skyes pa ma gtogs par de dag gi dbang gis mi skye'o //
analyzed: gang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar mthong ba der ched du bsams te smron  lam btab pa'i dbang gis skyes pa ma gtogs par de dag gi dbang gis mi skye'o //
translated: He enters and emerges from them, but he does not take birth there through the power of his aspirations, except when it is for the purpose of seeing the Buddhas, or for the purpose of honoring them and serving them, or for the purpose of maturing beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de thabs mkhas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sems kyi rgyud dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de thabs mkhas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sems kyi rgyud dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, up to: because the bodhisattva is endowed with a mental continuum that is accomplished through skillful means.

original: de ltar nas 'dir byang chub sems dpa' las bsam gtan dang mngon par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar nas 'dir byang chub sems dpa' las bsam gtan dang mngon par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, here the meditative stabilization and the superknowledges arise from the bodhisattva.

original: ci ltar rtag tu 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang yongs su zad par 'gyur @240a * //
analyzed: ci ltar rtag tu 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang yongs su zad par 'gyur @240a * //
translated: How is it that attachment and hostility in the world are always exhausted?

original: zhe na ; dang gi sgras ni ma smos pa bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir te de'i gti mug kyang yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe na ; dang gi sgras ni ma smos pa bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir te de'i gti mug kyang yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word “and” is for the sake of including what is not mentioned, i.e., that delusion is also exhausted.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di yang mdo ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di yang mdo ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: This is according to the sutra.

original: ji skad du des chos thams cad rkyen la rton pa nyid yin pas 'pho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par 'jig pa med pa nyid du rtogs pas de bas kyang shas cher 'dod pa'i 'ching ba thams cad bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du des chos thams cad rkyen la rton pa nyid yin pas 'pho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par 'jig pa med pa nyid du rtogs pas de bas kyang shas cher 'dod pa'i 'ching ba thams cad bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: As it is said: “Because he realizes that all phenomena are based on conditions, they are without transference and without destruction. Therefore, all the fetters of desire are reduced even more.

original: gzugs kyi 'ching ba thams cad dang srid pa'i 'ching ba dang ma rig pa'i 'ching ba bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'ching ba thams cad dang srid pa'i 'ching ba dang ma rig pa'i 'ching ba bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the bonds of form, the bonds of existence, and the bonds of ignorance are reduced.

original: de'i lta bar gyur ba'i 'ching ba rnams ni snga nas spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i lta bar gyur ba'i 'ching ba rnams ni snga nas spangs pa yin no //
translated: The bonds of his views have already been abandoned.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa 'di la gnas pa byang chub sems dpa' de ni bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa 'bum phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba phrag du ma nas bskal pa khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mar log pa'i 'dod chags 'grib par bya ba ma yin pa spong bar 'gyur ro //🔽log pa'i zhe sdang 'grib par bya ba ma yin pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa 'di la gnas pa byang chub sems dpa' de ni bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa 'bum phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba phrag du ma nas bskal pa khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mar log pa'i 'dod chags 'grib par bya ba ma yin pa spong bar 'gyur ro // log pa'i zhe sdang 'grib par bya ba ma yin pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva bhūmi, the Luminous, abandons the non-diminution of the bonds of false desire for many hundreds of eons, many thousands of eons, many hundreds of thousands of eons, many millions of eons, up to many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of millions of eons.🔽He abandons the non-diminution of the bonds of false hatred.

original: log pa'i gti mug 'grib par bya ba ma yin pa spong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: log pa'i gti mug 'grib par bya ba ma yin pa spong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: He abandons the non-diminution of the bonds of false ignorance.

original: de ltar na de'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, his desire, hatred, and ignorance are completely exhausted.

original: de ci ltar rtag tu 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'joms par nus par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar rtag tu 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'joms par nus par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that he is able to always conquer the desire realm’s desire?

original: ji skad du kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa 'od byed pa zhes bya ba mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa 'od byed pa zhes bya ba mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: As it is said, “O sons of the Conqueror, this is the brief presentation of the third bodhisattva ground, called The Luminous.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher lha'i rgyal po lha'i bdag po dbang por gyur te /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher lha'i rgyal po lha'i bdag po dbang por gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this ground mostly becomes a lord of the gods, a king of the gods, Indra.

original: sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa la 'dod chags rnam par bzlog pa'i thabs bsgrub pa la byang ba dang / gtso bo yin zhing sems can rnams 'dod pa'i 'dam nas 'don pa la mkhas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa la 'dod chags rnam par bzlog pa'i thabs bsgrub pa la byang ba dang / gtso bo yin zhing sems can rnams 'dod pa'i 'dam nas 'don pa la mkhas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: He is skilled in the means of turning sentient beings away from desire realm attachment, and he is the chief one, skilled in liberating sentient beings from the mire of desire.”

original: de ltar rgyal ba'i sras po de ni 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'joms par nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rgyal ba'i sras po de ni 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'joms par nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the Conqueror’s child is able to conquer the desire realm’s desire.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum par /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum par /
translated: Thus, this bodhisattva has attained the third bodhisattva ground.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang bsam gtan dang tshad med pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang mngon par @240b shes pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa yongs su zad pa gdon mi za bar thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang bsam gtan dang tshad med pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang mngon par @240b shes pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa yongs su zad pa gdon mi za bar thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas /
translated: He has attained the perfection of patience, the pure meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, the meditative attainments, the superknowledges, and the complete exhaustion of attachment and so on.

original: da ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la thug pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyi rten gyi khyad par dang tshogs kyi rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su grub pa rnam par gzhag pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la thug pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyi rten gyi khyad par dang tshogs kyi rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su grub pa rnam par gzhag pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to clarify the special support of the three perfections that culminate in the perfection of patience, the nature of the accumulations and the fully present result, it is said:

original: sbyin sogs chos gsum de dag phal mo cher //
analyzed: sbyin sogs chos gsum de dag phal mo cher //
translated: The three dharmas of generosity and so on

original: bde bar gshegs pas khyim pa rnams la bsngags //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas khyim pa rnams la bsngags //
translated: are mostly praised by the Sugata for householders.

original: bsod nams zhes bya'i tshogs kyang de dag nyid //
analyzed: bsod nams zhes bya'i tshogs kyang de dag nyid //
translated: They are also the accumulation of merit

original: sangs rgyas gzugs kyi bdag nyid sku yi rgyu //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs kyi bdag nyid sku yi rgyu //
translated: and the cause of the Buddha's form body.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na ji skad bshad pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rten yin mod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na ji skad bshad pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rten yin mod kyi /
translated: The bodhisattvas are indeed the basis of the generosity, etc., as they have been explained.

original: de lta na yang khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i dbye bas de rnams la gnyis srid pa la ltos nas de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: de lta na yang khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i dbye bas de rnams la gnyis srid pa la ltos nas de skad du brjod do //
translated: However, in terms of the possibility of the two, i.e., the householder and the monk, they are described in that way.

original: de la khyim pa rnams la ni phal cher sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos gsum po de dag sgrub par sla la /
analyzed: de la khyim pa rnams la ni phal cher sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos gsum po de dag sgrub par sla la /
translated: For householders, the three dharmas, generosity, etc., are generally easy to practice,

original: rab tu byung ba rnams la ni brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab yin te cig shos dag la gcig mi srid pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams la ni brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab yin te cig shos dag la gcig mi srid pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but for monks, it is effort, meditation, and wisdom. It is not the case that one of them is impossible for the other.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu'i tshogs ni gnyis yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu'i tshogs ni gnyis yin te /
translated: The collection of causes for buddhahood is twofold:

original: gang 'di bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gang 'di bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: the collection of merit and the collection of wisdom.

original: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs ni pha rol tu phyin pa gsum po de dag nyid yin la ye shes kyi tshogs ni bsam gtan dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs ni pha rol tu phyin pa gsum po de dag nyid yin la ye shes kyi tshogs ni bsam gtan dang shes rab bo //
translated: The collection of merit is the three perfections of generosity, morality, and patience, and the collection of wisdom is meditation and wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus ni gnyis ka'i rgyun yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni gnyis ka'i rgyun yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and effort is the cause of both.

original: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs gang yin pa de ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku bsod nams brgya'i mtshan nyid can rmad du byung zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gzugs sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs gang yin pa de ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku bsod nams brgya'i mtshan nyid can rmad du byung zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gzugs sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The accumulation of merit is the cause of the marvelous and inconceivable variety of forms of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, which have the nature of the body of form and are characterized by a hundred merits.

original: chos kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin no //
translated: The accumulation of wisdom is the cause of the body of truth, which has the nature of the Dharma and is characterized by non-arising.

original: da ni rten la sogs pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid che bar brjod nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa'i skabs rdzogs par bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni rten la sogs pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid che bar brjod nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa'i skabs rdzogs par bshad pa /
translated: Now, having described the greatness of the bodhisattvas by way of their support and so forth, the chapter on the third bodhisattva stage is completed.

original: rgyal ba'i sras po nyi ma la gnas 'od byed 'di //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras po nyi ma la gnas 'od byed 'di //
translated: The bodhisattva who is the sun, shining on the light-maker stage,

original: rang gtogs mun rnams dang po yang dag bsal byas nas //
analyzed: rang gtogs mun rnams dang po yang dag bsal byas nas //
translated: first dispels the darkness that belongs to him.

original: 'gro ba'i mun pa rnam par 'joms par mngon par 'dod //🔽sa 'od byed pa bde bar @241a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mun pa rnam par 'joms par mngon par 'dod // sa 'od byed pa bde bar @241a * //
translated: He is called the Illuminator because he illuminates the darkness of the world.🔽The Bodhisattva who is in the third Ground, which is called the Luminous, is like the sun, the son of the Sugata, which is situated in the sky.

original: gshegs pa'i sras kyi nyi ma la gnas pa 'di ni rang gi rten la yod pa'i mi shes pa bdag nyid 'byung ba'i gegs su gyur pa ni skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs nyid du bsal nas /
analyzed: gshegs pa'i sras kyi nyi ma la gnas pa 'di ni rang gi rten la yod pa'i mi shes pa bdag nyid 'byung ba'i gegs su gyur pa ni skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs nyid du bsal nas /
translated: He has dispelled the darkness which is ignorance, which is the obstacle to the arising of the self-arisen one, which is in his own support.

original: rnam pa de lta bu nye bar bstan pa las de las gzhan pa rnams kyis gsum pa 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa'i mun pa 'joms par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu nye bar bstan pa las de las gzhan pa rnams kyis gsum pa 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa'i mun pa 'joms par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: And, by the teaching of this kind, he wishes to destroy the darkness which is the obstacle to the arising of the third, which is in the others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni /
translated: The Bodhisattva,

original: sa 'dir shin tu rno bar gyur kyang khro mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sa 'dir shin tu rno bar gyur kyang khro mi 'gyur //
translated: even though he has become very sharp on this Ground, does not become angry.

original: de ni nyes pa'i mun pa yon tan 'joms par byed pa bcom pas nyi ma ltar ches rno bar 'jug tu zin kyang skyon dang ldan pa'i skye bo la 'khrug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa'i mun pa yon tan 'joms par byed pa bcom pas nyi ma ltar ches rno bar 'jug tu zin kyang skyon dang ldan pa'i skye bo la 'khrug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though he has become very sharp, like the sun, by the destruction of the darkness of faults which destroys the virtues, he does not become angry with the people who have faults.

original: bzod pa la ches lhag par goms pa'i phyir dang snying rjes rgyud snum par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa la ches lhag par goms pa'i phyir dang snying rjes rgyud snum par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of his extreme familiarity with patience and because of his compassion, his mind is well-oiled.🔽

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las /
translated: Because of their extreme familiarity with patience and because of their compassion, their mental continuum is made supple.

original: sems bskyed pa gsum pa'o /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third generation of the Thought.

original: // / da ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par bstan pa'i sgo nas sems bskyed pa bzhi pa'i dbang du byas te bshad pa /
analyzed: // / da ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par bstan pa'i sgo nas sems bskyed pa bzhi pa'i dbang du byas te bshad pa /
translated: Now, from the viewpoint of the fourth generation of the Thought, he explains the superiority of the perfection of effort over the perfections of giving, morality, and patience.

original: yon tan ma lus brtson 'grus rjes 'gro zhing //
analyzed: yon tan ma lus brtson 'grus rjes 'gro zhing //
translated: All virtues follow after effort;

original: bsod nams blo gros tshogs ni gnyis kyi rgyu //
analyzed: bsod nams blo gros tshogs ni gnyis kyi rgyu //
translated: it is the cause of the two collections of merit and wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus gang du 'bar bar 'gyur ba yi //
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang du 'bar bar 'gyur ba yi //
translated: Where effort blazes,

original: sa de bzhi pa 'od ni 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: sa de bzhi pa 'od ni 'phro ba'o //
translated: that ground is the fourth, the Blazing.

original: dge ba'i las la spro ba dang mi ldan pa la ni rnam pa thams cad du sbyin pa la sogs pa dag la 'jug pa med pas yon tan thams cad 'byung ba mi srid la /
analyzed: dge ba'i las la spro ba dang mi ldan pa la ni rnam pa thams cad du sbyin pa la sogs pa dag la 'jug pa med pas yon tan thams cad 'byung ba mi srid la /
translated: For one who is not endowed with enthusiasm for virtuous action, there is no engagement in giving, etc. in any way, and so the occurrence of all virtues is impossible.

original: sngar nye bar bkod pa'i yon tan bsags pa spros pa dang ldan pa la ni thob pa dang ma thob pa 'phel ba dang thob pa srid pas yon tan yin no cog gi rgyu ni brtson 'grus nyid yin no //
analyzed: sngar nye bar bkod pa'i yon tan bsags pa spros pa dang ldan pa la ni thob pa dang ma thob pa 'phel ba dang thob pa srid pas yon tan yin no cog gi rgyu ni brtson 'grus nyid yin no //
translated: The cause of all virtues is just effort.

original: tshogs gnyis kyi rgyu nyid du ni gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis kyi rgyu nyid du ni gong du bshad zin to //
translated: The cause of the two stores has already been explained above.

original: brtson 'grus de rang gi yon tan yongs su dag pa'i sgo nas sa gang zhig tu lhag par 'bar ba 'chang ba de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus de rang gi yon tan yongs su dag pa'i sgo nas sa gang zhig tu lhag par 'bar ba 'chang ba de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: That effort blazes forth on a certain stage by means of the purification of its own virtues. That stage is the fourth stage of the bodhisattva, called the Effulgent.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'od 'phro ba zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'od 'phro ba zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it called the Effulgent?

original: ming 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ming 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to show the reason for using the name, he says:

original: der ni bde gshegs sras la rdzogs pa yi //🔽byang chub phyogs lhag bsgoms pa las skyes pa'i //
analyzed: der ni bde gshegs sras la rdzogs pa yi // byang chub phyogs lhag bsgoms pa las skyes pa'i //
translated: There the offspring of the sugatas,🔽through the light of the path to enlightenment,

original: snang ba zangs kyi 'od pas lhag 'byung zhes //🔽zhes @241b bya ba smos te /
analyzed: snang ba zangs kyi 'od pas lhag 'byung zhes //🔽zhes @241b bya ba smos te /
translated: which is born of meditation,🔽shine forth with a brilliance greater than the copper-colored glow of dawn.

original: 'di ltar sa 'dir byang chub sems dpa' la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms pa las sngar bshad pa'i zangs kyi snang ba pas lhag pa'i snang ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa 'dir byang chub sems dpa' la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms pa las sngar bshad pa'i zangs kyi snang ba pas lhag pa'i snang ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, on this ground, the bodhisattva cultivates the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, and a light superior to the copper light explained above appears.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi me'i 'od 'byung bas byang chub sems dpa'i sa de la 'od 'phro ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi me'i 'od 'byung bas byang chub sems dpa'i sa de la 'od 'phro ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since the light of the fire of correct wisdom appears, this bodhisattva ground is called The Luminous.

original: de la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness, the four thorough abandonings, the four legs of manifestation, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are as follows:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni brtun pa can dang shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni brtun pa can dang shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas /
translated: “O sons of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who is on the Bodhisattvabhumi called Brilliance is diligent, mindful, and fully aware.

original: 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba nyid rnam par spongs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba nyid rnam par spongs te /
translated: He has completely abandoned covetousness and mental dissatisfaction in the world.

original: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: He dwells observing the internal body.

original: brtun pa can dang / shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas 'jig rten na brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba nyid rnam par spangs te /
analyzed: brtun pa can dang / shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas 'jig rten na brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba nyid rnam par spangs te /
translated: He is diligent, mindful, and fully aware. He has completely abandoned covetousness and mental dissatisfaction in the world.

original: phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: He dwells observing the external body.

original: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He dwells observing the internal and external body.

original: de bzhin du brtun pa can dang shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtun pa can dang shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas /
translated: In the same way, he is diligent, mindful, and fully aware.

original: nang gi tshor ba rnams dang / phyi'i tshor ba rnams dang / nang dang phyi'i tshor ba rnams dang / snga ma bzhin du nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / nang dang phyi'i sems la gnas so zhes bya ba dang / nang gi chos rnams dang /
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba rnams dang / phyi'i tshor ba rnams dang / nang dang phyi'i tshor ba rnams dang / snga ma bzhin du nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / nang dang phyi'i sems la gnas so zhes bya ba dang / nang gi chos rnams dang /
translated: He abides contemplating internal feelings, external feelings, and both internal and external feelings.

original: phyi'i chos rnams dang / nang dang phyi'i chos rnams la gnas so zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyi'i chos rnams dang / nang dang phyi'i chos rnams la gnas so zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: He abides contemplating internal dharmas, external dharmas, and both internal and external dharmas.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni 'di lta ste /🔽de sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do //🔽'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni 'di lta ste / de sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do // 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: The four right efforts are as follows:

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to //🔽yang dag par rab tu 'jog go //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to // yang dag par rab tu 'jog go //
translated: He generates will, strives, brings forth heroism, takes hold of his mind, and properly sets it to work in order to prevent the arising of evil and unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spong ba'i @242a * //🔽phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spong ba'i @242a * //🔽phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He generates will, strives, brings forth heroism, takes hold of his mind, and properly sets it to work in order to abandon evil and unwholesome dharmas that have already arisen.🔽He generates will, strives, brings forth heroism, takes hold of his mind, and properly sets it to work in order to give rise to wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen.🔽He generates will, strives, brings forth heroism, takes hold of his mind, and properly sets it to work in order to maintain, not forget, perfect, increase, multiply, cause them to grow, and fully develop wholesome dharmas that have already arisen.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In order to generate wholesome states that have not yet arisen, as before.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang mi nyams pa dang rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang rab tu rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang mi nyams pa dang rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang rab tu rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do //
translated: In order to maintain wholesome states that have arisen, not to let them be lost, to increase them, to manifest them more and more, and to bring them to fulfilment, one generates will,

original: 'bad do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bad do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: strives, arouses energy, seizes the mind, and makes an effort, as before.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four bases of supernormal power are as follows:

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa /
translated: The base of supernormal power that is concentration of will accompanied by the volition of striving,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /
translated: based on seclusion, based on non-greed,

original: 'gog pa la gnas pa rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba sgom mo //
analyzed: 'gog pa la gnas pa rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba sgom mo //
translated: based on non-hatred, based on non-delusion, based on the production of the thought of renunciation, based on the relinquishment of all attachments, and based on non-distraction.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spang ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spang ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no /
translated: Likewise, the foot of miraculous power that is the concentration of vigor and the application of the abandonment, the foot of miraculous power that is the concentration of mind and the application of the abandonment, and the foot of miraculous power that is the concentration of investigation and the application of the abandonment are as above.

original: dbang po lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five faculties are as follows:

original: dad pa'i dbang po dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dben pa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dben pa la gnas pa dang /
translated: The faculty of faith that is based on isolation, and likewise the faculty of vigor, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom that are based on isolation,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: based on detachment, and based on cessation.

original: stobs lnga ni de dag nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs pham par byas pa rnams yin te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: stobs lnga ni de dag nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs pham par byas pa rnams yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The five powers are the same as the five faculties, but they are distinguished by the fact that they have overcome the resistances.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The seven members of enlightenment are as follows:

original: de dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The member of enlightenment called mindfulness is based on isolation,🔽based on nonattraction, based on cessation, and matured by relinquishment.🔽The member of enlightenment called investigation of things is based on isolation, based on nonattraction, based on cessation, and matured by relinquishment.🔽The member of enlightenment called effort is based on isolation, based on nonattraction, based on cessation, and matured by relinquishment.

original: de bzhin du chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: The member of enlightenment called joy is based on isolation, based on nonattraction, based on cessation, and matured by relinquishment.🔽The member of enlightenment called pliancy is based on isolation, based on nonattraction, based on cessation, and matured by relinquishment.🔽The member of enlightenment called concentration is based on isolation, based on nonattraction, based on cessation, and matured by relinquishment.

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The member of enlightenment called equanimity is based on isolation, based on nonattraction, based on cessation, and matured by relinquishment.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The noble eightfold path is as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dben pa la @242b gnas pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dben pa la @242b gnas pa /
translated: Right view is cultivated as being based on solitude,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /
translated: being based on detachment,

original: 'gog pa la gnas pa rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba sgom mo //
analyzed: 'gog pa la gnas pa rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba sgom mo //
translated: being based on cessation, and being directed toward relinquishment.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Right thought is as above.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration are said to be based on solitude, and so forth, as above.

original: sa 'di la byang chub kyi phyogs sgom pa 'byung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sa 'di la byang chub kyi phyogs sgom pa 'byung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment occur on this ground,

original: rang du lta ba dang 'brel yongs su zad //
analyzed: rang du lta ba dang 'brel yongs su zad //
translated: but also the complete exhaustion of the view of self.

original: sa 'dir de'i rang du lta ba zad par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa 'dir de'i rang du lta ba zad par yang 'gyur te /
translated: On this ground, the view of self is completely exhausted.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang /

analyzed: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //

analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsnyad do //

analyzed: de la spang bar bya ba'i phyogs ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //

original: rgyu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //

analyzed: blang bar bya ba'i phyogs ni rnam par byang ba yin la /

analyzed: de thob pa'i rgyu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //

analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang gi ngo bo'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du bden pa gzhan gang cung zad cig yod pa de yang ci rigs par bden pa gnyis kyi khongs su gtogs pa kho nar nges par bya'o //
translated: Thus, whatever other truths exist should be ascertained as being included in the two truths, as appropriate.

original: yang ci bden pa bzhi las tha dad pa'i bden pa gzhan yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci bden pa bzhi las tha dad pa'i bden pa gzhan yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do other truths exist apart from the four truths?

original: bshad pa yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa yod de /

original: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa las /

analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽de kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin /

translated: This is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.🔽He is skilled in relative truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /🔽mtshan nyid kyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin /🔽rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin / mtshan nyid kyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin / rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in ultimate truth.🔽He is skilled in the truth of characteristics.🔽He is skilled in the truth of distinctions.

original: phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in the truth of differentiation.

original: dngos po'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in the truth of things.

original: rab tu skye ba'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in the truth of arising.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in the truth of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising.

original: lam shes pa la 'jug pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: lam shes pa la 'jug pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in the truth of engaging in the knowledge of the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i go rims thams cad kyi mtshams sbyar ba sgrub pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i go rims thams cad kyi mtshams sbyar ba sgrub pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: He is skilled in the four noble truths, that is, the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, and the truth of the path.

original: de la sems can gzhan dag gi bsam pa shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshim par byed pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de la sems can gzhan dag gi bsam pa shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshim par byed pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: He is skilled in the conventional truth, because he satisfies the minds of other beings just as they wish.

original: bgrod pa gcig pu la yang dag par gzhol bas don dam pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //🔽rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pas mtshan nyid kyi bden pa rab tu shes so //🔽chos rnam par dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pu la yang dag par gzhol bas don dam pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so // rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pas mtshan nyid kyi bden pa rab tu shes so // chos rnam par dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: He is skilled in the ultimate truth, because he is intent on the single way.🔽He is skilled in the truth of characteristics, because he understands the specific and general characteristics.🔽He is skilled in the truth of classification, because he understands the presentation of the classification of phenomena.

original: phung po khams dang skye mched kyi rnam par gzhag pa rjes su rtogs pas phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched kyi rnam par gzhag pa rjes su rtogs pas phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: He is skilled in the truth of differentiation, because he understands the presentation of the aggregates, constituents, and sense-spheres.🔽He is skilled in the truth of the path, because he understands the presentation of the path.

original: lus dang sems la gnod pa nyams su 'bab pas dngos po'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: lus dang sems la gnod pa nyams su 'bab pas dngos po'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: Since they fully understand the truth of suffering, they fully understand the truth of cessation.

original: 'gro bar nying mtshams sbyor ba rtogs pas rab tu skye @244a * //
analyzed: 'gro bar nying mtshams sbyor ba rtogs pas rab tu skye @244a * //
translated: Since they fully understand the truth of origination, they fully understand the truth of the path.🔽Since they fully understand the truth of cessation, they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
