original: rims nad kyis yongs su gdung ba thams cad shin tu zhi bas zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rims nad kyis yongs su gdung ba thams cad shin tu zhi bas zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: Since they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of elimination and nonarising, they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽Since they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path, they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽Since they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path, they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of elimination and nonarising.🔽Since they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of elimination and nonarising, they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: mi gnyis pa mngon par bsgrubs pas lam shes pa la 'jug pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa mngon par bsgrubs pas lam shes pa la 'jug pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: Since they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path, they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽Since they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path, they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of elimination and nonarising.🔽Since they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of elimination and nonarising, they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽Since they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path, they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽Since they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of the path, they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of elimination and nonarising.

original: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par khong du chud pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i go rims thams cad kyi mtshams sbyor ba sgrub pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa lta🔽bu'o // dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par khong du chud pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i go rims thams cad kyi mtshams sbyor ba sgrub pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa lta🔽bu'o // dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las /
translated: Since they fully understand the truth of the knowledge of the aspects of elimination

original: sbyang dka' ba zhes bya ba sems bskyed pa lnga pa'o /
analyzed: sbyang dka' ba zhes bya ba sems bskyed pa lnga pa'o /
translated: Difficult to Overcome is the fifth generation of the mind of enlightenment.

original: // / da ni sems bskyed pa drug pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: // / da ni sems bskyed pa drug pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, from the perspective of the sixth generation of the mind of enlightenment, it is said:

original: mngon du phyogs pa mnyam gzhag sems gnas te //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pa mnyam gzhag sems gnas te //
translated: Approaching, the mind is set in equipoise,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos la mngon phyogs shing //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos la mngon phyogs shing //
translated: Approaching the qualities of perfect buddhahood,

analyzed: 'di rten 'byung ba'i de nyid mthong ba de //
translated: Seeing the suchness of dependent origination,

original: shes rab gnas pas 'gog pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab gnas pas 'gog pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: That bodhisattva attains cessation through the power of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga par bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa thob pas sa drug par mnyam par gzhag par sems la gnas shing rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo'i de nyid mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shes rab🔽kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pas 'gog pa thob par 'gyur gyi snga rol du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga par bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa thob pas sa drug par mnyam par gzhag par sems la gnas shing rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo'i de nyid mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pas 'gog pa thob par 'gyur gyi snga rol du ni ma yin te /
translated: Through attaining the perfection of meditative stabilization on the fifth bodhisattva ground, on the sixth ground the bodhisattva's mind is set in equipoise and he sees the suchness of profound dependent origination.🔽That bodhisattva attains cessation through the power of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab lhag par gyur pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab lhag par gyur pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: He does not attain it previously because he does not have the preeminence of wisdom.

analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa phul du byung ba dang ldan pas ni 'gog pa thob par mi nus so //
translated: One who is endowed with the highest perfections such as generosity is not able to attain cessation.

original: gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba'i chos nyid khong du chud pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga par lam gyi bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir na sa 'di la mngon du gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba'i chos nyid khong du chud pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga par lam gyi bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir na sa 'di la mngon du gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This stage is called the Manifest because of the understanding of the reality that is like a reflection, because the bodhisattvas on the fifth bodhisattva stage have the objective of the truth of the path, and because they are facing the qualities of perfect buddhahood.

original: da ni de las gzhan pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rag las pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni de las gzhan pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rag las pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the dependence of the other accumulations of qualities on the perfection of wisdom, it is said:🔽Just as a whole group of blind people

original: ji ltar long ba'i tshogs kun bde blag tu //
analyzed: ji ltar long ba'i tshogs kun bde blag tu //

analyzed: mig ldan skyes bu gcig gis 'dod pa yi // yul du khrid pa de bzhin @244b 'dir yang blos //

original: mig nyams yon tan blangs te rgyal nyid 'gro //
analyzed: mig nyams yon tan blangs te rgyal nyid 'gro //
translated: so the blind qualities are led to buddhahood by wisdom.

original: ji ltar skyes bu mig dang ldan pa gcig gis long ba'i tshogs mtha' dag mngon par 'gro bar 'dod pa'i yul du bde blag tu khrid par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu mig dang ldan pa gcig gis long ba'i tshogs mtha' dag mngon par 'gro bar 'dod pa'i yul du bde blag tu khrid par byed pa de bzhin du /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas kyang de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan rnams blangs nas bde bar gshegs pa'i sa kun tu 'od ces bya bar 'jog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas kyang de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan rnams blangs nas bde bar gshegs pa'i sa kun tu 'od ces bya bar 'jog par 'gyur te /
translated: so too does the perfection of wisdom lead the other perfections to the Sugata’s ground called “All-Illumination,”

original: yang dag pa'i lam dang lam ma yin pa mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam dang lam ma yin pa mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the very seeing of the correct path and the incorrect path.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: 'di rten 'byung ba'i de nyid mthong ba de //
analyzed: 'di rten 'byung ba'i de nyid mthong ba de //

original: shes rab gnas pas 'gog pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab gnas pas 'gog pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: is the attainment of cessation through the abiding of wisdom.”

original: zhes de skad du gang smras na /
analyzed: zhes de skad du gang smras na /
translated: If that is said,

original: ci ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba na /
analyzed: ci ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba na /
translated: how does a bodhisattva, when seeing dependent origination,

original: 'di la brten nas 'byung ba'i de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la brten nas 'byung ba'i de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: see the suchness of what arises in dependence?

original: bshad pa / de'i rang gi ngo bo ni mi rig pa'i ling thog mthug pos blo'i mig ma lus par g-yogs pa bdag cag gi yul du nye bar 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bshad pa / de'i rang gi ngo bo ni mi rig pa'i ling thog mthug pos blo'i mig ma lus par g-yogs pa bdag cag gi yul du nye bar 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Its essence is not an object of approach for us, whose eyes of intelligence are completely covered by the thick cataracts of ignorance.

original: drug pa la sogs pa sa gong ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yul du ni 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir de la kho bo cag la dri bar bya ba ma yin gyi gang dag stong pa nyid phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'i mig sman ma rig pa'i rab rib kyi ling thog 'joms pas bskus pa blo'i sbyin ma rig pa'i rab rib kyi ling thog
analyzed: drug pa la sogs pa sa gong ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yul du ni 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir de la kho bo cag la dri bar bya ba ma yin gyi gang dag stong pa nyid phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'i mig sman ma rig pa'i rab rib kyi ling thog 'joms pas bskus pa blo'i sbyin ma rig pa'i rab rib kyi ling thog
translated: But it is the domain of the bodhisattvas who abide on the sixth ground and above.🔽Therefore, it is not something that we should be questioned about. Rather, it is to be marveled at by the bodhisattvas and the Bhagavat Buddhas, who possess the eye ointment that is the unerring vision of emptiness, which is applied with the salve of intelligence that destroys the cataracts of the eye disease of ignorance.

original: dang bral ba dri ma med pa mnga' ba byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag nyid la rmad par bya'o //
analyzed: dang bral ba dri ma med pa mnga' ba byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag nyid la rmad par bya'o //
translated: They are free of the cataracts of the eye disease of ignorance.

original: gal te 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'phags pa sa bcu pa la sogs pa mdo sde gang dag 'don pa de dag las 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar rten cing🔽'brel par 'byung ba'i de nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin nam ;
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'phags pa sa bcu pa la sogs pa mdo sde gang dag 'don pa de dag las 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin nam ;
translated: If it is said that the noble perfection of wisdom and the noble ten grounds and so on are sūtras that are recited, then are they sūtras that state how bodhisattvas who practice the noble perfection of wisdom see the suchness of dependent arising?

translated: Ananda, this Licchavi youth Sarvalokapriyadarsana will, four hundred years after my nirvana, become a monk called Nagasena and will spread and teach my doctrine.

analyzed: 'di ltar res 'ga' ni mi mkhas pas stong pa nyid spangs nas ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dngos po thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa log par lta ba skyed nas 'phel bar byed do //

analyzed: de'i phyir ston pa pos lhag par mos pa'i khyad par nges par byas te /

analyzed: 'di la stong pa nyid nye bar bstan par bya'o zhes nges par dka' ba nges par nus she na /

analyzed: de ni phyi rol gyi mtshan ma rnams kyis nges par nus pas de'i rgyu mtshan nye bar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /

analyzed: so so skye bo'i dus na'ang stong pa nyid thos nas //

original: rab tu dga' ba las byung mchi mas mig brlan zhing //

original: lus kyi ba spu ldang bar gyur pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: lus kyi ba spu ldang bar gyur pa gang yin pa //

original: de la rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas blo yi sa bon yod //
analyzed: de la rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas blo yi sa bon yod //

original: de nyid nye bar bstan pa'i snod ni de yin te //
analyzed: de nyid nye bar bstan pa'i snod ni de yin te //
translated: That person is a vessel for the teaching of that.

original: de la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: de la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: The truth of ultimate reality, which will be explained below,

original: dam pa'i don gyi bden pa bstan par bya //
analyzed: dam pa'i don gyi bden pa bstan par bya //
translated: should be taught to such a person.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i nyan pa po la de kho na nyid ston pa po'i 'bad pa 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i nyan pa po la de kho na nyid ston pa po'i 'bad pa 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The effort of one who teaches reality to such a person as this will not be fruitless.🔽Why is this?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because,

analyzed: 'di ltar / de la de yi rjes su 'gro ba'i yon tan 'byung //
translated: the qualities that follow from it will arise in him.

analyzed: nyan pa po de la stong pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log shes bskyed pa'i don ma yin pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi lta ba nyan pa'i rgyu can yon tan rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /

analyzed: de stong pa nyid kyi lta ba nyan pa la gter rnyed pa dang 'dra bar sems shing de mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: rtag tu tshul khrims yang dag blangs nas gnas par 'gyur //
translated: he will always take up and maintain moral discipline in order to not lose it.

original: sbyin @246a * //
analyzed: sbyin @246a * //

analyzed: pa gtong bar 'gyur zhing snying rje sten par byed //

original: bzod pa sgom byed de yi dge ba byang chub tu //
analyzed: bzod pa sgom byed de yi dge ba byang chub tu //

original: 'gro ba dgrol bar bya phyir yongs su sdo byed cing //
analyzed: 'gro ba dgrol bar bya phyir yongs su sdo byed cing //
translated: to the liberation of the world,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gus par byed //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gus par byed //
translated: and he honors the bodhisattvas.

original: de la bdag tshul khrims 'chal ba'i rkyen gyis ngan 'gror ltung na stong pa nyid kyi lta ba rgyun chad par 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam du rig nas rtag tu tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas gnas so //
analyzed: de la bdag tshul khrims 'chal ba'i rkyen gyis ngan 'gror ltung na stong pa nyid kyi lta ba rgyun chad par 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam du rig nas rtag tu tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas gnas so //
translated: The bodhisattva thinks, “If I were to fall into miserable realms because of my immorality, my study of emptiness would be interrupted.” Thus, he always takes up and maintains morality.

original: bdag tshul khrims kyis bde 'gror skyes kyang dbul por gyur na zas dang sman dang chos gos la sogs pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad tshol ba lhur byed pas stong pa nyid nyan pa rgyun chad par 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam zhing sbyin pa gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag tshul khrims kyis bde 'gror skyes kyang dbul por gyur na zas dang sman dang chos gos la sogs pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad tshol ba lhur byed pas stong pa nyid nyan pa rgyun chad par 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam zhing sbyin pa gtong bar byed do //
translated: He thinks, “If I were to be reborn in a happy realm because of my morality, but were to be poor, I would be preoccupied with seeking the necessities of life, such as food, medicine, and Dharma robes, and my study of emptiness would be interrupted.” Thus, he gives gifts.

original: stong pa nyid kyi lta ba snying rjes yongs su zin pa ni sangs rgyas nyid 'dren par byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes snying rje sten par byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi lta ba snying rjes yongs su zin pa ni sangs rgyas nyid 'dren par byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes snying rje sten par byed do //
translated: He cultivates compassion, thinking, “The view of emptiness, when embraced by compassion, leads to Buddhahood, but not otherwise.”

original: khro bas ni ngan song du 'gro zhing kha dog ngan pa thob par byed pas de'i rkyen gyis 'phags pa rnams mnyes par byed par mi 'gyur ro snyam ste bzod pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: khro bas ni ngan song du 'gro zhing kha dog ngan pa thob par byed pas de'i rkyen gyis 'phags pa rnams mnyes par byed par mi 'gyur ro snyam ste bzod pa sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates patience, thinking, “Anger leads to bad rebirths and to an ugly complexion. For that reason, I will not displease the Noble Ones.”

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su ma bsdos pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa dag ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su ma bsdos pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa dag ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dpag tu med pa /
translated: He dedicates those roots of virtue to enlightenment, for the sake of liberating beings, thinking, “If I do not dedicate morality, etc., which are not fully dedicated to omniscience, to enlightenment, they will not become the cause and effect of attaining Buddhahood.

original: rnam par tshang pa med par 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang 'gro ba dgrol ba'i phyir byang chub tu rab tu sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam par tshang pa med par 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang 'gro ba dgrol ba'i phyir byang chub tu rab tu sngo bar byed do //
translated: They will not become immeasurable, and they will not become complete.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma gtogs par gzhan dag gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ji lta ba nyid nye bar bstan par mi nus so snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma gtogs par gzhan dag gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ji lta ba nyid nye bar bstan par mi nus so snyam du bsams nas /
translated: No one but a bodhisattva can teach the reality of dependent origination.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gus par byed do //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gus par byed do //
translated: Thus, he shows respect for the bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar yun ring por bar chad med par dge ba'i tshogs gdon mi za bar bsags par gyur nas /
analyzed: de ltar yun ring por bar chad med par dge ba'i tshogs gdon mi za bar bsags par gyur nas /
translated: In this way, he has accumulated the equipment of virtue for a long time without interruption.

original: zab cing rgya che'i tshul la mkhas pa'i skye bos ni //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che'i tshul la mkhas pa'i skye bos ni //
translated: The person who is skilled in the profound and vast

original: rim gyis rab tu dga' ba'i sa ni thob 'gyur bas //
analyzed: rim gyis rab tu dga' ba'i sa ni thob 'gyur bas //
translated: gradually attains the stage of perfect joy.

original: de ni don du gnyer bas lam 'di mnyan par gyis //
analyzed: de ni don du gnyer bas lam 'di mnyan par gyis //
translated: Therefore, one who seeks that should listen to this path.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba don du gnyer bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba don du gnyer bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one who seeks the stage of perfect joy should listen to this path.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: This means that which has the characteristics that will be explained.

original: de la chos rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid bstan pa la 'di ni re zhig lung yin te /
analyzed: de la chos rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid bstan pa la 'di ni re zhig lung yin te /
translated: In this regard, the following is the scripture that teaches the reality of things just as it is:

original: ji skad du 'phags @246b pas bcu pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags @246b pas bcu pa las /
translated: As said in the noble Ten Sublime Sutra:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug ste /
translated: “O children of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who has perfectly completed the path on the fifth bodhisattva ground will enter the sixth bodhisattva ground.

original: de chos mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug go //
analyzed: de chos mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug go //
translated: He will enter it through ten samenesses of phenomena.

original: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /🔽chos thams cad mtshan ma med par mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad mnyan nyid med par mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin du skye ba med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / dben pa dang / gdod ma nas rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste / chos thams cad mtshan ma med par mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad mnyan nyid med par mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin du skye ba med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / dben pa dang / gdod ma nas rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: What are the ten? They are as follows:🔽The sameness of all phenomena in being without characteristics, the sameness of all phenomena in being without observation, and likewise the sameness of all phenomena in being unborn, unarisen, void, primordially pure,🔽the sameness of all phenomena in being without conceptual elaborations, the sameness of all phenomena in being without acceptance, the sameness of all phenomena in being without rejection, the sameness of all phenomena in being like an illusion, a dream, an optical illusion, an echo, the reflection of the moon in water, a mirror image, and a magical creation,

original: spros pa med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mig yor dang brag ca dang chu zla dang gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa lta bur mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: spros pa med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mig yor dang brag ca dang chu zla dang gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa lta bur mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: and the sameness of all phenomena in being without self and without a sentient being.

original: chos thams cad dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su med par mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su med par mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: All phenomena are the same in being neither entities nor non-entities.

original: de chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de ltar rab tu rtogs pa na rno zhing rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa rjes su thob ste zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de ltar rab tu rtogs pa na rno zhing rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa rjes su thob ste zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: When he realizes the nature of all phenomena in this way, he attains the sixth bodhisattva ground, The Manifest, through sharp and harmonious acceptance.

original: de'i phyir 'dir chos skye ba dang mnyam pa nyid kho na rigs pas bstan pa nyid kyis chos mnyam pa nyid gzhan bstan pa sla bar dgongs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir chos skye ba dang mnyam pa nyid kho na rigs pas bstan pa nyid kyis chos mnyam pa nyid gzhan bstan pa sla bar dgongs te /
translated: Therefore, here, the master, thinking that the teaching of the equality of phenomena is easy to understand once the equality of the arising of phenomena is taught through reasoning,

original: slob dpon gyis dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi dang por /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi dang por /
translated: at the beginning of the Treatise on the Middle Way,🔽stated:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //🔽dngos po gang dag gang na yang //🔽skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang // skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: not from both, not without cause,🔽anywhere,🔽at any time,

original: zhes nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: the arising of any thing whatsoever never exists.

original: rnam yang zhes bya ba ni gzhar yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam yang zhes bya ba ni gzhar yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ Anywhere” means “at any time.”

original: gang na yang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'gar yang gi sgra'i rnam grangs rten gyi tshig gis ni yul dang dus dang grub pa'i mtha' bshad do //
analyzed: gang na yang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'gar yang gi sgra'i rnam grangs rten gyi tshig gis ni yul dang dus dang grub pa'i mtha' bshad do //
translated: The term “anywhere” is a synonym for the term “at all,” which refers to place, time, and philosophical theory.

original: gang dag gi sgra brten pa'i tshig ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi sgra brten pa'i tshig ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po brjod pa'o //
translated: The term “at all” refers to external and internal things.

original: des na phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams ni yul dang dus dang grub pa'i mtha' 'gar yang bdag las skye ba srid pa ma yin no zhes 'di ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams ni yul dang dus dang grub pa'i mtha' 'gar yang bdag las skye ba srid pa ma yin no zhes 'di ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the passage should be connected as follows: “External and internal things are never produced from themselves at all, in any place, at any time, or according to any philosophical theory.”

original: 'dir ma yin zhes bya ba 'di yod pa nyid kyi sgrub byed rang las skye ba dang sprel gyi yod pa dang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ma yin zhes bya ba 'di yod pa nyid kyi sgrub byed rang las skye ba dang sprel gyi yod pa dang ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the term “at all” is not connected with the reason “because they exist,” but with the thesis “they are produced from themselves.”

original: de dgag pa don gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin du dam bca' ba @247a * //
analyzed: de dgag pa don gyis grub pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du dam bca' ba @247a * //
translated: This is because the negation of that is established by implication.

original: gsum car la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum car la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to all three theses.

original: dam bca' ba bzhi po de rjes su brjod nas rigs pas sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: dam bca' ba bzhi po de rjes su brjod nas rigs pas sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Having stated the four theses, in order to prove them through reasoning, he says:

original: de nyid de las byung min gzhan dag las lta gal zhig / gnyis ka las kyang ma yin rgyu med par ni ga la yod //
analyzed: de nyid de las byung min gzhan dag las lta gal zhig / gnyis ka las kyang ma yin rgyu med par ni ga la yod //
translated: It does not arise from itself, nor from another, nor from both, nor without a cause.

original: bdag las skyes pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de nyid de las 'byung min zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag las skyes pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de nyid de las 'byung min zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of “it does not arise from itself” is the same as “it does not arise from that.”

original: de bzhin du lhag ma la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be applied in the same way.

original: yang 'di gang las nges she na 'di ltar //
analyzed: yang 'di gang las nges she na 'di ltar //
translated: Moreover, from what is this ascertained?

original: de ni de las byung na yon tan 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni de las byung na yon tan 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
translated: If it arises from itself, it has no value at all.

original: skyes par gyur pa slar yang skye ba rigs pa'ang ma yin nyid ;
analyzed: skyes par gyur pa slar yang skye ba rigs pa'ang ma yin nyid ;
translated: It is not reasonable for what has arisen to arise again.

original: / de ni zhes bya ba ni skye bzhin pa skye ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po ste myu gu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / de ni zhes bya ba ni skye bzhin pa skye ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po ste myu gu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ That” refers to the arising sprout, the agent of the action of arising.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni skye bzhin pa de nyid kyi bdag gi ngo bo las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni skye bzhin pa de nyid kyi bdag gi ngo bo las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ From that” means from the intrinsic reality of that arising.

original: de'i phyir myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid de nyid las myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid de nyid 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir dam bca' ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid de nyid las myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid de nyid 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir dam bca' ba'i don yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the thesis here is that the sprout’s own nature does not arise from the sprout’s own nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir bdag nyid yod pa thob pa de nyid myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid yod bzhin pa de nyid las 'byung ba la yon tan lhag pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang gi phyir bdag nyid yod pa thob pa de nyid myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid yod bzhin pa de nyid las 'byung ba la yon tan lhag pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Why is that?

original: yod pa nyid sngar thob zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid sngar thob zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because for that which has attained the status of existence, there is no additional quality that arises from the very existence of the sprout’s own nature, because existence has already been attained.

original: bdag las skye ba'i phyogs 'di ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba yang yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bdag las skye ba'i phyogs 'di ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba yang yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: This position of arising from self is also illogical.

original: skyes par gyur pa slar yang skye ba rigs pa'ang ma yin nyid //
analyzed: skyes par gyur pa slar yang skye ba rigs pa'ang ma yin nyid //
translated: It is illogical for that which has arisen to arise again.

original: ces bya'o // 'di na dam bca' ba tsam zhig tu zad pas rigs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: ces bya'o // 'di na dam bca' ba tsam zhig tu zad pas rigs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Here, since this is merely a thesis, from the perspective of logic,

original: skyes zin slar yang skye bar yongs su rtog par 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: skyes zin slar yang skye bar yongs su rtog par 'gyur na ni //
translated: if you conceive that which has arisen to arise again,

original: myu gu la sogs rnams kyi skye ba 'dir rnyed mi 'gyur zhing //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: myu gu la sogs rnams kyi skye ba 'dir rnyed mi 'gyur zhing // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The arising of sprouts and so on will not be found here.

original: skyes zin pa'i sa bon yang skye bar 'dod na ni /
analyzed: skyes zin pa'i sa bon yang skye bar 'dod na ni /
translated: This is because if you assert that a seed that has already arisen arises again,

original: gang gi 'di yang skye ba bkag nas myu gu skye bar rtog par byed par 'gyur ba slar yang de skye ba la gegs ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gang gi 'di yang skye ba bkag nas myu gu skye bar rtog par byed par 'gyur ba slar yang de skye ba la gegs ci zhig yod /
translated: then, having refuted the arising of that, you would conceive the arising of a sprout. Again, what prevents the arising of that?

original: de'i phyir myu gu dang sdong bu dang sbubs 'cha' ba la sogs pa rnams gtan mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir myu gu dang sdong bu dang sbubs 'cha' ba la sogs pa rnams gtan mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, a sprout, a stalk, a bud, and so on would never arise.

original: gzhan yang / sa bon sid mthar thug par rab tu skye ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / sa bon sid mthar thug par rab tu skye ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, a seed would arise until the end of the world,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is a cause, as has been explained.

original: ci ste myu gu skye ba la phan 'dogs pa'i rkyen chu dang dus la sogs pa rnams ni sa bon rnam par 'gyur bar byed cing myu @247b gu skyed par byed la /
analyzed: ci ste myu gu skye ba la phan 'dogs pa'i rkyen chu dang dus la sogs pa rnams ni sa bon rnam par 'gyur bar byed cing myu @247b gu skyed par byed la /
translated: But if you say that conditions such as water and time that assist the arising of a sprout transform the seed and produce the sprout,

original: myu gu de yang byed pa po dang lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir sa bon 'jig par byed cing 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: myu gu de yang byed pa po dang lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir sa bon 'jig par byed cing 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Also, because it is contradictory for the sprout to exist simultaneously with the agent, the seed is destroyed and arises.

original: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i nyes pa'i skabs med cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i nyes pa'i skabs med cing /
translated: Therefore, there is no opportunity for the faults stated previously.

original: sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir bdag las mi skye ba yang ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir bdag las mi skye ba yang ma yin no snyam na /
translated: And because the seed and sprout are not different, it is not the case that things are not produced from themselves.

original: 'di yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rung ste /
translated: This also is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why?

original: ji ltar de nyid kyis de rnam par 'jig par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid kyis de rnam par 'jig par byed par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be that it is destroyed by itself?

original: sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the seed and sprout are not different,

original: myu gus kyang 'di 'jig par byed par mi rigs te /
analyzed: myu gus kyang 'di 'jig par byed par mi rigs te /
translated: it is not logical for the sprout to destroy it,

original: rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽gzhan yang / byed rgyu sa bon gyi las tha dad myu gu'i dbyibs dang ni //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o // gzhan yang / byed rgyu sa bon gyi las tha dad myu gu'i dbyibs dang ni //
translated: just like its own self.🔽Moreover,

original: kha dog ro nus smin pa'i tha dad khyod la med par 'gyur //
analyzed: kha dog ro nus smin pa'i tha dad khyod la med par 'gyur //
translated: The shape, color, taste, potency, and ripening of the seed, the object of the action of the causal condition, would be nonexistent for you.

original: de la dbyibs ni ring po dang zlum po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbyibs ni ring po dang zlum po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Shape is long, round, and so on.

original: kha dog ni ser po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni ser po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Color is blue, yellow, and so on.

original: ro ni mngar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ro ni mngar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Taste is sweet, sour, and so on.

original: nus pa ni mthu'i khyad par nus mthu'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: nus pa ni mthu'i khyad par nus mthu'i bye brag ste /
translated: Potency is a special power, a particular ability.

original: dper na gzhang 'brum gyi sman lus dang nye ba tsam gyis gzhang 'brum sel ba dang / rtsi sman la sogs pa rnams bcangs pa tsam gyis nam mkha' la 'gro ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzhang 'brum gyi sman lus dang nye ba tsam gyis gzhang 'brum sel ba dang / rtsi sman la sogs pa rnams bcangs pa tsam gyis nam mkha' la 'gro ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the medicine for hemorrhoids eliminates hemorrhoids merely by being near the body, and the medicinal herbs and so on that cause flight merely by being worn.

original: rnam par smin pa ni rdzas kyi khyad par yongs su 'gyur bas thob par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni rdzas kyi khyad par yongs su 'gyur bas thob par bya ba ste /
translated: Maturation is to be obtained by the transformation of a special substance.

original: dper na pi pi ling la sogs pa rnams mngar po nyid du 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na pi pi ling la sogs pa rnams mngar po nyid du 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the substances such as long pepper become sweet.

original: gal te sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin na ni sa bon gyi rang gi bdag nyid la yod pa ltar /
analyzed: gal te sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin na ni sa bon gyi rang gi bdag nyid la yod pa ltar /
translated: If seeds and sprouts are not different, then just as the nature of the seed exists,

original: myu gu la yang dbyibs la sogs pa tha mi dad par dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: myu gu la yang dbyibs la sogs pa tha mi dad par dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: the shape and so on of the seed would also be observed in the sprout without distinction.

original: dmigs pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: sgog skya la sogs pa'i sa bon dag las chu shing la sogs pa'i myu gu rnams ltar gzhan ma yin pa nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: sgog skya la sogs pa'i sa bon dag las chu shing la sogs pa'i myu gu rnams ltar gzhan ma yin pa nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: it is not tenable that the sprout is not different from the seed, like the shoot of a plantain and so on from garlic and so forth.

original: ci ste sa bon gyi gnas skabs btang nas gnas skabs gzhan 'thob pas sa bon nyid myu gur 'gyur ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste sa bon gyi gnas skabs btang nas gnas skabs gzhan 'thob pas sa bon nyid myu gur 'gyur ba yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the seed becomes the sprout by relinquishing its status as a seed and attaining another status,

original: de ltar na yang /🔽gal te sngar gyi bdag gi dngos po bsal nas de las gzhan //
analyzed: de ltar na yang / gal te sngar gyi bdag gi dngos po bsal nas de las gzhan //
translated: then in that case,

original: ngo bor 'gyur na de tshe de yi de nyid ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo bor 'gyur na de tshe de yi de nyid ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: if the seed were to become something else, having eliminated its previous nature, then how could it be the same as that?

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de gzhan ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de gzhan ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “its nature” is “that itself” and not another.

original: rtog pa 'di las myu gu'i gzhan ma yin pa nyid srid pa ma yin pas 'di'i gzhan ma yin pa nyid snyam pa yin @248a * //
analyzed: rtog pa 'di las myu gu'i gzhan ma yin pa nyid srid pa ma yin pas 'di'i gzhan ma yin pa nyid snyam pa yin @248a * //
translated: Since it is impossible for the sprout to be nondifferent from the seed, you might think that the seed is the same as the sprout.

original: no ; / ci ste sa bon dang myu gu dag dbyibs la sogs pa tha dad kyang rdzas tha mi dad do snyam na /
analyzed: no ; / ci ste sa bon dang myu gu dag dbyibs la sogs pa tha dad kyang rdzas tha mi dad do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the seed and the sprout are not different in substance, even though they are different in shape and so on,

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: dbyibs la sogs pa ma bzung na de dag gi rdzas ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa ma bzung na de dag gi rdzas ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if shape, etc. are not apprehended, their substance is not apprehended.

original: gzhan yang / gal te khyod kyi sa bon myu gu 'dir gzhan ma yin na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te khyod kyi sa bon myu gu 'dir gzhan ma yin na //
translated: Moreover, if the seed is not different from the sprout,

original: sa bon bzhin du myu gu zhes bya de bzung med pa'am //
analyzed: sa bon bzhin du myu gu zhes bya de bzung med pa'am //
translated: then like the seed, the so-called sprout would not be apprehended.

original: yang na de dag gcig pas ji ltar myu gu 'di bzhin du //
analyzed: yang na de dag gcig pas ji ltar myu gu 'di bzhin du //
translated: Or, since they are the same, just as the sprout is apprehended,

original: de yang gzung du yod 'gyur de phyir 'di ni khas mi blang //
analyzed: de yang gzung du yod 'gyur de phyir 'di ni khas mi blang //
translated: so the seed also would be apprehended. Therefore, this is unacceptable.

original: ji ltar myu gu'i gnas skabs sa bon gyi bdag nyid rang gi ngo bos gzung du med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar myu gu'i gnas skabs sa bon gyi bdag nyid rang gi ngo bos gzung du med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the seed is not apprehended by intrinsic reality in the state of the sprout,

original: sa bon las gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir sa bon gyi rang gi bdag nyid ltar myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid kyang gzung du yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon las gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir sa bon gyi rang gi bdag nyid ltar myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid kyang gzung du yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: so, because it is not different from the seed, the intrinsic reality of the sprout also would not be apprehended, just like the intrinsic reality of the seed.

original: yang na ji ltar myu gu gzung du yod pa de bzhin du myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid ltar sa bon yang gzung du yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar myu gu gzung du yod pa de bzhin du myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid ltar sa bon yang gzung du yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Or, just as the sprout is apprehended, so the seed also would be apprehended, just like the intrinsic reality of the sprout.

original: myu gu la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different from such things as sprouts.

original: nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba yongs su spang bar 'dod pas ni sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du khas blang bar bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba yongs su spang bar 'dod pas ni sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du khas blang bar bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, those who wish to completely avoid the fault of the consequence that seeds and sprouts would be identical should not accept that seeds and sprouts are not different.

original: de'i phyir de ltar de nyid rtogs par 'dod pa'i lugs gzhan du brtag pa'i bdag las skye ba bzlog nas lugs gzhan du blo ma sbyangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang rtog pa 'di mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar de nyid rtogs par 'dod pa'i lugs gzhan du brtag pa'i bdag las skye ba bzlog nas lugs gzhan du blo ma sbyangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang rtog pa 'di mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, in this way, having refuted arising from self in another system that is accepted by the opponent, Candrakīrti explains that this conception is untenable even in terms of the conventions of the untrained world, in another system:

original: gang gi rgyu zhig na yang de yi 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gang gi rgyu zhig na yang de yi 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the effect is seen when the cause no longer exists,

original: de dag gcig pa yin zhes 'jig rten gyis kyang khas mi len //
analyzed: de dag gcig pa yin zhes 'jig rten gyis kyang khas mi len //
translated: The world does not accept that they are the same.

original: 'di ltar rgyu sa bon zhes bya ba 'gags zin kyang 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba mthong ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu sa bon zhes bya ba 'gags zin kyang 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba mthong ba de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, although the cause called “seed” has already ceased, the effect called “sprout” is seen.

original: 'jig rten gyis kyang sa bon myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis kyang sa bon myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du mi mthong ste /
translated: The world also does not see seeds and sprouts as not different.

original: gcig nyid yin na ni rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang mthong par mi 'gyur ba zhig na mthong ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na ni rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang mthong par mi 'gyur ba zhig na mthong ba yang yin te /
translated: If they were the same, then just as the cause is seen, the effect would not be seen. But it is seen.

original: de'i phyir de dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not not different.

original: gang gi phyir phyogs gnyi ga ltar yang bdag las skye ba rigs pa dang 'gal ba //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs gnyi ga ltar yang bdag las skye ba rigs pa dang 'gal ba //
translated: Since arising from self is inconsistent with both positions,🔽Therefore, this postulation

original: de phyir dngos po bdag las 'byung zhes rab tu brtags pa 'di //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po bdag las 'byung zhes rab tu brtags pa 'di //
translated: That things arise from self

original: de nyid dang ni 'jig rten du yang rigs pa ma yin no //🔽de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis khyad par du ma mdzad par /
analyzed: de nyid dang ni 'jig rten du yang rigs pa ma yin no // de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis khyad par du ma mdzad par /
translated: Is neither in reality nor in the world.

original: bdag las ma yin zhes @248b spyir skye ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin zhes @248b spyir skye ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: For this reason, the master Nāgārjuna did not make any distinctions and in general refuted arising from self.🔽Things do not arise from self,

original: gang zhig dngos po rnams ni don dam par bdag las skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po rnams ni don dam par bdag las skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: Because that would be pointless and things would not always arise.

original: yod pa'i phyir sems can bzhin no zhes khyad par du byed pa de'i don dam par zhes bya ba'i khyad par don med do zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir sems can bzhin no zhes khyad par du byed pa de'i don dam par zhes bya ba'i khyad par don med do zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: Because it exists, it is like sentient beings. The distinction “ultimately” is meaningless.🔽Moreover, if you assert arising from self,🔽the produced and the producer,

original: gzhan yang / bdag las skye bar 'dod na bskyed par bya dang skyed byed dang // las dang byed pa po yang gcig nyid 'gyur na de dag ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bdag las skye bar 'dod na bskyed par bya dang skyed byed dang // las dang byed pa po yang gcig nyid 'gyur na de dag ni //
translated: the object and the agent, would be identical.

original: gcig nyid ma yin pas na bdag las skye bar khas blang bar //
analyzed: gcig nyid ma yin pas na bdag las skye bar khas blang bar //
translated: But since they are not identical, arising from self🔽should not be accepted.

original: bya min rgya cher bshad pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: bya min rgya cher bshad pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: Because the faults explained extensively would follow.

original: ji skad du /🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid du //
analyzed: ji skad du / rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid du //
translated: As it is said:🔽The effect and the cause are never tenable

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: as being identical.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid na //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid na //
translated: If the effect and the cause were identical,

original: skye dang bskyed pa gcig tu 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye dang bskyed pa gcig tu 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: arising and the producer would be identical.

original: gcig pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Identity does not exist.

original: pha dang bu dag gam mig dang rnam par shes pa dag kyang gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha dang bu dag gam mig dang rnam par shes pa dag kyang gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that the father and the son, or the eye and the eye consciousness, would be identical.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: gal te shing de me yin na ;
analyzed: gal te shing de me yin na ;
translated: If that fuel were fire,

original: / byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: then agent and action would be one.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pa las na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pa las na /
translated: Thus, because of the fear of such faults being entailed,

original: bden pa gnyis phyin ci ma log par rtogs par 'dod pas dngos po rnams bdag las skye bar khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis phyin ci ma log par rtogs par 'dod pas dngos po rnams bdag las skye bar khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: those who wish to understand the two truths without error should not accept that things arise from themselves.

original: 'dir dngos po rnams bdag las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di nges pa yin la phyogs 'di ni rigs pa nyid kyang yin na /🔽gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po rnams bdag las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di nges pa yin la phyogs 'di ni rigs pa nyid kyang yin na / gang 'di skad du /
translated: Here, the statement “Things do not arise from themselves” is certain, and this position is also reasonable.🔽But it is unreasonable to say,

original: gzhan dag las lta ga la zhig / ces smras pa de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan dag las lta ga la zhig / ces smras pa de ni mi rigs so //
translated: “How could they arise from others?”

original: 'di ltar gzhan du gyur pa'i rkyen bzhi po rgyu dang dmigs pa dang de ma thag pa dang de bzhin du bdag po ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan du gyur pa'i rkyen bzhi po rgyu dang dmigs pa dang de ma thag pa dang de bzhin du bdag po ste /
translated: Thus the four conditions that are different are the causal condition, the observed object condition, the immediately preceding condition, and the dominant condition.

original: rkyen rnams dngos po rnams kyi skyed par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i gsung rab la ltos nas mi 'dod bzhin du yang gzhan las skye bar khas blang bar bya'o //🔽de la kha cig na re /
analyzed: rkyen rnams dngos po rnams kyi skyed par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i gsung rab la ltos nas mi 'dod bzhin du yang gzhan las skye bar khas blang bar bya'o // de la kha cig na re /
translated: Conditions are the producers of things.

original: rgyu'i rkyen ni byed rgyu ma gtogs pa'i rgyu lnga'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ni byed rgyu ma gtogs pa'i rgyu lnga'o //
translated: Some say: The causal condition is the five causes excluding active cause.

original: de la dmigs par byas na dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs par byas na dmigs pa ste /
translated: The objective condition is that which is observed.

original: ci rigs par rnam par shes pa drug gi dmigs pa chos thams cad ni dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: ci rigs par rnam par shes pa drug gi dmigs pa chos thams cad ni dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
translated: All phenomena that are the objects of observation of the six consciousnesses, as is appropriate, are objective conditions.

original: phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i sems las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i sems las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is minds and mental factors other than the mind entering the nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: byed rgyu ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: byed rgyu ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhe'o //
translated: The active cause is the dominant condition.

original: @249a * // gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: @249a * // gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: sgrub par byed pa ni rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid las gang zhig gang gi skyed par byed pa sa bon gyi ngo bor gnas pa de ni de'i rgyu'i rkyen yin la /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid las gang zhig gang gi skyed par byed pa sa bon gyi ngo bor gnas pa de ni de'i rgyu'i rkyen yin la /
translated: The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.

original: skyes bu rgan po ldang ba ltar sems dang sems las byung ba rgyu las skyes bzhin pa rnams rten bar ba dang 'dra ba'i dmigs pa gang gis bskyed par 'gyur ba de ni dmigs pa'i rkyen te /🔽skye bzhin pa'i chos kyi rten yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu rgan po ldang ba ltar sems dang sems las byung ba rgyu las skyes bzhin pa rnams rten bar ba dang 'dra ba'i dmigs pa gang gis bskyed par 'gyur ba de ni dmigs pa'i rkyen te / skye bzhin pa'i chos kyi rten yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.

original: rgyu 'gags ma thag pa ni 'bras bu skye ba'i rkyen yin te /🔽dper na sa bon 'gags ma thag pa myu gu'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'gags ma thag pa ni 'bras bu skye ba'i rkyen yin te / dper na sa bon 'gags ma thag pa myu gu'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.

original: gang zhig yod na gang 'byung ba de ni de'i bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yod na gang 'byung ba de ni de'i bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhe'o //
translated: The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.🔽The object-field of the present thought and thought-concomitants is the condition as object-field.

original: yang rkyen gzhan gang dag lhan cig skyes pa dang phyi nas skyes pa la sogs pa de dag kyang 'di rnams kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: yang rkyen gzhan gang dag lhan cig skyes pa dang phyi nas skyes pa la sogs pa de dag kyang 'di rnams kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, all other conditions, whether they arise simultaneously or subsequently, are included among these.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa dag ni rkyen ma yin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa dag ni rkyen ma yin te de'i phyir /
translated: Īśvara and so on are not conditions, and therefore:

original: rkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin //
translated: The fifth condition does not exist.

original: zhes nges par 'dzin par byed do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: zhes nges par 'dzin par byed do zhes smra'o //
translated: Thus, the Sāṃkhyas hold their position with conviction.

original: 'di ni gzhag par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhag par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a position that can be maintained,

original: rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it contradicts reasoning and scripture.

original: de la rigs pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa /
analyzed: de la rigs pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa /
translated: With regard to that, from the perspective of reasoning, it is said:

original: gzhan la brten nas gal te gnas zhig 'byung bar 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: gzhan la brten nas gal te gnas zhig 'byung bar 'gyur na ni //
translated: If a thing called “abiding” arises in dependence on another,

original: 'o na me lce bas kyang mun pa mthug po 'byung 'gyur zhing ste gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na me lce bas kyang mun pa mthug po 'byung 'gyur zhing ste gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then thick darkness would arise from a flame, because they are different.

original: de ni mthong ba'am rig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'am rig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is neither seen nor known,

original: de'i phyir 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and therefore this is not the case.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du //
translated: Cause and effect are not different.

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is never tenable.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid na /
translated: If cause and effect were different,

original: rgyu dang rgyu min mtshungs par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu min mtshungs par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: cause and non-cause would be equivalent.

original: gzhan yang / thams cad las kyang thams cad skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / thams cad las kyang thams cad skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, everything would arise from everything,

original: rgyur gyur pa dang rgyu ma yin par gyur pa thams cad las kyang dngos po 'bras bur gyur pa dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa dang rgyu ma yin par gyur pa thams cad las kyang dngos po 'bras bur gyur pa dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because from all things, both those that are causes and those that are not causes, all things, both those that are effects and those that are not effects, would arise.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: skyed par byed pa ma yin ma lus pa yang gzhan nyid mtshungs //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin ma lus pa yang gzhan nyid mtshungs //
translated: even all that is not a producer is equivalent in being different.

original: ji ltar skyed par byed pa'i s'a lu sa bon rang gi 'bras bu s'a lu'i myu gu las gzhan nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar skyed par byed pa'i s'a lu sa bon rang gi 'bras bu s'a lu'i myu gu las gzhan nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a rice seed that is a producer is different from its effect, the rice sprout,

original: skyed par byed pa ma yin pa me dang sol ba dang nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa yang @249b yin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin pa me dang sol ba dang nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa yang @249b yin no //
translated: so also that which is not a producer, such as fire, charcoal, and barley seeds, is different.

original: ji ltar s'a lu'i sa bon gzhan du gyur pa las sva lu'i myu gu skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar s'a lu'i sa bon gzhan du gyur pa las sva lu'i myu gu skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a rice sprout arises from a rice seed,

original: me dang sol ba dang nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa dag las kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me dang sol ba dang nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa dag las kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: so it would also arise from fire, charcoal, barley seeds, and so on.

original: yang ji ltar s'a lu'i myu gu'i gzhan du gyur pa s'a lu'i sa bon las 'byung ba de bzhin du bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnams kyang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar s'a lu'i myu gu'i gzhan du gyur pa s'a lu'i sa bon las 'byung ba de bzhin du bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnams kyang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Moreover, just as a rice sprout arises from a rice seed, so a pot, cloth, and so on would also arise from a rice seed.

original: de ni mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not seen.

original: de'i phyir 'di yang yod pa ma yin no //🔽'dir smras pa /🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis la gzhan nyid kyang yod la thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar thal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yang yod pa ma yin no // 'dir smras pa / rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis la gzhan nyid kyang yod la thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar thal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore this is also not possible.

original: nges pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Objection: Although cause and effect are different, not everything arises from everything, because a restriction is seen.

original: 'dir nges pa ni 'di yin te /🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'dir nges pa ni 'di yin te / gang gi phyir /
translated: Here the restriction is this:

original: rab tu bya bar nus pa de'i phyir 'bras bur nges brjod cing //
analyzed: rab tu bya bar nus pa de'i phyir 'bras bur nges brjod cing //
translated: Because it is able to perform a function, it is called the effect.

original: gang zhig des bskyed nus pa de ni gzhan na'ang rgyu yin la //
analyzed: gang zhig des bskyed nus pa de ni gzhan na'ang rgyu yin la //
translated: And that which is able to produce it is the cause, even if it is different.

original: rgyud gcig gtogs dang skyed par byed las skye ba de yi phyir //
analyzed: rgyud gcig gtogs dang skyed par byed las skye ba de yi phyir //
translated: Because it belongs to the same continuum and because it arises from the producer,🔽the sprout is the effect of the seed.

original: s'a lu'i myu gu nas la sogs las de lta min zhe na //
analyzed: s'a lu'i myu gu nas la sogs las de lta min zhe na //
translated: The rice sprout is not like that from the barley seed, etc.

original: 'dir 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Here, the term “effect”

original: nus pa'i don la kri tya'i rkyen can te /
analyzed: nus pa'i don la kri tya'i rkyen can te /
translated: is a kṛtya suffix that indicates potentiality.

original: gang zhig gang gis bya bar nus pa de nyid de'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis bya bar nus pa de nyid de'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: That which is able to perform the action is the effect of that.

original: gang zhig 'bras bu 'di bskyed par nus pa de ni gzhan yin du zin kyang rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'bras bu 'di bskyed par nus pa de ni gzhan yin du zin kyang rgyu yin te /
translated: That which is able to produce this effect is the cause, even if it is different.

original: des na gzhan nyid khyad par can kho nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gzhan nyid khyad par can kho nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dngos po yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the state of cause and effect is only due to a specific difference.

original: gzhan nyid kyi spyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi spyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not due to the general difference.

original: rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa dang skyed par byed pa de las kyang skye ba yin gyi rgyud tha dad par gtogs pa nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa dang skyed par byed pa de las kyang skye ba yin gyi rgyud tha dad par gtogs pa nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa'am /
translated: It arises from that which belongs to the same continuum and that which produces it, but not from that which belongs to a different continuum, such as a barley seed, etc.

original: rgyud gcig tu gtogs kyang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa skad cig ma phyi ma las kyang skad cig ma snga ma ma yin pas thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu gtogs kyang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa skad cig ma phyi ma las kyang skad cig ma snga ma ma yin pas thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But even though they belong to the same continuum, the later moment is not the earlier moment, and therefore it is not the producer. Thus, it is not the case that everything would arise from everything.

original: 'di ni mi rung ste /🔽'di ltar gang s'a lu'i myu gu'i rgyu ni s'a lu'i sa bon kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rung ste / 'di ltar gang s'a lu'i myu gu'i rgyu ni s'a lu'i sa bon kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin la /
translated: This is not correct.🔽Why is it certain that the cause of a rice seedling is only a rice seed and not something else, and that the effect of a rice seed is only a rice seedling and not something else?

original: s'a lu'i sa bon gyi 'bras bu ni s'a lu'i myu gu kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa 'di ko gang las yin zhes re zhig 'di nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu smra ba 'di la 'dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon gyi 'bras bu ni s'a lu'i myu gu kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa 'di ko gang las yin zhes re zhig 'di nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu smra ba 'di la 'dri bar bya'o //
translated: First, this should be asked of the proponents of cause and effect.

original: smras pa / nges pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / nges pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, “Because we see certainty,”

original: yang ci'i phyir de ltar nges pa mthong zhes brgal zhing brtags pa na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de ltar nges pa mthong zhes brgal zhing brtags pa na /
translated: then why do you see certainty in that way?

original: gang gi phyir nges pa mthong ba de'i phyir nges pa mthong ngo @250a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nges pa mthong ba de'i phyir nges pa mthong ngo @250a * //
translated: If you say, “Because we see certainty,” then you see certainty because of certainty.

original: zhes bya ba de tsam zhig smra ba 'dis ni nges pa'i rgyu ma bstan par bshad zin pa'i nyes pa cung zad kyang spang par mi nus so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de tsam zhig smra ba 'dis ni nges pa'i rgyu ma bstan par bshad zin pa'i nyes pa cung zad kyang spang par mi nus so //
translated: This mere statement does not in the least avoid the faults already explained, since it does not teach a definitive reason.

original: gzhan yang gzhan nyid thun mong pa khyad par du yongs su ma bcad pa shin tu grags pa 'di nyid 'di'i ji lta ba bzhin 'dod pa la gnod byed du yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan nyid thun mong pa khyad par du yongs su ma bcad pa shin tu grags pa 'di nyid 'di'i ji lta ba bzhin 'dod pa la gnod byed du yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Moreover, this very well-known common otherness, which is not specified, is a refutation of the assertion of the opponent just as it is.

original: ji ltar nas dang ge sar dang ni king shu ka la sogs //
analyzed: ji ltar nas dang ge sar dang ni king shu ka la sogs //
translated: Just as barley, lotus, and kiṃśuka

original: s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed par 'dod min nus ldan min //
analyzed: s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed par 'dod min nus ldan min //
translated: are not asserted to be producers of rice sprouts, they are not potent.

original: rgyud gcig khongs su gtogs min 'dra ba ma yin nyid de bzhin //
analyzed: rgyud gcig khongs su gtogs min 'dra ba ma yin nyid de bzhin //
translated: They are not in the same continuum, nor are they similar.

original: s'a lu'i sa bon yang ni de yi min te gzhan nyid phyir //
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon yang ni de yi min te gzhan nyid phyir //
translated: The rice seed is not like them, because it is different.

original: ji ltar nas dang ge sar dang king shu ka la sogs pa rnams gzhan yin pa'i phyir s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed par mi 'dod cing /
analyzed: ji ltar nas dang ge sar dang king shu ka la sogs pa rnams gzhan yin pa'i phyir s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed par mi 'dod cing /
translated: Just as barley, lotus, kiṃśuka, and so on are not asserted to be producers of rice sprouts because they are different,

original: s'a lu'i myu gu bskyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa ma yin pa dang 'dra ba ma yin pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: s'a lu'i myu gu bskyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa ma yin pa dang 'dra ba ma yin pa de bzhin du //
translated: It is not like the non-existent potential to produce a rice sprout, nor is it like the non-existent belonging to the same continuum.

original: s'a lu'i sa bon yang de la ji skad bshad pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon yang de la ji skad bshad pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the rice seed is not distinguished by the distinctions explained above,

original: gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is different.

original: de ltar re zhig gzhan la grags pa'i gzhan nyid grub grub ltar rjes su brjod nas sun 'byin byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gzhan la grags pa'i gzhan nyid grub grub ltar rjes su brjod nas sun 'byin byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, first, having stated the otherness that is accepted by the other party, the refutation is made.

original: da ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi gzhan nyid mi srid par bshad pa //
analyzed: da ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi gzhan nyid mi srid par bshad pa //
translated: Now, it will be explained that the otherness of cause and effect is impossible.

original: myu gu sa bon dang ni dus mnyam yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: myu gu sa bon dang ni dus mnyam yod pa ma yin te //
translated: The sprout does not exist simultaneously with the seed,

original: gzhan nyid med par sa bon gzhan pa nyid du ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med par sa bon gzhan pa nyid du ga la 'gyur //
translated: because without otherness, how could the seed be different?

original: des na myu gu sa bon las skye 'grub par 'gyur min nas //
analyzed: des na myu gu sa bon las skye 'grub par 'gyur min nas //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the sprout arising from the seed is not established,

original: gzhan las skye ba yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di gtang bar byos //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di gtang bar byos //
translated: so give up this position that it arises from another.

original: 'di na byams pa dang nyer sbas yod bzhin pa dag kho na phan tshun ltos nas gzhan nyid du mthong gi / sa bon dang myu gu dag ni de ltar cig car dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na byams pa dang nyer sbas yod bzhin pa dag kho na phan tshun ltos nas gzhan nyid du mthong gi / sa bon dang myu gu dag ni de ltar cig car dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Here, Maitreya and Upagupta, who exist, are seen to be mutually different in dependence on each other, but seeds and sprouts are not observed simultaneously.

original: sa bon rnam par ma gyur par myu gu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon rnam par ma gyur par myu gu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a sprout does not exist without the transformation of the seed.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar sa bon dang dus mnyam du myu gu yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir sa bon la myu gu las gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar sa bon dang dus mnyam du myu gu yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir sa bon la myu gu las gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Since in this way the sprout does not exist simultaneously with the seed, therefore the seed does not exist as different from the sprout.

original: gzhan nyid med na gzhan las myu gu skye'o zhes bya ba 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med na gzhan las myu gu skye'o zhes bya ba 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And if it does not exist as different, then it is not the case that the sprout arises from something else.

original: de'i phyir gzhan las skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan las skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this position that it arises from something else should be abandoned.

original: don 'di ni /
analyzed: don 'di ni /
translated: This point is explained in the following:

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The essence of things

original: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin //
translated: Does not exist in conditions and so on.

original: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
translated: If its own nature does not exist,

original: gzhan @250b gyi dngos po ga la yod //🔽ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan @250b gyi dngos po ga la yod //🔽ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: How could the nature of something else exist?

original: 'dir rkyen la sogs la zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'am rkyen dag gam /
analyzed: 'dir rkyen la sogs la zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'am rkyen dag gam /
translated: Here, “and so on” refers to causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa'am de las gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa'am de las gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Here, “conditions, etc.” means causes, conditions, or the collection of causes and conditions, or something other than that.

original: rang bzhin rnam par ma gyur pa na 'bras bu rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam par ma gyur pa na 'bras bu rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When there is no transformation of intrinsic reality, the intrinsic reality of effects does not exist at all, because they are not arisen.

original: de med na rkyen la sogs pa rnams la gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med na rkyen la sogs pa rnams la gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If they do not exist, then otherness in conditions, etc. does not exist.

original: gang yod pas na yod pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yod pas na yod pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni bdun pa yin no //
translated: This is the seventh characteristic of existence.

original: gang gi tshe gzhi yin pa de'i tshe na 'bras bu rnams kyi rang bzhin rkyen la sogs pa dag la 'khar gzhong dang rgya shug ltar yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhi yin pa de'i tshe na 'bras bu rnams kyi rang bzhin rkyen la sogs pa dag la 'khar gzhong dang rgya shug ltar yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When there is a basis, at that time the intrinsic reality of effects does not exist in conditions, etc., like a dish does not exist in jujube fruit.

original: gang zhig gang na med pa de ni de las skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang na med pa de ni de las skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not exist in something is not arisen from that,

original: dper na bye ma dag la til mar bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na bye ma dag la til mar bzhin te /
translated: like sesame oil does not exist in sand.

original: ci ste de ni med par yang //
analyzed: ci ste de ni med par yang //
translated: If it does not exist in that,🔽how could it arise from that?

original: rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na //🔽rkyen ma yin pa dag las kyang //
analyzed: rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na // rkyen ma yin pa dag las kyang //
translated: If it arises from those conditions,

original: ci yi phyir na skyed mi 'gyur //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na skyed mi 'gyur // zhes ji skad gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Why does it not arise from non-conditions?

original: de'i phyir rten gyi phyogs 'di ni slob dpon nyid kyis tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba kho nas ches legs par rnam par phye bas nye bar ma bkod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten gyi phyogs 'di ni slob dpon nyid kyis tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba kho nas ches legs par rnam par phye bas nye bar ma bkod do //
translated: Therefore, since this position of the basis has been very well analyzed by the master himself through the composition of these very verses, I will not elaborate further.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: myu gu sa bon dang ni dus mnyam yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: myu gu sa bon dang ni dus mnyam yod pa ma yin te //
translated: “The sprout does not exist simultaneously with the seed.”

original: zhes gang smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te //🔽ji ltar srang mda'i mthon dman dag dus gcig nyid du mthong ba de bzhin du sa bon 'gag bzhin pa na myu gu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te // ji ltar srang mda'i mthon dman dag dus gcig nyid du mthong ba de bzhin du sa bon 'gag bzhin pa na myu gu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: What was said is unreasonable.🔽Just as the rising and falling of a scale are seen simultaneously, so too the sprout arises when the seed is ceasing.

original: 'di ltar gang kho na'i tshe sa bon 'gag pa de'i tshe kho nar dus gcig nyid du myu gu skye ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na'i tshe sa bon 'gag pa de'i tshe kho nar dus gcig nyid du myu gu skye ba yin te /
