translated: In this way, just when the seed ceases, at that very time, simultaneously, the sprout arises.

original: de'i phyir sa bon 'gag pa dang myu gu skye ba gnyis dus gcig pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag kyang dus mnyam par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon 'gag pa dang myu gu skye ba gnyis dus gcig pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag kyang dus mnyam par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, since the cessation of the seed and the arising of the sprout are simultaneous, the seed and sprout would be simultaneous.

original: de'i phyir gzhan nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate that they are different, he says:🔽Just as the two ends of a scale move up and down,

original: ji ltar srang gi mda' gnyis mtho ba dang dma' ba dag / dus mnyam ma yin par ni min par mthong ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar srang gi mda' gnyis mtho ba dang dma' ba dag / dus mnyam ma yin par ni min par mthong ba de bzhin du //
translated: they are seen not to be simultaneous.🔽In the same way, the arising and ceasing of the produced and the producer

original: bskyed par bya dang skyed byed dag gi skye 'gag 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: bskyed par bya dang skyed byed dag gi skye 'gag 'gyur zhe na //
translated: occur simultaneously.

original: zhes bya ba ste de'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste de'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore there is no error.

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: Even so,

original: gal te gcig tshe yin na 'dir dus gcig med de yod min //
analyzed: gal te gcig tshe yin na 'dir dus gcig med de yod min //
translated: if they exist at the same time, they do not exist at the same time here.

original: gal te srang gi dpes bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa gnyis kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa dus gcig tu rtog na de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te srang gi dpes bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa gnyis kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa dus gcig tu rtog na de mi rung ngo //
translated: If you imagine that the arising and ceasing of the produced and the producer are simultaneous, like the two ends of a scale, that is illogical.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te yang @251a * //
analyzed: gal te yang @251a * //
translated: If they exist at the same time,

original: srang gi dper mtho dman dus gcig pa nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: srang gi dper mtho dman dus gcig pa nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: In the example of the scale, the rising and falling occur at the same time.

original: de lta na yang dpe las byung ba'i don dngos po la dus gcig pa nyid med pas 'di mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta na yang dpe las byung ba'i don dngos po la dus gcig pa nyid med pas 'di mi rigs so //
translated: However, since the meaning that arises from the example does not exist at the same time in reality, this is illogical.

original: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate how this is illogical, he says:

original: gal te skye bzhin pa de skye la phyogs pas yod min zhing //
analyzed: gal te skye bzhin pa de skye la phyogs pas yod min zhing //
translated: If you assert that that which is in the process of arising exists because it is oriented toward arising,

original: 'gag bzhin pa ni yod kyang 'jig la phyogs par 'dod gyur pa //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ni yod kyang 'jig la phyogs par 'dod gyur pa //
translated: and that which is in the process of ceasing exists but is oriented toward cessation,

original: de tshe 'di ni ji lta bur na srang dang mtshungs pa yin //🔽de la skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la mngon du phyogs pas ma 'ongs pa yin la 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir da ltar ba yin te /
analyzed: de tshe 'di ni ji lta bur na srang dang mtshungs pa yin // de la skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la mngon du phyogs pas ma 'ongs pa yin la 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir da ltar ba yin te /
translated: then how could this be similar to the scale?🔽In this context, that which is called “in the process of arising” is the future because it is oriented toward arising. That which is called “in the process of ceasing” is the present because it is oriented toward cessation.

original: de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba yin la yod pa nyid da ltar ba yin pas 'gag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba yin la yod pa nyid da ltar ba yin pas 'gag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it does not exist, it arises because it is not yet arisen. Since it exists, it ceases because it is present.

original: gang gi tshe 'di de ltar yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar srang dang mtshungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di de ltar yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar srang dang mtshungs par 'gyur /
translated: But if that is so, how could it be similar to a scale?

original: srang mda' gnyis la ni da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: srang mda' gnyis la ni da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the two arms of a scale are present,

original: mthon dman gyi bya ba dag dus gcig pa nyid yod kyi sa bon dang myu gu da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag la ni dus gcig med pas 'di ni srang dang mtshungs pa ma yin no /
analyzed: mthon dman gyi bya ba dag dus gcig pa nyid yod kyi sa bon dang myu gu da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag la ni dus gcig med pas 'di ni srang dang mtshungs pa ma yin no /
translated: the activities of rising and falling occur at the same time. But since the seed and sprout are not present and future, they are not similar to a scale.

original: ci ste chos dag dus gcig pa nyid med mod kyi //🔽de lta na yang de'i bya ba dag la dus gcig pa nyid yod do snyam na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: ci ste chos dag dus gcig pa nyid med mod kyi // de lta na yang de'i bya ba dag la dus gcig pa nyid yod do snyam na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: But even if the two phenomena are not simultaneous,🔽their activities are simultaneous.

original: de dag gi bya ba chos las tha dad par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi bya ba chos las tha dad par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is also unacceptable because we do not accept that the activities of those phenomena are different from the phenomena themselves.

original: gzhan yang skye ba 'di ni byed po med par rigs pa'i ngo bo'ang min //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba 'di ni byed po med par rigs pa'i ngo bo'ang min //
translated: Moreover, it is illogical for arising to exist without an agent.

original: skye ba'i bya ba gang yin pa de'i byed pa po myu gu ni ma 'ongs pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba'i bya ba gang yin pa de'i byed pa po myu gu ni ma 'ongs pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The sprout, which is the agent of the activity of arising, does not exist because it is future.

original: de med na yang rten med par 'di yod pa ma yin pa la yod pa ma yin pa ni 'gag pa dang dus gcig par ci ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na yang rten med par 'di yod pa ma yin pa la yod pa ma yin pa ni 'gag pa dang dus gcig par ci ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If it does not exist, then without a basis, it would not exist. How could non-existence be simultaneous with cessation?

original: de'i phyir bya ba bdag dus gcig pa nyid du mi rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba bdag dus gcig pa nyid du mi rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is completely unreasonable that action and the self are simultaneous.

original: gal te dngos po ma skyes pa //
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma skyes pa //
translated: If an unarisen entity

original: 'ga' zhig gang na yod gyur na //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gang na yod gyur na //
translated: existed somewhere,

original: de ni skye 'gyur dngos po de //
analyzed: de ni skye 'gyur dngos po de //
translated: that entity would arise.

original: med na ci zhig skye bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: med na ci zhig skye bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if it does not exist, what arises?

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po ma skyes pa 'ga' zhig skye ba'i snga rol du 'ga' zhig na yod par gyur na ni skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po ma skyes pa 'ga' zhig skye ba'i snga rol du 'ga' zhig na yod par gyur na ni skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If an unarisen entity called a sprout existed somewhere prior to arising, it would arise.

original: skye ba'i snga rol du ni 'ga' yang 'ga' zhig na yod par gzhag par mi nus te //
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol du ni 'ga' yang 'ga' zhig na yod par gzhag par mi nus te //
translated: But prior to arising, it is impossible to posit that it exists somewhere,

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has not yet arisen.

original: de'i phyir skye ba'i bya ba'i rten dngos po skye ba'i snga rol du med @251b na ste mi bdog na ci zhig skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba'i bya ba'i rten dngos po skye ba'i snga rol du med @251b na ste mi bdog na ci zhig skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, if the entity that is the basis of the action of arising does not exist, that is, is not present, prior to arising, what is it that arises?

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra dngos po'i khyad par yin pas gzhi mthun no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra dngos po'i khyad par yin pas gzhi mthun no //
translated: The word “it” is a particular entity, and so there is a common locus.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The word “entity” is the seventh case.

original: med na zhes bya ba yang dngos po'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: med na zhes bya ba yang dngos po'i khyad par ro //
translated: The word “if it does not exist” is a particular entity.

original: ci zhig gi sgra ni skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: ci zhig gi sgra ni skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The word “what” is to be connected with the phrase “arises.”

original: dngos po de med na ci zhig skye bar 'gyur te cung zad kyang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po de med na ci zhig skye bar 'gyur te cung zad kyang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What entity that does not exist arises? Nothing whatsoever arises. This is the meaning.

original: gal te srang mda'i mthon dman gyi tshul gyis skad cig gang kho na la sa bon 'gag pa de nyid la myu gu skye'o zhes 'phags pa s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las srang gi dpe 'di nye bar bkod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te srang mda'i mthon dman gyi tshul gyis skad cig gang kho na la sa bon 'gag pa de nyid la myu gu skye'o zhes 'phags pa s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las srang gi dpe 'di nye bar bkod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t this example of a scale presented in the noble Sūtra on the Ripening of Karma? It says, “Just as when one end of a scale goes up, the other end goes down, in the same way, when the seed ceases, the sprout arises.”

original: nye bar bkod pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: nye bar bkod pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: The reply is true.

original: de gzhan las skye bar bstan pa'i phyir ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de gzhan las skye bar bstan pa'i phyir ma yin zhing /
translated: But it is not to demonstrate arising from another.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba bstan pa'i phyir yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba bstan pa'i phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it to demonstrate arising by virtue of intrinsic characteristic.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: cig car du brten nas 'byung ba ma brtags par grub pa sgyu ma lta bu yongs su gsal bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: cig car du brten nas 'byung ba ma brtags par grub pa sgyu ma lta bu yongs su gsal bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is to demonstrate the illusion-like dependent origination of things that is established without analysis.

original: ji skad du /🔽sa bon zhig dang ma zhig las //
analyzed: ji skad du / sa bon zhig dang ma zhig las //
translated: As it is said:

original: myu gu 'byung ba ma yin pa //🔽khyod kyis skye ba thams cad ni //
analyzed: myu gu 'byung ba ma yin pa // khyod kyis skye ba thams cad ni //
translated: A sprout does not arise from a seed that is destroyed or not destroyed.

original: sgyu ma 'byung ba bzhin du gsungs //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sgyu ma 'byung ba bzhin du gsungs // zhes bshad do //
translated: You have said that all arising is like the arising of an illusion.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽sa bon dang myu gu dag cig car ba nyid med pas gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir skye ba mi rigs na /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / sa bon dang myu gu dag cig car ba nyid med pas gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir skye ba mi rigs na /
translated: Here the opponent says:🔽If it is illogical for arising to occur when there is no otherness, since there is no simultaneity of seed and sprout,

original: gang du cig car ba nyid yod pa der gzhan nyid yod pas skye ba yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang du cig car ba nyid yod pa der gzhan nyid yod pas skye ba yod par 'gyur te /
translated: then arising will occur when there is otherness, since there is simultaneity.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba tshor la sogs pa rnams lta bu'o //🔽mig dang gzugs la sogs pa dag dang tshor ba la sogs pa lhan cig 'byung ba rnams dus mnyam kho nar mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba tshor la sogs pa rnams lta bu'o // mig dang gzugs la sogs pa dag dang tshor ba la sogs pa lhan cig 'byung ba rnams dus mnyam kho nar mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the visual consciousness and the feelings, etc., that arise simultaneously with it.🔽The eye, form, etc., and the feelings, etc., that arise simultaneously with them, all generate the visual consciousness at the same time.

original: mig la sogs pa dag dang sems kyang dus mnyam kho nar tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rkyen nyid du 'gyur ro zhes smra'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag dang sems kyang dus mnyam kho nar tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rkyen nyid du 'gyur ro zhes smra'o //
translated: In the same way, the eye, etc., and the mind all become the conditions of the feelings, etc., at the same time.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gal te mig gi blo la rang gi skyed byed dus gcig pa //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gal te mig gi blo la rang gi skyed byed dus gcig pa //
translated: Why?

original: mig la sogs dang lhan cig 'byung ba 'du shes la sogs las //🔽gzhan nyid yod na yod la 'byung bas dgos pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: mig la sogs dang lhan cig 'byung ba 'du shes la sogs las // gzhan nyid yod na yod la 'byung bas dgos pa ci zhig yod //
translated: If the visual consciousness were different from the eye, etc., and from the feelings, etc., that arise simultaneously with it,🔽what purpose would be served by its arising?

original: ci ste de med ce na 'di la nyes pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: ci ste de med ce na 'di la nyes pa bshad zin to //
translated: If you say that it does not exist, the error has already been explained.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams dang 'du shes la sogs pa dus mnyam pa rnams mig gi blo de ltar ba'i rkyen nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe yod pa @252a * //
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams dang 'du shes la sogs pa dus mnyam pa rnams mig gi blo de ltar ba'i rkyen nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe yod pa @252a * //
translated: If you assert that the eye and so on and the simultaneous discriminations and so on are the conditions of the eye cognition, then at that time, they would be the conditions of the eye cognition that has already arisen.🔽

original: ni de la ltos pa'i gzhan nyid du 'gyur mod kyi yod pa la 'byung bas dgos pa cung zad kyang med pas skye ba med do //
analyzed: ni de la ltos pa'i gzhan nyid du 'gyur mod kyi yod pa la 'byung bas dgos pa cung zad kyang med pas skye ba med do //
translated: If you assert that the eye and so on and the simultaneous discriminations and so on are the conditions of the eye cognition, then at that time, since they would be different in dependence on that, there would be no need for their existence to arise. Therefore they would not arise.

original: ci ste skye ba med pa yongs su spang bar 'dod nas de yod pa nyid du khas mi len na ni /
analyzed: ci ste skye ba med pa yongs su spang bar 'dod nas de yod pa nyid du khas mi len na ni /
translated: But if you do not accept that they exist because you want to avoid their nonarising,

original: de'i tshe yang yod pa ma yin pa'i blo las mig la sogs pa rnams gzhan nyid ma yin no zhes nyes pa bshad zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang yod pa ma yin pa'i blo las mig la sogs pa rnams gzhan nyid ma yin no zhes nyes pa bshad zin pa kho na'o //
translated: then at that time, since the eye and so on would not exist, it is explained that it is not the case that they are different from the nonarising cognition.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan las skye bar 'dod pa na gzhan nyid srid kyang skye ba mi srid la de mi srid pa'i phyir gnyi ga mi srid cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan las skye bar 'dod pa na gzhan nyid srid kyang skye ba mi srid la de mi srid pa'i phyir gnyi ga mi srid cing /
translated: Therefore, in this way, if you assert that things arise from other, then even if otherness is possible, arising is impossible. And because that is impossible, both are impossible.

original: skye ba srid kyang gzhan nyid mi srid pa de mi srid pa'i phyir gnyis ka yang mi srid pas rnam pa thams cad du phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba srid kyang gzhan nyid mi srid pa de mi srid pa'i phyir gnyis ka yang mi srid pas rnam pa thams cad du phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if arising were possible, since the otherness of the effect that is to be arisen is impossible, both are impossible. Therefore, external objects do not exist in any way.

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi stong pas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi stong pas /
translated: Therefore, because external objects are empty,

original: song song nas sgra tsam 'ba' zhig lus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: song song nas sgra tsam 'ba' zhig lus par 'gyur te /
translated: after going and going, only mere sound remains.

original: de'i phyir rtogs pa 'di ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs pa 'di ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, this conception is untenable.

original: da ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis las rgyu la ltos pa'i dus yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis las rgyu la ltos pa'i dus yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the time of the cause that is dependent on the effect does not exist, it is said:

original: skyed par byed pa bskyed bya gzhan bskyed pa de rgyu yin na //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa bskyed bya gzhan bskyed pa de rgyu yin na //
translated: If the producer is the cause that produces another, the effect to be arisen,

original: yod pa 'am 'on te med dang gnyi ga'i gnyis bral zhig bskyed grang //
analyzed: yod pa 'am 'on te med dang gnyi ga'i gnyis bral zhig bskyed grang //
translated: is it an existent, a nonexistent, or both, or is it produced as devoid of both?

original: yod na skyed byed ci dgos med la'ang des ni ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na skyed byed ci dgos med la'ang des ni ci zhig bya //
translated: If it exists, what is the need for a producer? If it does not exist, what does it do?

original: gnyis nyid la des ci bya gnyis dang bral la'ang des ci bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis nyid la des ci bya gnyis dang bral la'ang des ci bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What does it do for that which is both? What does it do for that which is devoid of both?

original: re zhig skyed par byed pa'i rgyu bskyed bya yod par 'gyur ba'i skyed byed ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig skyed par byed pa'i rgyu bskyed bya yod par 'gyur ba'i skyed byed ni ma yin te /
translated: First, a cause that is a producer is not a producer of an existent product.

original: skyes par gyur pa slar yod skye bar rigs pa'ang ma yin nyid //
analyzed: skyes par gyur pa slar yod skye bar rigs pa'ang ma yin nyid //
translated: And it is not reasonable for what has arisen to arise again.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa bshad zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa bshad zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the faults of this have already been explained, such as in the line:🔽“It is not reasonable for what has arisen to arise again.”

original: de'i phyir de la rkyen dag gis dgos pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la rkyen dag gis dgos pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, conditions have no purpose at all in regard to that.

original: bskyed par bya ba yod pa ma yin par gyur pa la yang skyed par byed pa de dag gis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba yod pa ma yin par gyur pa la yang skyed par byed pa de dag gis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: And what would those producers do if the produced did not exist?

original: bong bu'i rva ltar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bong bu'i rva ltar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they would be nonexistent, like the horns of an ass.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽For one who asserts an existent effect

original: 'bras bu yod par gang 'dod dang // 'bras bu med par gang 'dod la //🔽khyim gyi don du ka ba sogs //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par gang 'dod dang // 'bras bu med par gang 'dod la // khyim gyi don du ka ba sogs //
translated: And one who asserts a nonexistent effect,🔽The purpose of the pillar and so on

original: brgyan pa'i don yang med par 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: brgyan pa'i don yang med par 'gyur // zhes bshad do //
translated: For the sake of the house would be nonexistent.

original: dbu ma las kyang /
analyzed: dbu ma las kyang /
translated: And in the Madhyamaka it is said:

original: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: If the effect has its own nature,

original: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par byed //
analyzed: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par byed //
translated: What would a cause produce?

original: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If the effect lacks its own nature,

original: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par byed //
analyzed: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par byed //
translated: What would a cause generate?

original: skye ba yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: skye ba yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If arising exists,

original: rgyu nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: a cause is not tenable.

original: rgyu nyid 'thad pa yod min na //
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'thad pa yod min na //
translated: If a cause is not tenable,

original: 'bras bu gang gi yin par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang gi yin par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: what would be the effect?

original: gnyis nyid yin par de la rkyen rnams kyis ci zhig @252b bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis nyid yin par de la rkyen rnams kyis ci zhig @252b bya ste /
translated: What would the conditions do for it?

original: bshad zin pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the previously explained errors would ensue.

original: gnyis kyi dngos po zhig gnyis nyid yin zhing gnyis nyid la yod pa ni gnyis nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos po zhig gnyis nyid yin zhing gnyis nyid la yod pa ni gnyis nyid do //
translated: The entity of duality is duality. Duality exists in duality.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo can nyid ni dus gcig gi tshe gcig la srid pa yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo can nyid ni dus gcig gi tshe gcig la srid pa yang ma yin pas /
translated: It is not possible for the nature of existence and nonexistence to exist simultaneously in one thing.

original: de'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, an entity that has that nature does not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de la skyed par byed pa'i rkyen dag gis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de la skyed par byed pa'i rkyen dag gis ci zhig bya /
translated: Since it does not exist, what would the generating conditions do for it?

original: ji skad du bstan bcos las //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan bcos las //
translated: As the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:

original: mya ngan 'das pa dngos po dang // dngos med gnyis kar ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa dngos po dang // dngos med gnyis kar ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could nirvana be both A thing and a non-thing?🔽It is not tenable that these two

original: de gnyis gcig la yod min te //
analyzed: de gnyis gcig la yod min te //
translated: Are one.

original: snang ba dang ni mun pa bzhin //
analyzed: snang ba dang ni mun pa bzhin //
translated: Like light and darkness.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:🔽The existent and the non-existent

original: byed pa por gyur ma gyur dang // gyur ma gyur de mi byed do //🔽yin dang ma yin gyur cig la //
analyzed: byed pa por gyur ma gyur dang // gyur ma gyur de mi byed do // yin dang ma yin gyur cig la //
translated: Are not produced.🔽How could a single thing be both

original: phan tshun 'gal bas ga la zhig / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal bas ga la zhig / ces gsungs so //
translated: Existent and non-existent, since these are mutually exclusive?

original: gnyi ga dang bral ba yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa gnyis ka dang bral ba de la yang rkyen de dag gis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga dang bral ba yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa gnyis ka dang bral ba de la yang rkyen de dag gis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: And if the effect is neither existent nor non-existent, what could those conditions do to that effect, which is devoid of both existence and non-existence?

original: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo spangs pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo spangs pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an effect that is devoid of the nature of existence and non-existence does not exist.

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid mi srid na yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes de dag bkag pas cung zad kyang khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid mi srid na yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes de dag bkag pas cung zad kyang khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If existence and non-existence are impossible, then what is neither existent nor non-existent is not even slightly different when refuted by the negation “neither existent nor non-existent.”

original: gang gi tshe 'di gnyi ga ma grub pa de'i tshe yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di gnyi ga ma grub pa de'i tshe yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: But when neither of these two is established, then existence and nonexistence are impossible.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dngos min dngos po med min pa //
analyzed: dngos min dngos po med min pa //
translated: Neither existent nor nonexistent,

original: mya ngan 'das par gang ston pa //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das par gang ston pa //
translated: how could nirvana be taught?

original: dngos med pa dang dngos po dag //🔽grub na de ni 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos med pa dang dngos po dag // grub na de ni 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: If nonexistence and existence

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽gal te skye bar rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir rigs pa gang dang gang smras pa de dang de ni bud shing skam po mar gyis bran pa ltar /🔽khyod kyi blo'i mes ma lus par bsregs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // gal te skye bar rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir rigs pa gang dang gang smras pa de dang de ni bud shing skam po mar gyis bran pa ltar / khyod kyi blo'i mes ma lus par bsregs pas /
translated: were established, that would be established.🔽Whatever reasonings you may employ in order to establish arising, they will all be consumed by the fire of my wisdom, like dry kindling doused in oil.

original: khyod kyi shes rab kyi mes spor ba lhur byed pa'i rigs pa'i bud shing bskul bas chog go //
analyzed: khyod kyi shes rab kyi mes spor ba lhur byed pa'i rigs pa'i bud shing bskul bas chog go //
translated: Therefore, it is enough to ignite the kindling of your reasoning, which is intent on burning with the fire of your wisdom.

original: gal te rigs pa nye bar ma bstan par brjod par 'dod pa'i don grub par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rigs pa nye bar ma bstan par brjod par 'dod pa'i don grub par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you do not teach the reasonings, will the meaning you wish to express not be established?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: don gang zhig 'jig rten nyid las /
analyzed: don gang zhig 'jig rten nyid las /
translated: The meaning that is established for the world

original: grub pa der ni rigs pas ci yang bya bas med de /
analyzed: grub pa der ni rigs pas ci yang bya bas med de /
translated: But since it is established by that, there is no need for reasoning,

original: 'jig rten gyi mthong ba ni shin tu stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mthong ba ni shin tu stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa /
translated: because worldly seeing is very powerful.

original: @253a * // gang gis rang lta la gnas 'jig rten tshad mar 'dod pas na //
analyzed: @253a * // gang gis rang lta la gnas 'jig rten tshad mar 'dod pas na //
translated: Since you assert that the world is valid in terms of its own views,

original: 'dir ni rigs pa smras pa nyid kyis lta ko ci zhig bya //
analyzed: 'dir ni rigs pa smras pa nyid kyis lta ko ci zhig bya //
translated: what need is there to state reasoning here?

original: gzhan las gzhan 'byung ba yang 'jig rten pa yis rtogs 'gyur te //
analyzed: gzhan las gzhan 'byung ba yang 'jig rten pa yis rtogs 'gyur te //
translated: The world understands that one thing arises from another,

original: des na gzhan las skye yod 'dir ni rigs pas ci zhig dgos //
analyzed: des na gzhan las skye yod 'dir ni rigs pas ci zhig dgos //
translated: so why is reasoning needed here to show that things arise from other?

original: 'jig rten pa ni thams cad rang gi lta ba kho na la gnas pa na shin tu stobs dang ldan pa yin zhing gzhan kho na las skye bar lta ba yang yin la //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni thams cad rang gi lta ba kho na la gnas pa na shin tu stobs dang ldan pa yin zhing gzhan kho na las skye bar lta ba yang yin la //
translated: Since the world is very powerful in terms of its own views, it sees that one thing arises from another.

original: rigs pa nyes par 'god pa yang dngos po mngon sum ma yin pa kho na la ni 'os kyi mngon sum la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa nyes par 'god pa yang dngos po mngon sum ma yin pa kho na la ni 'os kyi mngon sum la ni ma yin te /
translated: And it is appropriate to set forth faulty reasoning only in regard to things that are not directly perceived, not in regard to things that are directly perceived.

original: de'i phyir 'thad pa med par yang dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'thad pa med par yang dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, even though it is untenable, things are only produced from other.

original: gang zhig bstan bcos kyi don phyin ci ma log par ma rtogs shing thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar dngos po'i bag chags gzhag pa yongs su smin pa /
analyzed: gang zhig bstan bcos kyi don phyin ci ma log par ma rtogs shing thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar dngos po'i bag chags gzhag pa yongs su smin pa /
translated: One who does not understand the meaning of the treatise without error and whose latent propensities for conceiving things to exist have fully matured due to beginningless cyclic existence,

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i mdza' bo dang bral bar thos pa mi bzod pas 'jig rten gyis gnod pa'i rdol thabs la brten pa 'di ni /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i mdza' bo dang bral bar thos pa mi bzod pas 'jig rten gyis gnod pa'i rdol thabs la brten pa 'di ni /
translated: who is unable to bear the sound of the separation of the friend who is the attachment to things, who relies on the babbling of worldly refutations,

original: 'jig rten gyi byung tshul shin tu mang zhing rgya che ba ma bshad par 'jig rten gyi gnod pa'i bla rdol las bzlog par mi nus pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi byung tshul shin tu mang zhing rgya che ba ma bshad par 'jig rten gyi gnod pa'i bla rdol las bzlog par mi nus pas /
translated: is unable to stop the babbling of worldly refutations without explaining the many and vast ways of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi gnod pa'i yul khyad par can bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gnod pa'i yul khyad par can bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the special object of refutation by worldly refutations,

original: re zhig bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: re zhig bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: first, from the perspective of the presentation of the two truths, it is said:

original: dngos kun yang dag brdzun pa mthong ba yis //
analyzed: dngos kun yang dag brdzun pa mthong ba yis //
translated: All things are seen to be both real and false.

original: dngos rnyed ngo bo gnyis ni 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos rnyed ngo bo gnyis ni 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: The two natures of the things found are apprehended.

original: yang dag mthong yul gang yin de nyid de //
analyzed: yang dag mthong yul gang yin de nyid de //
translated: That which is the object of seeing reality is reality.

original: mthong ba brdzun pa kun rdzob bden par gsungs //🔽'di na bden pa gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis /
analyzed: mthong ba brdzun pa kun rdzob bden par gsungs // 'di na bden pa gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis /
translated: False seeing is said to be conventional truth.

original: 'du byed dang myu gu la sogs pa nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo rnam pa gnyis nye bar bstan te /
analyzed: 'du byed dang myu gu la sogs pa nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo rnam pa gnyis nye bar bstan te /
translated: Here, the Bhagavān Buddhas, who know without error the natures of the two truths, have taught that all inner and outer things, such as karmic acts and sprouts, have two natures.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'o //
translated: The conventional and the ultimate.

original: de la don dam pa ni yang dag par gzigs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi khyad par gyi yul nyid kyis bdag gi ngo bo rnyed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la don dam pa ni yang dag par gzigs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi khyad par gyi yul nyid kyis bdag gi ngo bo rnyed pa yin gyi /
translated: Among them, the ultimate is the nature found by the special wisdom of those who see reality.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not established by its own nature.

original: 'di ni ngo bo gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ngo bo gcig yin no //
translated: This is the one nature.

original: gzhan ni so so'i skye bo'i ma rig pa'i rab rib kyi ling thog gis blo'i mig ma lus par khebs pa rnams kyi mthong ba brdzun pa'i stobs las bdag gi @253b yod pa rnyed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni so so'i skye bo'i ma rig pa'i rab rib kyi ling thog gis blo'i mig ma lus par khebs pa rnams kyi mthong ba brdzun pa'i stobs las bdag gi @253b yod pa rnyed pa yin te /
translated: The other is the existence of the self, which is found by the power of the false seeing of those whose eyes of intelligence are completely covered by the cataracts of ignorance, which are the afflictions of ordinary beings.

original: byis pa rnams kyi mthong ba'i yul du 'gyur pa ji lta ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin du rang gi ngo bos grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi mthong ba'i yul du 'gyur pa ji lta ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin du rang gi ngo bos grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the self exists by its own nature in the way that it is the object of the seeing of ordinary beings.

original: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad rang bzhin de gnyis 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad rang bzhin de gnyis 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all things are apprehended as having these two natures.

original: rang bzhin de gnyis las kyang mthong ba yang dag pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni de nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin de gnyis las kyang mthong ba yang dag pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni de nyid de /
translated: And of these two natures, that which is the object of correct seeing is reality.

original: de ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ultimate truth.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, its nature will be explained.

original: mthong ba brdzun pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba brdzun pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: That which is the object of false seeing is conventional truth.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: Therefore, having thus established the two truths,

original: mthong ba brdzun pa rnams la mthong ba yang dag pa dang brdzun pa nyid las gnyis nyid yod pas des gzung bar bya ba'i don dang / shes pa gnyis nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: mthong ba brdzun pa rnams la mthong ba yang dag pa dang brdzun pa nyid las gnyis nyid yod pas des gzung bar bya ba'i don dang / shes pa gnyis nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Since there are two kinds of false seeing, correct and false, he explains that the object apprehended by that and the two kinds of consciousness should be taught.

original: mthong ba brdzun pa'ang rnam pa gnyis 'dod de /
analyzed: mthong ba brdzun pa'ang rnam pa gnyis 'dod de /
translated: False seeing is also asserted to be of two kinds:

original: dbang po gsal dang dbang po skyon ldan no //
analyzed: dbang po gsal dang dbang po skyon ldan no //
translated: with clear faculties and with faulty faculties.

original: skyon ldan dbang can rnams kyi shes pa ni //
analyzed: skyon ldan dbang can rnams kyi shes pa ni //
translated: The consciousness of those with faulty faculties

original: dbang po legs gyur shes ltos log par 'dod //
analyzed: dbang po legs gyur shes ltos log par 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be false in dependence on the consciousness with good faculties.

original: de la dbang po gsal ba can ni rab rib dang bral zhing mig ser la sogs pas nyams par ma byas pa dang / rnam pa de lta bu'i phyi rol gyi yul phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la dbang po gsal ba can ni rab rib dang bral zhing mig ser la sogs pas nyams par ma byas pa dang / rnam pa de lta bu'i phyi rol gyi yul phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa rnams so //
translated: Those with clear faculties are those who are free from cataracts and are not impaired by jaundice, etc., and who apprehend external objects in a non-erroneous way.

original: skyon dang ldan pa'i dbang po can rnams ni de las bzlog pa dag go //
analyzed: skyon dang ldan pa'i dbang po can rnams ni de las bzlog pa dag go //
translated: Those with faulty faculties are the opposite of those.

original: de la dbang po legs par gyur pa rnams kyi shes pa la ltos nas skyon dang ldan pa'i dbang po can rnams kyi shes pa gang yin pa de log par shes par 'dod do //
analyzed: de la dbang po legs par gyur pa rnams kyi shes pa la ltos nas skyon dang ldan pa'i dbang po can rnams kyi shes pa gang yin pa de log par shes par 'dod do //
translated: In this regard, the consciousness of those whose sense faculties are defective is considered false consciousness in relation to the consciousness of those whose sense faculties are excellent.

original: ji ltar 'di dag gi shes pa phyin ci log pa dang phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi sgo nas rnam pa gnyis yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag gi shes pa phyin ci log pa dang phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi sgo nas rnam pa gnyis yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as consciousness is twofold in terms of being erroneous and nonerroneous,🔽so too is the object.

original: yul yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: yul yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: gnod pa med pa'i dbang po drug rnams kyis //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i dbang po drug rnams kyis //
translated: Whatever is apprehended by the six unimpaired sense faculties

original: bzung ba gang zhig 'jig rten gyis rtogs te //
analyzed: bzung ba gang zhig 'jig rten gyis rtogs te //
translated: and is recognized by the world

original: 'jig rten nyid las bden yin lhag ma ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten nyid las bden yin lhag ma ni //
translated: is true only from the perspective of the world. The rest🔽is posited as false only from the perspective of the world.

original: 'jig rten nyid las log par rnam par gzhag / de la rab rib dang mig ser la sogs pa dag dang da dur zos pa la sogs pa rnams ni dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyan nang na yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten nyid las log par rnam par gzhag / de la rab rib dang mig ser la sogs pa dag dang da dur zos pa la sogs pa rnams ni dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyan nang na yod pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, cataracts, jaundice, and so on, and the ingestion of datura, and so on, are internal conditions that impair the sense faculties.

original: til mar dang chu dang me long dang brag phug la sogs pa nas brjod pa'i sgra la sogs pa rnams dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer yul dang dus khyad par can dang nye bar gyur pa la sogs pa rnams ni dbang po @254a * //🔽la gnod pa'i rkyen phyi rol na yod pa yin te /
analyzed: til mar dang chu dang me long dang brag phug la sogs pa nas brjod pa'i sgra la sogs pa rnams dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer yul dang dus khyad par can dang nye bar gyur pa la sogs pa rnams ni dbang po @254a * // la gnod pa'i rkyen phyi rol na yod pa yin te /
translated: and the sun’s rays that are in a particular place and time, etc.

original: de dag ni dbang po la gnod par byed pa nang na yod pa dag med par /
analyzed: de dag ni dbang po la gnod par byed pa nang na yod pa dag med par /
translated: For, when those conditions that impair the sense faculties do not exist internally,

original: gzugs brnyan dang brag ca dang smig rgyu la chu la sogs par 'dzin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang brag ca dang smig rgyu la chu la sogs par 'dzin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: they become the cause for apprehending a reflection, an echo, or a mirage as water, etc.

original: de bzhin du mig 'khrul mkhan la sogs par rab tu sbyar ba'i sngags dang sman la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig 'khrul mkhan la sogs par rab tu sbyar ba'i sngags dang sman la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand that mantras and medicines, etc., that are applied by magicians, etc., are also like that.

original: yid kyi gnod par byed pa ni de dag dang yang dag pa ma yin pas byas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la sogs pa dag dang / rjes su dpag pa ltar snang bdag ste /
analyzed: yid kyi gnod par byed pa ni de dag dang yang dag pa ma yin pas byas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la sogs pa dag dang / rjes su dpag pa ltar snang bdag ste /
translated: The impairment of the mental faculty is due to those and to tenets that are fabricated by non-Buddhists, etc., and to fallacious inferences.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The presentation of dreams and so on will be explained.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'jig rten gyis dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyen ji skad du bshad pa med par dbang po drug car gyis gzung bar bya ba'i don rtogs pa de ni 'jig rten nyid las bden pa yin gyi 'phags pa la ltos nas ni ma yin no
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'jig rten gyis dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyen ji skad du bshad pa med par dbang po drug car gyis gzung bar bya ba'i don rtogs pa de ni 'jig rten nyid las bden pa yin gyi 'phags pa la ltos nas ni ma yin no
translated: Thus, the world itself determines the truth of the object that is grasped by the six unimpaired faculties, in the absence of the conditions that impair the faculties as explained above.

original: // gzugs brnyan la sogs pa gang zhig dbang po rnams la gnod pa yod pa na yul gyi ngo bo nyid du snang ba de ni 'jig rten nyid la ltos nas log pa yin no //
analyzed: // gzugs brnyan la sogs pa gang zhig dbang po rnams la gnod pa yod pa na yul gyi ngo bo nyid du snang ba de ni 'jig rten nyid la ltos nas log pa yin no //
translated: The world itself determines the falsity of the object that is grasped by the impaired faculties, such as the object that appears to be a double moon.

original: da ni bshad zin pa'i don nyid dper brjod pa'i tshul gyis nye bar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni bshad zin pa'i don nyid dper brjod pa'i tshul gyis nye bar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the meaning that has been explained by way of an example, it is said:🔽The self that is imagined by the tīrthikas,

original: mi shes gnyid kyis rab bskyod mu stegs can //
analyzed: mi shes gnyid kyis rab bskyod mu stegs can //
translated: Who are shaken by the sleep of ignorance,

original: rnams kyi bdag nyid ji bzhin brtags pa dang // sgyu ma smig rgyu sogs la brtags pa gang //
analyzed: rnams kyi bdag nyid ji bzhin brtags pa dang // sgyu ma smig rgyu sogs la brtags pa gang //
translated: And the self that is imagined in illusions, mirages, and so on,

original: de dag 'jig rten las kyang yod min nyid //
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten las kyang yod min nyid //
translated: They do not exist even in the world.

original: mu stegs can 'di dag ni de kho na nyid la 'jug par 'dod pas skye bo ma byang ba gnag rdzi dang bud med la sogs pa yan cad la grags pa'i dngos po skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par yang dag par
analyzed: mu stegs can 'di dag ni de kho na nyid la 'jug par 'dod pas skye bo ma byang ba gnag rdzi dang bud med la sogs pa yan cad la grags pa'i dngos po skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par yang dag par
translated: These tīrthikas, who wish to enter into reality, do not correctly ascertain, without error, the things that are renowned in the world, such as arising and cessation, even from the perspective of the ignorant, such as cowherds and women.

original: nges par ma bzung bar /
analyzed: nges par ma bzung bar /
translated: They do not hold those things to be correct.

original: phul du byung bar 'gro bar 'dod pas shing la 'dzegs pas yal ga snga ma btang nas yal ga phyi ma ma bzung ba ltar lhung ba chen pos lta ba ngan pa'i ri'i su la dag tu ltung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: phul du byung bar 'gro bar 'dod pas shing la 'dzegs pas yal ga snga ma btang nas yal ga phyi ma ma bzung ba ltar lhung ba chen pos lta ba ngan pa'i ri'i su la dag tu ltung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: They fall into the great abyss, like someone who wishes to go to a high place and climbs a tree, but falls from it without holding onto a branch. They fall into the abyss of bad views.

original: bden pa gnyis mthong ba dang bral ba'i 'bras bu mi thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis mthong ba dang bral ba'i 'bras bu mi thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not attain the result of seeing the two truths.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gis gang brtags pa yon tan gsum la sogs pa de dag ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gis gang brtags pa yon tan gsum la sogs pa de dag ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the three qualities and so on that they imagine do not exist even in the conventional reality of the world.

original: de'i phyir 'dir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir /
translated: Therefore, here Nāgārjuna says:

original: mig ni rab rib can gyi dmigs pa yis //
analyzed: mig ni rab rib can gyi dmigs pa yis //
translated: Just as the object of one with diseased vision

original: rab rib med shes la gnod @254b min ji ltar //
analyzed: rab rib med shes la gnod @254b min ji ltar //
translated: does not invalidate the cognition of one with healthy eyes,

original: de bzhin dri med ye shes spangs pa'i blos //
analyzed: de bzhin dri med ye shes spangs pa'i blos //
translated: so the mind devoid of stainless wisdom

original: dri med blo la gnod pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: dri med blo la gnod pa yod ma yin //
translated: does not invalidate the stainless mind.

original: gzhan las skye ba dgag pa bshad pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i lta ba kho na la gnas nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba dgag pa bshad pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i lta ba kho na la gnas nas ni ma yin no //
translated: This refutation of arising from other is not presented from the perspective of worldly cognition alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you think that it is, then what does it mean to say that “arising from other does not exist even in the world”?🔽We do not present this refutation of arising from other based on worldly cognition alone.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi gzigs pa khas blangs nas yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi gzigs pa khas blangs nas yin no //
translated: We present it from the perspective of the noble ones’ wisdom.

original: gang gi tshe skye ba dgag pa 'di khyad par du yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar rab rib can rnams kyi sgra la sogs pa'i ngo bo la dmigs pas rab rib med pa'i shes pa la mi gnod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skye ba dgag pa 'di khyad par du yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar rab rib can rnams kyi sgra la sogs pa'i ngo bo la dmigs pas rab rib med pa'i shes pa la mi gnod pa de bzhin du /
translated: When we present this refutation of arising from other from the perspective of the noble ones’ wisdom, then how is it that the object of one with diseased vision does not invalidate the cognition of one with healthy eyes?

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes dang bral ba so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pas kyang gzigs pa zag pa med pa la gnod pa ma yin pas rnam pa de lta bu yul la 'jig rten gyis gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes dang bral ba so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pas kyang gzigs pa zag pa med pa la gnod pa ma yin pas rnam pa de lta bu yul la 'jig rten gyis gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: The consciousnesses of ordinary beings, which are devoid of uncontaminated wisdom, do not invalidate the uncontaminated vision. Therefore, worldly cognition does not invalidate such an object.

original: de'i phyir de ltar pha rol po ni dam pa dag gis bzhad gad du bya bar 'os pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar pha rol po ni dam pa dag gis bzhad gad du bya bar 'os pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the opponent is worthy of ridicule by the wise.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni bden pa gnyis yin pa dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye bas dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo gnyis su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni bden pa gnyis yin pa dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye bas dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo gnyis su brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this shows that things have two natures, due to the division into the two truths and into the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In this regard, in order to teach the conventional truth of the world, it is said:

original: gti mug rang bzhin sgrib phyir kun rdzob ste //
analyzed: gti mug rang bzhin sgrib phyir kun rdzob ste //
translated: Since it obscures the nature by delusion, it is conventional.

original: des gang bcos ma bden par snang de ni //
analyzed: des gang bcos ma bden par snang de ni //
translated: That which it creates appears as real.

original: kun rdzob bden zhes thub pa des gsungs te //
analyzed: kun rdzob bden zhes thub pa des gsungs te //
translated: The Sage has said that is conventional truth.

original: bcos mar gyur pa'i dngos ni kun rdzob tu'o//
analyzed: bcos mar gyur pa'i dngos ni kun rdzob tu'o//
translated: Things that are created are conventional.

original: de la 'dis sems can rnams ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po lta ba la rmongs par byed pas na gti mug ste /
analyzed: de la 'dis sems can rnams ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po lta ba la rmongs par byed pas na gti mug ste /
translated: Since this causes sentient beings to be confused about the way things exist, it is confusion.

original: ma rig pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed pa rang bzhin mthong ba la sgrib pa'i bdag nyid can ni kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: ma rig pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed pa rang bzhin mthong ba la sgrib pa'i bdag nyid can ni kun rdzob bo //
translated: The reality of things that does not exist is imputed by ignorance, and it obscures the perception of the nature of things.

original: kun rdzob des gang zhig bden par snang zhing rang bzhin med bzhin du rang bzhin du so sor snang ba de ni 'jig rten phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i kun rdzob tu bden pas 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob des gang zhig bden par snang zhing rang bzhin med bzhin du rang bzhin du so sor snang ba de ni 'jig rten phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i kun rdzob tu bden pas 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
translated: Whatever appears to be true due to that ignorance, and whatever appears to have an intrinsic nature even though it does not, is the concealer that is true for the world.

original: de ni bcos ma rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni bcos ma rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ngo //
translated: It is a fabrication that is dependently arisen.

original: brten nas 'byung ba gzugs brnyan dang brag ca la sogs pa cung zad cig ni brdzun yang ma rig pa dang ldan pa rnams la snang la /
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ba gzugs brnyan dang brag ca la sogs pa cung zad cig ni brdzun yang ma rig pa dang ldan pa rnams la snang la /
translated: Some dependently arisen things, such as reflections and echoes, are false and appear to those who possess ignorance.

original: sngon po la sogs pa gzugs dang sems dang tshor ba la sogs pa cung zad cig ni bden par snang ste /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa gzugs dang sems dang tshor ba la sogs pa cung zad cig ni bden par snang ste /
translated: Blue, etc., form, mind, feeling, etc., appear to be true.

original: rang bzhin ni ma rig pa dang ldan pa rnams la rnam pa thams cad du mi snang ngo //🔽de'i phyir de dang gang zhig kun rdzob tu yang brdzun pa kun rdzob @255a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni ma rig pa dang ldan pa rnams la rnam pa thams cad du mi snang ngo // de'i phyir de dang gang zhig kun rdzob tu yang brdzun pa kun rdzob @255a * //
translated: But the nature of things does not appear at all to those who are ignorant.

original: kyi bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kyi bden pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is false even in the conventional is not a conventional truth.

original: de ltar na re zhig srid pa'i yan lag gis yongs su bsdus pa nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa'i dbang gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag go //🔽de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs ba can gyis gzigs pa spangs pa /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig srid pa'i yan lag gis yongs su bsdus pa nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa'i dbang gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag go // de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs ba can gyis gzigs pa spangs pa /
translated: Thus, first, conventional truth is established by the power of afflicted ignorance which is included among the members of existence.🔽In that regard, the nature of things is not a truth for those who have abandoned the afflicted view of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas,

original: 'du byed gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i yod pa nyid dang 'dra bar gzigs pa rnams la ni bcos ma'i rang bzhin gyi bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i yod pa nyid dang 'dra bar gzigs pa rnams la ni bcos ma'i rang bzhin gyi bden pa ma yin te /
translated: because they see compounded phenomena as like reflections, etc., which exist.

original: bden par mngon par rlom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden par mngon par rlom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not falsely project as real.

original: byis pa rnams la ni slu bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la ni slu bar byed pa yin la /
translated: For the childish, it is deceptive.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams la ni sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyis kun rdzob tsam du 'gyur ro //🔽de yang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can ma rig pa tsam kun du spyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams la ni sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyis kun rdzob tsam du 'gyur ro // de yang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can ma rig pa tsam kun du spyod pa'i phyir /
translated: For others, it is mere conventionality, like a magical creation, etc., because it is dependently co-originated.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i spyod yul can gyi 'phags pa rnams la snang gi //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i spyod yul can gyi 'phags pa rnams la snang gi //
translated: Moreover, it appears to the noble ones whose sphere of activity is endowed with appearance, because they experience only the ignorance which is characterized by the obscuration of the knowable.

original: snang ba med pa'i spyod yul mnga' ba rnams la ni ma yin no //🔽sangs rgyas rnams la ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i spyod yul mnga' ba rnams la ni ma yin no // sangs rgyas rnams la ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir /
translated: It does not appear to those whose sphere of activity is devoid of appearance.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba gtan log par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba gtan log par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: And it is accepted that the buddhas have completely stopped the movement of mind and mental factors, because all phenomena are completely and totally fully enlightened in them.

original: de ltar na re zhig bcom ldan 'das des kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang kun rdzob tsam du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig bcom ldan 'das des kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang kun rdzob tsam du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Lord has taught conventional truth and mere conventionality.

original: de la so so'i skye bo rnams kyi don dam pa gang yin pa de nyid 'phags pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i spyod yul can rnams kyi kun rdzob tsam yin la /
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo rnams kyi don dam pa gang yin pa de nyid 'phags pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i spyod yul can rnams kyi kun rdzob tsam yin la /
translated: In this regard, whatever is the ultimate for ordinary beings is mere conventionality for the noble ones whose sphere of activity is endowed with appearance.

original: de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de rnams kyi don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de rnams kyi don dam pa'o //
translated: The emptiness that is its nature is the ultimate for them.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi don dam pa ni rang bzhin nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi don dam pa ni rang bzhin nyid yin zhing /
translated: The ultimate for the buddhas is the very nature itself.

original: de yang slu ba med pa nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang slu ba med pa nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, since it is nondeceptive, it is the ultimate truth.

original: de ni de rnams kyi so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni de rnams kyi so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin no //
translated: That is to be personally experienced by them.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni slu bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni slu bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin no //
translated: Conventional truth is not the ultimate truth because it is deceptive.

original: de'i phyir de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan nas /
translated: Therefore, having taught conventional truth in this way,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan par 'dod pas de ni brjod du med pa'i phyir dang shes pa'i phyir yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dngos su bstan par mi nus pas /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan par 'dod pas de ni brjod du med pa'i phyir dang shes pa'i phyir yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dngos su bstan par mi nus pas /
translated: Since the ultimate truth is inexpressible, it cannot be directly taught because it is not an object of expression or cognition.

original: nyan par 'dod pa sems la rang gis myong ba nyid du de'i rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dpe bshad pa /🔽rab rib mthu yis skra shad la sogs pa'i //🔽ngo bo log @255b pa gang zhig rnam brtags pa //
analyzed: nyan par 'dod pa sems la rang gis myong ba nyid du de'i rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dpe bshad pa / rab rib mthu yis skra shad la sogs pa'i // ngo bo log @255b pa gang zhig rnam brtags pa //
translated: Therefore, in order to make its nature clear to those who wish to hear it, an analogy is explained.🔽The nature of false things such as floating hairs,🔽which is imagined due to the power of eye disease,

original: de nyid bdag nyid gang du mig dag pas //
analyzed: de nyid bdag nyid gang du mig dag pas //
translated: is seen by those with clear eyes

original: mthong de de nyid de bzhin 'dir shes kyis //🔽rab rib kyi mthus rab rib can gyis rang gi la ga na thogs pa'i bse ru la sogs snod kyi nang na skra shad la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su 'gyur bzhin par mthong ba des bsal par 'dod nas snod de la yang dang yang du sgre zlog byed
analyzed: mthong de de nyid de bzhin 'dir shes kyis // rab rib kyi mthus rab rib can gyis rang gi la ga na thogs pa'i bse ru la sogs snod kyi nang na skra shad la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su 'gyur bzhin par mthong ba des bsal par 'dod nas snod de la yang dang yang du sgre zlog byed
translated: as it is, and so it should be understood here.🔽Those with eye disease see a collection of floating hairs, etc., in their own eyes due to the power of their eye disease, and thinking to remove them, they repeatedly rub their eyes.

original: pa'i tshegs thob par rig ste /
analyzed: pa'i tshegs thob par rig ste /
translated: When they do so, they realize that the hairs, etc., are not external objects.

original: 'di ci byed pa zhig snyam nas rab rib med pas de'i gan du phyin nas skra shad la yul gyi yul der mig gtad kyang skra shad kyi rnam pa de dag ma dmigs shing /
analyzed: 'di ci byed pa zhig snyam nas rab rib med pas de'i gan du phyin nas skra shad la yul gyi yul der mig gtad kyang skra shad kyi rnam pa de dag ma dmigs shing /
translated: Thinking, “What is this?” he goes to the place where the hair appears, and even though he focuses his eyes on that place, he does not see the appearance of the hair.

original: skra shad de'i rten can dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang skra shad dang skra shad ma yin pa dang mthon ka la sogs pa'i khyad par dag tu rtog par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skra shad de'i rten can dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang skra shad dang skra shad ma yin pa dang mthon ka la sogs pa'i khyad par dag tu rtog par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: He does not conceive the difference between the basis of the hair, which is a real thing, and the nonexistence of the hair, which is a unreal thing.

original: yang gang gi tshe rab rib can rab rib med pa la skra shad mthong ngo zhes rang gis bsam pa ston par byed pa de'i tshe de'i rnam par rtog pa bsal bar 'dod pas rab rib can gyi dmigs pa'i ngor byas nas 'di na skra shad dag yod
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe rab rib can rab rib med pa la skra shad mthong ngo zhes rang gis bsam pa ston par byed pa de'i tshe de'i rnam par rtog pa bsal bar 'dod pas rab rib can gyi dmigs pa'i ngor byas nas 'di na skra shad dag yod
translated: When the person with diseased vision says, “I see hair,” he is expressing his own thought. At that time, in order to remove his misconception, the person without diseased vision, taking the perspective of the person with diseased vision, says, “There is no hair here.”

original: pa ma yin no zhes dgag pa lhur byed pa'i tshig smra mod kyi /🔽smra ba po 'di la de la skur pa 'debs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin no zhes dgag pa lhur byed pa'i tshig smra mod kyi /🔽smra ba po 'di la de la skur pa 'debs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not saying that the hair is not seen.

original: skra shad dag gi de kho na nyid ni gang zhig rab rib med pas mthong ba de yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skra shad dag gi de kho na nyid ni gang zhig rab rib med pas mthong ba de yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no //
translated: The reality of the hairs is what is seen by one without myodesopsia, not the other.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis gnod pa byas pas de kho na nyid ma mthong ba dag gis phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi ngo bo kun rdzob pa'o
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis gnod pa byas pas de kho na nyid ma mthong ba dag gis phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi ngo bo kun rdzob pa'o
translated: Similarly, those who do not see reality because they are afflicted by the myodesopsia of ignorance perceive the intrinsic reality of the aggregates, elements, media, and so on. That is their relative reality.

original: // gal te phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid ma rig pa'i bag chags dang bral ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rab rib can ma yin pas skra shad mthong ba'i tshul du rang bzhin gang gis gzigs pa de ni de dag gi don dam pa'i
analyzed: // gal te phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid ma rig pa'i bag chags dang bral ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rab rib can ma yin pas skra shad mthong ba'i tshul du rang bzhin gang gis gzigs pa de ni de dag gi don dam pa'i
translated: If the aggregates, etc., are seen by the Buddhas, the Transcendent Destroyers, who are free from the instinct for ignorance, by a non-myodesopsia, as having a certain intrinsic reality, that is their ultimate reality.

original: bden pa'o // gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni mthong ba med pa nyid ma yin nam de'i phyir ji ltar de dag gis gzigs she na /
analyzed: bden pa'o // gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni mthong ba med pa nyid ma yin nam de'i phyir ji ltar de dag gis gzigs she na /
translated: If such a nature is not seen, how can it be seen by them?

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang de ma gzigs pa'i tshul gyis de dag gis gzigs so zhes brjod ji skad du 'phags pa bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa las /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang de ma gzigs pa'i tshul gyis de dag gis gzigs so zhes brjod ji skad du 'phags pa bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa las /
translated: As it says in the noble Entry into the Two Realities:

original: lha'i bu gal te don dam par na don dam pa'i bden pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi yul gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur na ni /🔽de don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs @256a * //
analyzed: lha'i bu gal te don dam par na don dam pa'i bden pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi yul gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur na ni / de don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs @256a * //
translated: Son of a god, if ultimately the ultimate truth were the nature of the object of body, speech, and mind,🔽it would not be counted as the ultimate truth,

original: su mi 'gro ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: su mi 'gro ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would be just the conventional truth.

original: 'on kyang lha'i bu don dam par na don dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad thams cad las 'das pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang lha'i bu don dam par na don dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad thams cad las 'das pa /
translated: However, son of a god, ultimately the ultimate truth is beyond all conventions,

original: bye brag med pa /
analyzed: bye brag med pa /
translated: without distinctions,

original: ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa /
translated: unborn,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: undying,

original: smra bar bya ba dang / smra ba dang / shes par bya ba dang / shes pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: smra bar bya ba dang / smra ba dang / shes par bya ba dang / shes pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: free from what is to be expressed and expression, and free from what is to be known and knower.

original: lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul gyi bar las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul gyi bar las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Devaputra, ultimate truth is endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, up to and including the object of omniscient wisdom.

original: ji ltar don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes brjod pa ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes brjod pa ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not as it is said to be, “ultimate truth.”

original: chos thams cad ni brdzun te slu ba'i chos so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni brdzun te slu ba'i chos so //
translated: All phenomena are false and deceptive phenomena.

original: lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa ni bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa ni bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Devaputra, ultimate truth cannot be taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis ston pa dang / ci ston pa dang / gang la ston pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni don dam par rab tu ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis ston pa dang / ci ston pa dang / gang la ston pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni don dam par rab tu ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The phenomena of the teacher, the teaching, and the audience are all ultimately unarisen.

original: rab tu ma skyes pa'i chos rnams kyis ni rab tu ma skyes pa'i chos rnams bshad par mi nus so zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rab tu ma skyes pa'i chos rnams kyis ni rab tu ma skyes pa'i chos rnams bshad par mi nus so zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Unarisen phenomena cannot teach unarisen phenomena.”

original: de'i phyir de kho na nyid la de'i yul can dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na nyid la de'i yul can dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang /
translated: Therefore, in reality, the subject and object of that are not possible, such as: entity and non-entity, own-nature and other-nature, truth and untruth, eternalism and nihilism, eternal and non-eternal,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang / stong ba dang mi stong pa dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dang / gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dag srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang / stong ba dang mi stong pa dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dang / gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dag srid pa ma yin te /
translated: happiness and suffering, pure and impure, self and selflessness, empty and non-empty, characteristic and characterized, sameness and difference, arising and ceasing, and so on.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their own nature is not observed.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na de kho na nyid bsam pa la 'phags pa rnams kho na tshad ma yin gyi 'phags pa ma yin pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na de kho na nyid bsam pa la 'phags pa rnams kho na tshad ma yin gyi 'phags pa ma yin pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, only the noble ones are valid with regard to the contemplation of reality, not the non-noble ones.

original: ci ste 'jig rten gyi gnod pa brjod par 'dod pas de kho na nyid rnam par dpyod pa la 'jig rten gyi mthong ba yang tshad ma nyid du khas len na de lta yin dang / gal te 'jig rten tshad ma yin na ni //
analyzed: ci ste 'jig rten gyi gnod pa brjod par 'dod pas de kho na nyid rnam par dpyod pa la 'jig rten gyi mthong ba yang tshad ma nyid du khas len na de lta yin dang / gal te 'jig rten tshad ma yin na ni //
translated: But if you accept that the world’s perspective is valid in the analysis of reality, then the world’s perspective would see reality.

original: 'jig rten de nyid mthong bas 'phags gzhan gyis //
analyzed: 'jig rten de nyid mthong bas 'phags gzhan gyis //
translated: If the world were valid cognition,

original: ci dgos 'phags pa'i lam gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: ci dgos 'phags pa'i lam gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: then what need would there be for the āryas?

original: blun po tshad mar rigs pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: blun po tshad mar rigs pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not tenable that fools are valid cognition.

original: 'jig rten tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa yin pa dang / de nyid de kho na nyid mthong ba yin pa'i @256b phyir ma rig pa spangs pa yin par khas blang bar bya dgos na /
analyzed: 'jig rten tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa yin pa dang / de nyid de kho na nyid mthong ba yin pa'i @256b phyir ma rig pa spangs pa yin par khas blang bar bya dgos na /
translated: If you accept that the world is valid cognition, then you must accept that the world sees reality and that the world has abandoned ignorance.

original: gang gi phyir blun po ni tshad mar rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir blun po ni tshad mar rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not tenable that fools are valid cognition.

original: gang la gang gi yul can gyi mi shes pa yod pa de ni de la tshad ma nyid ma yin par mthong ste /
analyzed: gang la gang gi yul can gyi mi shes pa yod pa de ni de la tshad ma nyid ma yin par mthong ste /
translated: We see that if someone has ignorance with respect to something, then he is not a valid cognition with respect to that thing.

original: dper na nor bu rin po che la sogs pa brtags pa la de mi shes pa rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nor bu rin po che la sogs pa brtags pa la de mi shes pa rnams lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like those who do not know how to examine a precious jewel.

original: mig la sogs pa dag kho nas de kho na nyid nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag kho nas de kho na nyid nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Because reality is ascertained by the eye and so forth,

original: 'phags pa'i lam khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to comprehend the noble path,

original: tshul khrims dang / thos ba dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i bsgrim pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin par yang 'gyur ba zhig na de ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / thos ba dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i bsgrim pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin par yang 'gyur ba zhig na de ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: the effort of morality, listening, reflection, and meditation and so on would be fruitless, but that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir / rnam kun 'jig rten tshad min de yi phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam kun 'jig rten tshad min de yi phyir //
translated: Therefore: In every way the world is not valid with regard to that,

original: de nyid skabs su 'jig rten gnod pa med //
analyzed: de nyid skabs su 'jig rten gnod pa med //
translated: and therefore it is not undermined in this context.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul 'di las na de kho na nyid kyi skabs su 'jig rten rnam pa thams cad du tshad ma ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul 'di las na de kho na nyid kyi skabs su 'jig rten rnam pa thams cad du tshad ma ma yin zhing /
translated: Because of the method explained above, the world is not valid in every way with regard to reality.

original: de kho na nyid kyi skabs su 'jig rten gyis gnod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi skabs su 'jig rten gyis gnod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And the world does not undermine reality.

original: 'o na ci ltar 'jig rten gyis gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar 'jig rten gyis gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well, how is it undermined by the world?

original: bshad pa / 'jig rten don ni 'jig rten grags nyid kyis //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'jig rten don ni 'jig rten grags nyid kyis //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: The worldly meaning is refuted by the world itself.

original: gal te sel na 'jig rten kyis gnod 'gyur //🔽dper na kha cig gis nga'i rdzas phrogs so zhes smras pa dang / cig shos kyis de la brgal zhing brtags pa /
analyzed: gal te sel na 'jig rten kyis gnod 'gyur // dper na kha cig gis nga'i rdzas phrogs so zhes smras pa dang / cig shos kyis de la brgal zhing brtags pa /
translated: If you refute it, you are undermined by the world.

original: rdzas de ci zhig yin /
analyzed: rdzas de ci zhig yin /
translated: For example, suppose someone says, “Someone stole my property,” and another person challenges him, asking, “What is this property?”

original: des bum pa'o zhes smras pa la /
analyzed: des bum pa'o zhes smras pa la /
translated: He replies, “It is a pot.”

original: bum pa ni rdzas ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa ni rdzas ma yin te /
