translated: The other person says, “A pot is not a property.🔽Because it is an object of comprehension, it is like a pot in a dream.”

original: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi bum pa bzhin no zhes de des sun 'byin par byed pa de lta bu la sogs pa'i yul la 'jig rten pa'i don 'jig rten pa'i grags pa nyid kyis sel bar byed pa la 'jig rten gyis gnod par 'gyur gyi
analyzed: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi bum pa bzhin no zhes de des sun 'byin par byed pa de lta bu la sogs pa'i yul la 'jig rten pa'i don 'jig rten pa'i grags pa nyid kyis sel bar byed pa la 'jig rten gyis gnod par 'gyur gyi
translated: In this way, the first person refutes the second person. In this kind of context, the worldly meaning is refuted by the world itself.

original: / gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i gzigs pa la gnas te /
analyzed: / gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i gzigs pa la gnas te /
translated: But when one abides in the perspective of the āryas,

original: skye bo mkhas pa tshad mar byed pa de'i tshe ni 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye bo mkhas pa tshad mar byed pa de'i tshe ni 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then the world does not undermine the refutation.

original: mkhas pas phyogs 'dis gzhan yang dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas phyogs 'dis gzhan yang dpyad par bya'o //
translated: The wise should analyze other topics in the same way.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi grags pas gzhan las skye ba khas blangs nas kyang 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gyi grags pas gzhan las skye ba khas blangs nas kyang 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yongs su spangs te /
translated: Thus, having accepted arising from other in terms of what is renowned in the world, one may completely avoid being harmed by worldly people.

original: da ni 'jig rten la yang gzhan las skye ba yod pa ma yin pas de'i lta ba la gnas nas kyang gzhan las skyes pa dgag par 'dod pa la 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad @257a * //
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten la yang gzhan las skye ba yod pa ma yin pas de'i lta ba la gnas nas kyang gzhan las skyes pa dgag par 'dod pa la 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad @257a * //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that since arising from other does not exist even in the world, one who abides in the worldly perspective and wishes to refute arising from other is not harmed by worldly people, the text says:

original: pa ; gang phyir 'jig rten sa bon tsam btab nas //
analyzed: pa ; gang phyir 'jig rten sa bon tsam btab nas //
translated: Because, having merely planted the seed,

original: bdag gis bu 'di bskyed ces smra byed cing //
analyzed: bdag gis bu 'di bskyed ces smra byed cing //
translated: the world says, “I produced this son,”

original: shing yang btsugs so snyam du rtogs des na //
analyzed: shing yang btsugs so snyam du rtogs des na //
translated: and thinks, “I planted this tree,”

original: gzhan las skye ba 'jig rten las kyang med //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba 'jig rten las kyang med //
translated: arising from other does not exist even in the world.

original: pho'i dbang pos mngon par gsal bar byas pa 'ga' zhig nye bar ston pa na bu 'di bdag gis bskyed do zhes smra bar byed do //
analyzed: pho'i dbang pos mngon par gsal bar byas pa 'ga' zhig nye bar ston pa na bu 'di bdag gis bskyed do zhes smra bar byed do //
translated: When a man who has fathered a son points to him, he says, “I produced this son.”

original: 'di rnams de lta bu zhig rang gi lus las bton nas de'i ma'i khong du 'dzud pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams de lta bu zhig rang gi lus las bton nas de'i ma'i khong du 'dzud pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that these are extracted from one’s own body and inserted into the womb of the mother.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de'i sa bon du gyur pa mi gtsang ba tsam zhig go //
analyzed: de'i sa bon du gyur pa mi gtsang ba tsam zhig go //
translated: It is merely the impure seed that becomes the cause of that.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de'i rgyu blugs nas rang gi bu gtong bar byed pa de'i phyir sa bon dang bu gnyis gzhan nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar 'jig rten du gsal bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de'i rgyu blugs nas rang gi bu gtong bar byed pa de'i phyir sa bon dang bu gnyis gzhan nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar 'jig rten du gsal bar nges pa yin no //
translated: Since the cause is inserted into that, the mother gives birth to her own child. Therefore, the seed and the child are not different. Thus, it is clearly ascertained in the world.

original: gzhan nyid yin na ni gang zag gzhan ltar de yang nye bar ston par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na ni gang zag gzhan ltar de yang nye bar ston par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were different, then like another person, it would not be revealed.

original: de bzhin du sa bon dang ljon shing dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bon dang ljon shing dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the seed and the tree.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul la rten cing 'brel par 'byung brtag pa dang chad pa med par grub pa'i sgo nas yon tan bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul la rten cing 'brel par 'byung brtag pa dang chad pa med par grub pa'i sgo nas yon tan bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, in this way, in dependence on the method explained above, in order to demonstrate the qualities of dependent origination and the absence of annihilation, it is said:

original: gang phyir myu gu sa bon las gzhan min //
analyzed: gang phyir myu gu sa bon las gzhan min //
translated: Because the sprout is not different from the seed,

original: de phyir myug tshe sa bon zhig pa med //
analyzed: de phyir myug tshe sa bon zhig pa med //
translated: Therefore, when the sprout is present, the seed does not cease.

original: gang phyir gcig nyid yod min de phyir yang //
analyzed: gang phyir gcig nyid yod min de phyir yang //
translated: Since they are not the same,

original: myug tshe sa bon yod ces brjod mi bya //
analyzed: myug tshe sa bon yod ces brjod mi bya //
translated: one cannot say that the seed exists when the sprout is present.

original: gal te myu gu sa bon las gzhan nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te myu gu sa bon las gzhan nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the sprout were different from the seed,

original: the tshom med par myu gu yod bzhin du yang sa bon rgyun chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: the tshom med par myu gu yod bzhin du yang sa bon rgyun chad par 'gyur te /
translated: then, without a doubt, the seed would be severed when the sprout is present.

original: gang gi phyir ba men yod pas ba lang shi bar gyur kyang rgyun ma chad pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ba men yod pas ba lang shi bar gyur kyang rgyun ma chad pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Because when a cow is present, the ox does not die, and the continuum is not severed.

original: so so'i skye bo yod pas 'phags pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo yod pas 'phags pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And because ordinary beings are present, the noble ones do not attain nirvana.

original: gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid ltar sa bon chad par ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid ltar sa bon chad par ma yin te /
translated: But because they are not different, the seed is not severed, just like the sprout’s own nature.

original: de ltar na chad pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chad pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the error of nihilism is avoided.

original: gcig nyid med pas sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu ma yin pas sa bon mi 'jig la bkag pa'i phyir rtag pa yang bkag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid med pas sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu ma yin pas sa bon mi 'jig la bkag pa'i phyir rtag pa yang bkag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are not the same, the seed itself is not the sprout. Therefore, the seed does not perish. Since it is refuted, the error of eternalism is also avoided.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sa bon yod na myu gu ji bzhin te //
analyzed: sa bon yod na myu gu ji bzhin te //
translated: Just as the sprout arises from the seed,

original: sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
analyzed: sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
translated: The seed is not the sprout.

original: de las gzhan min de yang ma yin te //
analyzed: de las gzhan min de yang ma yin te //
translated: It is not different from it, nor is it just that.

original: de ltar rtag min chad min chos nyid do //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtag min chad min chos nyid do // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: sa bon yod na zhes bya ba ni sa bon yod par 'gyur ba @257b na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon yod na zhes bya ba ni sa bon yod par 'gyur ba @257b na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “if the seed exists” is “if the seed were to exist.”

original: sa bon gyi rgyu can myu gu yang 'byung ba ni sa bon las gzhan nyid du mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon gyi rgyu can myu gu yang 'byung ba ni sa bon las gzhan nyid du mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: The sprout that arises from the seed is not suitable as different from the seed.

original: gsungs pa / sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
analyzed: gsungs pa / sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
translated: The root text says, “The seed is not the sprout.”🔽Why is the seed not the sprout?🔽The root text says, “It is not different from it, nor is it just that.”

original: yang ci'i phyir sa bon de nyid myu gu der mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir sa bon de nyid myu gu der mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not suitable for the seed to be different from the sprout?

original: de'i phyir / de las gzhan min de yang ma yin te //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de las gzhan min de yang ma yin te //
translated: The root text says, “It is not different from it.”🔽Why is it not suitable for the seed to be the same as the sprout?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽gang gi phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid gnyi ga'i phyogs mi srid pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so // gang gi phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid gnyi ga'i phyogs mi srid pa de'i phyir /
translated: The root text says, “Nor is it just that.”🔽Since it is not possible for the seed to be the same as or different from the sprout,

original: de las gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid mi rigs so //
analyzed: de las gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid mi rigs so //
translated: it is not tenable for the seed to be either different from or the same as the sprout.

original: de ltar phyogs gnyis char yang bkag pa na rtag pa dang chad pa med pa'i chos nyid du yongs su gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs gnyis char yang bkag pa na rtag pa dang chad pa med pa'i chos nyid du yongs su gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when both sides are refuted, the reality free from eternalism and nihilism is fully revealed.

original: 'dir don gyi de kho na nyid ni sa bon dang myu gu gnyis la rang bzhin 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni //
analyzed: 'dir don gyi de kho na nyid ni sa bon dang myu gu gnyis la rang bzhin 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni //
translated: Here, the reality of the matter is this: If the seed and sprout had any intrinsic reality,

original: de gnyis gcig pa'am gzhan pa nyid du'ang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de gnyis gcig pa'am gzhan pa nyid du'ang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: they would be either the same or different.

original: gang gi phyir tshe de dag la rang bzhin nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rmi lam du dmigs pa'i sa bon dang myu gu dag ltar gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshe de dag la rang bzhin nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rmi lam du dmigs pa'i sa bon dang myu gu dag ltar gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: But since they do not have intrinsic reality, how could they be the same or different, like the seed and sprout observed in a dream? This is what should be understood.

original: don 'di nyid /
analyzed: don 'di nyid /
translated: This very point is explained in the following:

original: 'du byed rnams ni ma rig rkyen can te //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni ma rig rkyen can te //
translated: Conditioned by ignorance are volitions,

original: 'du byed de dag de nyid du yod min //
analyzed: 'du byed de dag de nyid du yod min //
translated: But those volitions do not exist in ignorance.

original: 'du byed ma rig pa gnyis stong pa ste //
analyzed: 'du byed ma rig pa gnyis stong pa ste //
translated: Both ignorance and volitions are empty,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni g-yo ba dang bral ba'o //🔽zhes bya bas bshad pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni g-yo ba dang bral ba'o //🔽zhes bya bas bshad pa /
translated: And by nature devoid of movement.

original: bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: The Treatise says:

original: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on something

original: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
analyzed: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
translated: Is not identical to that thing,

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin pa //🔽de phyir rtag min chad pa'ang min //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin pa // de phyir rtag min chad pa'ang min //
translated: Nor is it different from it.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin gyis 'ga' yang skye ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin gyis 'ga' yang skye ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: Thus, one should accept without doubt that nothing whatsoever arises intrinsically.

original: de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid brten gyur na //
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid brten gyur na //
translated: If things existed through their own characteristics,

original: de la skur pas dngos po 'jig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la skur pas dngos po 'jig pa'i phyir //
translated: Since the denial of them would destroy things,

original: stong nyid dngos po 'jig pa'i rgyur 'gyur na //
analyzed: stong nyid dngos po 'jig pa'i rgyur 'gyur na //
translated: Emptiness would be the cause of the destruction of things.

original: de ni rigs min de phyir dngos yod min //
analyzed: de ni rigs min de phyir dngos yod min //
translated: But that is illogical, so things do not exist.

original: gal te gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyang rang gi mtshan nyid de rang gi ngo bo dang rang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen dag gis bskyed na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyang rang gi mtshan nyid de rang gi ngo bo dang rang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen dag gis bskyed na ni /
translated: If such things as form and feeling existed through their own characteristics—that is, through their own natures and essences—and were produced by causes and conditions,

original: de gang gi tshe na rnal 'byor pa 'dis dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong zhing chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs pa de'i tshe nges par ji ltar skyes pa'i rang bzhin la skur ba btab bas stong pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur te /🔽de'i phyir ji ltar tho @258a * //
analyzed: de gang gi tshe na rnal 'byor pa 'dis dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong zhing chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs pa de'i tshe nges par ji ltar skyes pa'i rang bzhin la skur ba btab bas stong pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur te / de'i phyir ji ltar tho @258a * //
translated: When this yogi sees that things are empty of intrinsic reality and realizes that all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic reality, then he will definitely realize emptiness by deprecating intrinsic reality as it has arisen.

original: ba la sogs pa dag bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa dag bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as a hammer and so on is the cause of the destruction of a pot and so on,🔽emptiness would be the cause of the deprecation of the intrinsic reality of things.

original: stong pa nyid kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin la skur pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba zhig na de ni rung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin la skur pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba zhig na de ni rung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni thams cad kyi tshe skye bar khas blang bar mi bya'o //🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni thams cad kyi tshe skye bar khas blang bar mi bya'o // ji skad du /
translated: Therefore, you should not accept that the intrinsic reality of things arises at all times.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the Heap of Jewels Sutra:

original: 'od srungs gzhan yang dbu ma'i lam chos rnams la yang dag par so sor rtog pa ni /
analyzed: 'od srungs gzhan yang dbu ma'i lam chos rnams la yang dag par so sor rtog pa ni /
translated: Kāśyapa, moreover, the middle way of correct discernment of phenomena is this:

original: gang stong pa nyid kyis chos rnams stong par mi byed de /
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid kyis chos rnams stong par mi byed de /
translated: emptiness does not make phenomena empty.🔽Phenomena themselves are empty.

original: chos rnams nyid stong pa dang / gang mtshan ma med pas chos rnams mtshan ma med par mi byed de /
analyzed: chos rnams nyid stong pa dang / gang mtshan ma med pas chos rnams mtshan ma med par mi byed de /
translated: Signlessness does not make phenomena signless.🔽Phenomena themselves are signless.

original: chos rnams nyid mtshan ma med pa dang / gang smon pa med pas chos rnams smon pa med par mi byed de /
analyzed: chos rnams nyid mtshan ma med pa dang / gang smon pa med pas chos rnams smon pa med par mi byed de /
translated: Wishlessness does not make phenomena wishless.🔽Phenomena themselves are wishless.🔽Non-conditioning does not make phenomena unconditioned.

original: chos rnams nyid smon pa med pa dang / gang mngon par 'du bya ba med pas chos rnams mngon bar 'du byed pa med par mi byed de /
analyzed: chos rnams nyid smon pa med pa dang / gang mngon par 'du bya ba med pas chos rnams mngon bar 'du byed pa med par mi byed de /
translated: Phenomena themselves are unconditioned.

original: chos rnams nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / gang ma skyes pas chos rnams skyes pa nyid du mi byed de /
analyzed: chos rnams nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / gang ma skyes pas chos rnams skyes pa nyid du mi byed de /
translated: Non-arising does not make phenomena non-arisen.🔽Phenomena themselves are non-arisen.

original: chos rnams nyid ma skyes pa dang / gang ma byung bas chos rnams ma byung bar mi byed de /
analyzed: chos rnams nyid ma skyes pa dang / gang ma byung bas chos rnams ma byung bar mi byed de /
translated: Non-occurrence does not make phenomena non-occurred.

original: chos rnams nyid ma byung ba dang zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos rnams nyid ma byung ba dang zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And phenomena themselves do not arise.

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo khas blangs nas de la brten pa'i stong pa nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ltar de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par sems pa
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo khas blangs nas de la brten pa'i stong pa nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ltar de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par sems pa
translated: Someone might accept the dependent nature and think that the emptiness that is based on it, which is the emptiness of the apprehended and apprehender, is not to be described as being the same or different, like impermanence and so on.

original: de'i ltar na /
analyzed: de'i ltar na /
translated: In that case,

original: stong pa nyid kho nas chos thams cad stong pa yin gyi /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kho nas chos thams cad stong pa yin gyi /
translated: it would follow that emptiness alone is empty of all phenomena,

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but they are not empty of their own nature.

original: bzhi brgya pa las /
analyzed: bzhi brgya pa las /
translated: The Catuhﬁ śataka says:

original: stong min stong ldan mthong min te //🔽myang 'das bdag gir gyur cig ces //
analyzed: stong min stong ldan mthong min te // myang 'das bdag gir gyur cig ces //
translated: The nonempty does not see the empty,

original: log ltas mya ngan mi 'da' bar //
analyzed: log ltas mya ngan mi 'da' bar //
translated: And the empty does not see the nonempty.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs //🔽zhes bshad la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs // zhes bshad la /
translated: The Tathāgatas have said🔽That one does not attain nirvana through wrong views.

original: bstan bcos las kyang /🔽stong nyid lta ba thams cad ni //
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang / stong nyid lta ba thams cad ni //
translated: And the treatise says:🔽The Victor has said that all views of emptiness

original: nges par 'byin par rgyal bas gsungs //
analyzed: nges par 'byin par rgyal bas gsungs //
translated: Are means of attaining nirvana.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
translated: Those who view emptiness

original: de dag sgrub tu med par gsungs //🔽zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: de dag sgrub tu med par gsungs // zhes gsungs so /
translated: are said to be incapable of practice.

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: don dam par skye ba med pas bdag dang gzhan las skyes pa bdag la rag mod /
analyzed: don dam par skye ba med pas bdag dang gzhan las skyes pa bdag la rag mod /
translated: “Since ultimately there is no arising, it is certainly the case that things arise from self and other.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa @258b gang dag mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis dmigs pa de dag gi rang bzhin ni gdon mi za bar gzhan las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa @258b gang dag mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis dmigs pa de dag gi rang bzhin ni gdon mi za bar gzhan las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But the nature of those things that are perceived by direct perception and inference, such as form and feeling, must arise from other.

original: ci ste de ltar mi 'dod na ni bden pa gnyis ci ste brjod de /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar mi 'dod na ni bden pa gnyis ci ste brjod de /
translated: If you do not accept this, then why do you speak of two truths?

original: bden pa gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be only one truth.

original: de'i phyir gzhan las skye ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan las skye ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, there is no arising from other.”

original: 'di la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di bden mod kyi don dam par na bden pa gnyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di bden mod kyi don dam par na bden pa gnyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is true, but ultimately there are not two truths.

original: dge slong dag bden pa dam pa 'di ni gcig ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag bden pa dam pa 'di ni gcig ste /
translated: “Monks, this is the ultimate truth, which is one,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: mi slu ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: nirvana, which has the character of being undeceiving.”

original: 'du byed thams cad ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “All compounded things are false and deceptive phenomena.”

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug par bya ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug par bya ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, whatever is conventional truth is a method for entering ultimate truth.

original: bdag dang gzhan dag las skye ba ma dpyad par 'jig rten pa'i lugs kyis khas len par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag las skye ba ma dpyad par 'jig rten pa'i lugs kyis khas len par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the nonanalytical perspective of the world, we accept arising from self and arising from other.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang phyir dngos po 'di dag rnam dpyad na //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po 'di dag rnam dpyad na //
translated: When things are analyzed,

original: de nyid bdag can dngos las tshu rol du //🔽gnas rnyed ma yin de phyir 'jig rten gyi //
analyzed: de nyid bdag can dngos las tshu rol du // gnas rnyed ma yin de phyir 'jig rten gyi //
translated: Nothing is found to exist from its own side.🔽Therefore, do not analyze

original: tha snyad bden la rnam par dpyad mi bya //🔽'di ltar gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni ci bdag las skye ba zhig gam /
analyzed: tha snyad bden la rnam par dpyad mi bya // 'di ltar gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni ci bdag las skye ba zhig gam /
translated: The conventional truth of the world.🔽When things such as form and feeling are analyzed,🔽Is it the case that they arise from themselves?

original: cig gzhan las skye ba zhig ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnam par dpyad pa na /
analyzed: cig gzhan las skye ba zhig ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnam par dpyad pa na /
translated: Or do they arise from something else?

original: don dam par ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i phyir rang bzhin can las tshu rol te gzhan du gyur ba'i cha skye ba la sogs pa can la gnas ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i phyir rang bzhin can las tshu rol te gzhan du gyur ba'i cha skye ba la sogs pa can la gnas ba ma yin te /
translated: Because ultimately they are not produced and not stopped, they do not abide in a part that is other than the self, that is, in a part that is other than that which has intrinsic nature, and that has production, etc.

original: de'i phyir bdag dang gzhan las zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par dpyod pa 'jug pa med par byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang gzhan las zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par dpyod pa 'jug pa med par byas te /
translated: Therefore, one should not engage in analysis such as “from self and other,” etc.

original: 'jig rten pas yongs su mthong ba 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig gzhan la rag las pa'i 'jug pa'i sgo nas khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas yongs su mthong ba 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig gzhan la rag las pa'i 'jug pa'i sgo nas khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: One should accept only this much, “If this exists, that arises,” in terms of the engagement that is dependent on other, which is seen by the world.

original: 'phags pa ltas /🔽ji ltar kla klo skad gzhan gyis //
analyzed: 'phags pa ltas / ji ltar kla klo skad gzhan gyis //
translated: As the Ārya has said,

original: gzung bar mi nus de bzhin du //🔽'jig rten pa yi ma rtogs par //
analyzed: gzung bar mi nus de bzhin du // 'jig rten pa yi ma rtogs par //
translated: Just as a barbarian cannot be addressed in a language other than his own,

original: 'jig rten gzung bar nus ma yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzung bar nus ma yin //
translated: so the world cannot be addressed except in terms of what is familiar to it.

original: zhes ji skad du bshad pa lta bu'o //🔽bstan bcos las kyang //🔽tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
analyzed: zhes ji skad du bshad pa lta bu'o // bstan bcos las kyang // tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
translated: As the treatise says,🔽Without relying on the conventional,

original: dam pa'i don ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dam pa'i don ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: The ultimate is not taught.

original: dam pa'i don ni ma rtogs bar //
analyzed: dam pa'i don ni ma rtogs bar //
translated: Without realizing the ultimate,

original: mya ngan 'das pa thob mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa thob mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: one will not attain nirvāṇa.

original: rnam par dpyad pa byas na ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad nyams par @259a * //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa byas na ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad nyams par @259a * //
translated: If one engages in analysis, then mundane conventions will be undermined.

original: 'gyur te / ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: 'gyur te / ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As it says in a sūtra:

original: dper na shing dang rgyud la brten byas la //
analyzed: dper na shing dang rgyud la brten byas la //
translated: For example, in dependence on a tree and a vine,

original: lag pa rtsol ba byas pa gsum tshogs na //
analyzed: lag pa rtsol ba byas pa gsum tshogs na //
translated: and the coming together of three things—

original: sgrog byed pi wang gling bu la sogs las //
analyzed: sgrog byed pi wang gling bu la sogs las //
translated: the effort of the hands, and so on—

original: de dag las skyes sgra yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag las skyes sgra yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: the sound of a flute will emerge.

original: de nas mkhas pa la las brtag byas te //
analyzed: de nas mkhas pa la las brtag byas te //
translated: Then, some wise person will investigate:

original: de ni gang nas 'ongs la gar song zhes //
analyzed: de ni gang nas 'ongs la gar song zhes //
translated: “Where did it come from? Where did it go?”

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kun du brtag byas na //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kun du brtag byas na //
translated: Having investigated in all directions and in between,

original: sgra yi 'ong ba 'am 'gro ba rnyed mi 'gyur //🔽de ltar rgyu dag dang ni rkyen dag las //
analyzed: sgra yi 'ong ba 'am 'gro ba rnyed mi 'gyur // de ltar rgyu dag dang ni rkyen dag las //
translated: the coming or going of the sound will not be found.

original: 'du byed gyur ba thams cad 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: 'du byed gyur ba thams cad 'byung ba ste //
translated: Thus, all conditioned things arise from causes and conditions.

original: yang dag mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa yis ni //
analyzed: yang dag mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa yis ni //
translated: The yogi who sees reality

original: 'du byed stong pa g-yo ba med par mthong //
analyzed: 'du byed stong pa g-yo ba med par mthong //
translated: One sees compounded things as empty, without movement.

original: phung po dag dang skye mched khams rnams ni //
analyzed: phung po dag dang skye mched khams rnams ni //
translated: The aggregates, the sense-spheres, and the elements

original: nang yang stong la phyi rol stong pa ste //
analyzed: nang yang stong la phyi rol stong pa ste //
translated: Are empty internally and empty externally.

original: sems can bdag gis stong zhing gnas med la //
analyzed: sems can bdag gis stong zhing gnas med la //
translated: Beings are empty of self and empty of location.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: The characteristics of phenomena are the nature of space.

original: ces rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽ci ste yang de ltar dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bdog pa thams cad kun nas gcod pa na bred sha thon pa tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa 'di gang zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyur gyur pa
analyzed: ces rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o // ci ste yang de ltar dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bdog pa thams cad kun nas gcod pa na bred sha thon pa tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa 'di gang zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyur gyur pa
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: rdzas kyi bdag nyid 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes smra na /
analyzed: rdzas kyi bdag nyid 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes smra na /
translated: But if one is frightened by the complete cutting off of all possessions due to such an attachment to entities, and if one claims that some substance must be produced that would be the cause of affliction and purification,

original: de lta na yang de skad du smra ba la tshig tsam zhig lhag ma lus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang de skad du smra ba la tshig tsam zhig lhag ma lus par 'gyur ro //
translated: then even in that case, only words would remain for such a claim.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid skabs su rigs pa gang zhig gis //
analyzed: de nyid skabs su rigs pa gang zhig gis //
translated: In the context of reality, by what reasoning

original: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba rigs min pa'i //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba rigs min pa'i //
translated: Since arising from self and from other are illogical,

original: rigs des tha snyad du yang rigs min pas //
analyzed: rigs des tha snyad du yang rigs min pas //
translated: By that logic, arising is illogical even conventionally.

original: khyod kyi skye ba gang gis yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod kyi skye ba gang gis yin par 'gyur //
translated: So by what means will your things arise?

original: ji ltar don dam pa'i skabs su ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas bdag dang gzhan las skye ba mi rung ba de bzhin du tha snyad du yang /
analyzed: ji ltar don dam pa'i skabs su ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas bdag dang gzhan las skye ba mi rung ba de bzhin du tha snyad du yang /
translated: Just as arising from self and from other are illogical in the context of the ultimate, as has been explained, by that same logic arising is illogical even conventionally.

original: de nyid kyis skye bar mi rigs pas khyod kyi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba gang gis 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid kyis skye bar mi rigs pas khyod kyi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba gang gis 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: So by what means will your things arise?

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba ni bden pa gnyis char du yang yod pa ma yin no zhes mi 'dod pa zhin du yang gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba ni bden pa gnyis char du yang yod pa ma yin no zhes mi 'dod pa zhin du yang gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even though you do not assert that arising by virtue of intrinsic characteristic exists in either of the two truths, you still must accept it without a doubt.

original: gang dag bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na bkag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang dag bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na bkag pa yin gyi /
translated: Those who say “not from self” and so on refute only the intrinsic existence of things as it is conceived by the master Nāgārjuna.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa de dag gi 'dod pa 'di @259b yang gtan tshigs med par mi grub pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa de dag gi 'dod pa 'di @259b yang gtan tshigs med par mi grub pas /
translated: But this assertion of theirs is not established without a reason.

original: de skad du smra ba de dag ni brgal zhing brtag par bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de skad du smra ba de dag ni brgal zhing brtag par bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are only to be refuted and examined.

original: 'o na ni gal te bden pa gnyis char du yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ci ltar na de dag gi rang gi ngo bo 'jig rten du dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni gal te bden pa gnyis char du yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ci ltar na de dag gi rang gi ngo bo 'jig rten du dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If arising from self does not exist in either of the two truths, how can their own nature be observed in the world?

original: bshad pa ; dngos po stong pa gzugs brnyan la sogs pa //
analyzed: bshad pa ; dngos po stong pa gzugs brnyan la sogs pa //
translated: Things that are empty, such as reflections,

original: tshogs la ltos rnams ma grags pa yang min //🔽ji ltar der ni gzugs brnyan sogs stong las //
analyzed: tshogs la ltos rnams ma grags pa yang min // ji ltar der ni gzugs brnyan sogs stong las //
translated: are not renowned as not relying on collections.

original: shes pa de yi rnam par skye 'gyur ltar //
analyzed: shes pa de yi rnam par skye 'gyur ltar //
translated: Just as a reflection arises from a reflection and so on,🔽though empty,

original: de bzhin dngos po thams cad stong na yang //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos po thams cad stong na yang //
translated: in the same way, though all things are empty,

original: stong nyid dag las rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: stong nyid dag las rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
translated: they arise from emptiness.

original: dngos po thams cad ni rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa med par gnas pa yin la /🔽gzugs brnyan rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa yang shes bzhin du mkhas pa su zhig gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu las tha dad pa med par gnas pa rnams yod pa tsam zhig tu dmigs pas rang bzhin
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa med par gnas pa yin la / gzugs brnyan rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa yang shes bzhin du mkhas pa su zhig gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu las tha dad pa med par gnas pa rnams yod pa tsam zhig tu dmigs pas rang bzhin
translated: All things are such that cause and effect are not different.

original: dang bcas par nges par byed /
analyzed: dang bcas par nges par byed /
translated: What wise person, understanding the presentation of cause and effect in the case of a reflection, which is essenceless, would observe that form, feeling, etc., which are not different from cause and effect, exist merely, and would ascertain that they have an essence?

original: de'i phyir yod par dmigs kyang rang bzhin gyis skye ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod par dmigs kyang rang bzhin gyis skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, although they are observed to exist, they do not arise essentially.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: me long shin tu yongs dag la //
analyzed: me long shin tu yongs dag la //
translated: Just as in a clear mirror🔽An image appears

original: ji ltar rang bzhin med pa yi //🔽gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin med pa yi // gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du //
translated: Though it is essenceless,

original: ljon pa chos rnams shes par gyis //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ljon pa chos rnams shes par gyis // zhes gsungs so //
translated: So you should understand things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: bden pa gnyis su 'ang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis su 'ang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are essenceless in both truths,

original: de dag rtag pa ma yin chad pa'ang min //
analyzed: de dag rtag pa ma yin chad pa'ang min //
translated: They are neither permanent nor annihilated.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po rnams gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po rnams gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because things are empty of essence, like reflections,

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa gnyis char du yang rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir rtag pa dang chad pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa gnyis char du yang rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir rtag pa dang chad pa med pa nyid do //
translated: therefore, in both the ultimate and conventional truths, there is neither permanence nor annihilation, because there is no essence, no intrinsic reality.

original: ji skad du bstan bcos las /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan bcos las /
translated: As the treatise says:

original: gang zhig ngo bo nyid yod pa //
analyzed: gang zhig ngo bo nyid yod pa //
translated: That which has intrinsic reality

original: de ni med pa min pas rtag //
analyzed: de ni med pa min pas rtag //
translated: Is not nonexistent, and so is permanent.
